description:
Honestly, Garden Creamery must be my favorite ice cream place in SF! They put in a lot of effort into their ice cream making process and it shows. We were served by the owner herself and she let us try so many flavors. 

Garden Creamery has some unique flavors like salted plum,  pandan coconut, hojicha, and jasmine milk coffee, and those were just some of the dairy flavors! There's vegan and dairy-free ones which would appease my mom who's allergic to dairy #blessed #thankyougardencreamery. I personally loved the matcha and aube pandan as a huge matcha fan. 

TLDR flavors are diverse and great, prices are reasonable, bathroom is clean, service is friendly, and their long production process shows in the flavor.
author: Lizzie S.

description:
This is my absolute favorite place to get ice cream in SF! The ice cream itself is super creamy and smooth, plus the workers are very generous and patient when giving samples. 

The best part is their flavor selection: They always have such an array of Asian flavors! I think one time when I went they had around 4 different green tea flavors (!!!) along with various others like Hong Kong Milk Tea or Ube. Incredible!

Prices are around the same as other SF ice cream places (aka I can't believe I'm paying $4+ for a scoop of ice cream), but the scoops are pretty generous.

I stop by almost every time I'm in the area!
author: Melissa H.

description:
So my cousin recommended this place today and we took trip here to try out the chimney cones! and i gotta say this was AMAZING!!! Just the right texture: not too crunchy and not too soft. It didn't have too much sugar on it so that if you order a sweeter ice cream it wouldn't be sweetness overload it would be just right! Basically this cone was perfect if you want something new and different to try, but in general I'm not a fan of cones in general, but I would make the exception for this edible cone! So good!

As for ice cream, all the flavors I sampled were delicious! I tried their matcha flavor (delicious! not too strong or sweet), their roasted matcha (also delicious, like matcha but with a twist. I think I preferred the regular one better though), I also tried the thai tea (amazing! especially because they made it non dairy so that was great in itself.), the black sesame flavor was pretty good, and the mint was delicious as well and slightly tasted different then most at different ice cream places, but in a good way. I ended up going with classic mint just because at that moment I felt like getting that but I definitely would've ordered thai tea and matcha at another time with a chimney cone again :)

Customer service was great, and quick even though there was a line out the door. Its out the door because of how popular this place was and also because the floor space is kind of small- limited seating but enough for a least two big groups to sit in the back and a few more people by the window in the front.
author: Kelsey Y.

description:
Finally got to try this place out! 
My bf & I went here after having dinner at Foreign Cinema. Once we walked in, we were greeted by two super nice employees! Sampled some flavors, and went with the Matcha Gold & Japanese Milk Coffee. My boyfriend got the Ube & Matcha Gold. I loved all three flavors!!! Their Ube ice cream is probably the best I've ever had. The matcha had toffee pieces in it which was amazing. The Japanese milk coffee flavor was smooth and creamy. I love the quality of the ice cream! Seriously top notch ice cream in my book. Will definitely be coming back!!!
author: Alyssa C.

description:
There was a long line when I came around 3pm but it went pretty fast. My main reason for coming here was to try out their chimney cone, which is only available from 2-4pm I think. From a different location, I've tried one before yet Garden Creamery's cone pleasantly surprised me. It was really soft and fluffy with a hint of citrus. Super good. 

I chose the salted plum flavor for my single scoop and it was really good on it's own. Sweet and salty, but it didn't necessarily mesh well with the sugary chimney cone. It's a solid refreshing flavor and something different to try too. 

Overall I really enjoyed both. $8 isn't that bad considering how much you get and how much it fills you up. I just recommend getting a complementary ice cream flavor if ur getting a chimney cone.
author: Leslie S.

description:
The chimney cone is bomb!

I came to garden creamery on my most recent visit to SF and was more than satisfied. I had such a hard time picking a flavor because I sampled a few and they all tasted so good. I would've sampled every single flavor if it wasn't for the long line behind me because all of them actually sounded really good. Since it's in season, I ended up picking a pumpkin spice flavor and got it in a chimney cone. I'm drooling right now just thinking about how good it was. The only thing that bummed me out is that you can't get a split scoop/2 flavors with the chimney cone. I also wouldn't say that the staff was extra friendly, but they weren't rude either.

This place is gonna now be one of my recommendations for any of my friends visiting SF!
author: Megan Y.

description:
My other favorite ice cream place in SF!

Parking is tough lol meter parking is available... $5/per hour ughhh

Line moves quickly and there's so many flavors....you are allowed to sample everything too!

$4.50 per single scoop (2 flavors)

my fave: Matcha Gold, Thai Tea, Ube Pandan

eh flavors: Hojicha, Earl Grey, Japanese Milk Coffee 

$8 Chimney cone (cinnamon bread come with lemon zest) comes with 1 flavor but I just got it on the side ~ one and done, nice to try at least once, the bottom of the cone isn't enclosed so ice cream can easily leak out

Good luck with parking!
author: Yeanne L.

description: This is my favorite spot for ice cream in SF! My favorite flavor is the black sesame- so gooddd! The hojicha and other tea flavors are also delicious. Garden Creamery has a wide range of Asian flavors. The texture is very creamy and it's not overly sweet. I recently tried their pumpkin flavor and was pleasantly surprised! Definitely come here if you're visiting SF. Highly recommend.
author: Jessica Y.

description: 5 stars for the Ube Pandan! This flavor is amazing and they were able to capture both flavors perfectly! I also tried the matcha gold, which has a good matcha flavor with bits of toffee. If you like Asian flavored, you definitely have to try this ice cream spot!
author: Vy T.

description:
I've now moved away from SF, and I must say my biggest regret is not eating enough GC (*cries*).

This is THE best ice cream in SF.  In my mind, there is no doubt about it.  From their friendly employees (hi Jane!) to the intricate detail they place in uncommon pan-Asian flavors, I have never been upset to consistently swipe my credit card at this ice cream establishment.

I've tried (but not limited to):
-all their matcha (all sooooo freaking good; trust the combinations, trust the process)
-cookies and cream (which my friend has never ordered any other flavor than this)
-lilikoi guava (spelling might be off, but dang, that was smackin'!)
-genmaicha (ahh, they've put one of my favorite teas into an ice cream!)
-JAPANESE MILK COFFEE (just get it, you will not regret it heh)
-Earl Grey (named after my rabbit, and a solid choice)
-black sesame (so rich and creamy, it's like eating heaven)

I have a couple of dreams, one of which entails meeting the owners of GC one day :').  Truly, when anyone visits the Bay Area, I have either annoyingly raved about this ice cream establishment or have taken them here myself.  This is my number 1 recommendation! :D 

So much love to you, GC.  I'm now in NYC and am trying, so desperately, to find another ice cream place that compares to you.
author: Jana L.

description:
Ok I go to a lot of ice cream shops, this one by far is my FAVORITE in SF. I came here on a sunday at about 1pm and it was pretty empty (though I was told it's SUPER busy on Saturdays 2-4pm when they have their chimney cones). It's a super cute shop with a few tables and seating by the window. The service was great, she let me try as many flavors as I wanted and even suggested some! There are so many unique flavors- they have seasonal flavors (like ones based with fruit), a main selection, and few flavors that are on rotation every few days. 

I got a single size black sesame and mango sticky rice ($4.60... $4.50 for dairy, and $4.75 for non-dairy and I got one of each flavor) in a sugar cone (no extra cost, $1 more for a waffle cone). The black sesame is so good, with a strong flavor that's not overpowering. The mango sticky rice though was by far my favorite. It's dairy free, but you couldn't even tell!!! It was so creamy and weirdly reminded me EXACTLY of mango sticky rice, which is my FAVORITE dessert. Absolutely loved it. I don't know how the ice cream could be so creamy yet so light! 

I also tried the "Flavor King" Li hing- which is like sweet/salty plum- which reminded me of home (I'm from Hawaii and we put li hing mui on everything....I also found out the owners are from Hawaii). The matcha toffee was also good and the matcha had a strong matcha flavor. Thai tea tasted exactly how thai tea tastes- not watered down or anything! The Kalamansi lime was a new one they had on rotation which had a strong lime flavor- good but personally not my favorite. Strawberry fields was another good one that was very creamy and fresh. The Cardamom had the PERFECT balance of spices and I was so tempted to get a scoop of that one as well. My friend also got cookies and cream which she loved and is also a classic.

I will definitely be back to try more flavors (and maybe get a chimney cone!)
author: April L.

description:
It's funny because when I was on my way to Smitten I actually passed by this place and my friend asked if I wanted to go here instead, but I was like "WE MUST COMMIT TO OUR PLAN" and sadly missed out on an opportunity to try this..

Luckily, came back the next day with my friend to check it out. It's so adorable and has many unique Asian-influenced flavors. The workers were also very friendly and encouraged us to try as many flavors as we wanted (I was grateful that they didn't make me feel like a burden for trying things). It was incredibly difficult but I ended up choosing li hing plum and black sesame because both were WEIRDLY accurate to a childhood memory flavor in a way that I can't describe, especially the plum (and I've had black sesame ice cream before but I've never felt so ..viscerally connected to childhood in that way before? Okay I'm going to stop before this review gets too meta). The ice cream was superb - creamy, light, accurate to the flavors they claimed to be while not being too sweet or overwhelming. Crying because who knows when next I'll be in SF.
author: Shelley P.

description:
We sampled three flavors and they were amazing. Kalamansi Philippino lime creamsicle was my favorite. Really refreshing and the right amount of tartness. My second favorite was ube (purple yam) with coconut, rich, creamy, and indulgent. My third favorite was mango sticky rice (dairy free), great blend of sour and sweet, reminds me of my home country Thailand.

We came at 5PM on a Saturday and the line stated forming as we were leaving. Only 10 seats in the shop.
author: Norases V.

description:
Got a scoop of Japanese milk coffee and matcha oreo. The Japanese milk coffee was creamy and tasted more like milk than coffee. I took a chance with this flavor because I didn't try it before ordering it. I really liked the matcha oreo, it's a really good combination! The matcha wasn't too strong so it did not overpower the oreo bits. I would have preferred it to have a stronger matcha flavor. I tried the black sesame and really liked it, so I would definitely get a scoop of that next time.

This place has really unique flavors, so I would come back to try them!
author: Joey W.

description: The green tea ice cream with its toffee chips is the best green tea ice cream i've ever had. Great flavor taken up another notch by their genius work, the toffee chips are such a nice touch...
author: David N.

description:
Meticulous Effort Translates into Fantastic Results 

The first thing you should know about Garden Creamery is that they went through the effort to purchase their pasteurization machine from New York, and bothered to drive it all the way out to San Francisco.

The second thing you should know is that they have a unique pasteurization process for each one of their ice cream flavors, to maximize taste and texture. 

This level of precision and focus is uncommon among many ice cream shops I've been to. The level of effort that Garden Creamery goes into producing the best possible ice cream that they can reflects an incredible dedication that they have for their desserts. Furthermore, their reasonable prices and friendly atmosphere makes this the top ice cream shop in San Francisco for me. 

Having been disappointed repeatedly by places like Humphrey Slocombe or other popular chic ice cream places in the area, I'm happy to say that Garden Creamery blows them out of the water. Stop by here, I'm sure you won't be disappointed.
author: Samuel W.

description:
This review is ONLY for the chimney cone.

The chimney cone is only offered on Saturdays from 2-4PM. We arrived around 3:30PM and pleasantly surprised the line wasn't super long. It also moved pretty quickly.

I was very excited to try the chimney cone because I thought it was a churro cone. And this girl LOVES churros.

But it isn't a churro! It has a more bready texture and is more like cinnamon bun dough unraveled and then re-raveled into a cone, rolled in cinnamon sugar. It is served at room temperature. 

I honestly did not enjoy it all, regardless of my churro hopes and dreams. The bread on its own tasted sour/acidic. The cone was too thick and had too much breading.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Delicious ice cream and unique flavors. A must visit! Prices are pretty reasonable at $4.50 for two flavors.

I love their mango and sticky rice flavor, coconut and pandan.
author: Liz N.

description: Probably my new favorite ice cream shop in The City. I loved how unique the flavors were. I ended up getting a cone with the Japanese Milk Coffee and Matcha Gold (crunch?) - I don't remember the full name - and I loooooved it. The ice cream is so smooth and light and decadent. It's amazing. And worth the line!
author: Juliana P.

description:
We can never resist coming here whenever we get dinner in the area, no matter how full we are. 

This time I tried: 
* Hong Kong Milk Tea (Black Tea) - 4.5 stars
I must get this next time! Tasted legit like Milk Tea.

People in my group also got:
Strawberry Fields - 3.5 stars
Japanese Milk Coffee - 3.5 stars (I'm just not a big fan of coffee)
Thai Tea - 3.5 stars

I'm curious to try the Honey Dark Chocolate next time too!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
~Food~  
Thai Tea Non-Dairy Ice Cream: I don't usually get Thai Tea flavored things but this one was good. I've become more and more lactose intolerant so their Non-Dairy flavors were my savior. Unlike being stuck with sorbet and/or one flavor, their Non-Dairy selection (strawberry, thai tea, mango sticky rice, etc.) is just as interesting and almost as big as their Dairy flavors. 

~Price/Quality/Quantity~  
On the more bougie side but they have cool flavors and you can get 2 flavors with a single scoop!

~Atmosphere/Service~
Very nice and patient staff. There's a small amount of seating inside but it's mostly a buy and go type of shop. Don't get intimidated by the line outside as it moves relatively quickly!

~Bottom Line~
If you can't handle the lactose, this is still great for you.
author: Lily L.

description: I am always up for dessert :-), especially ice cream!  So when walking round this SF this weekend we came upon the garden creamery. This is my new favorite place, they have such great variety of ice cream and creative flavors. I ended up trying this gluten, vegan ice cream and omg it was amazing. The coconut one was the best I've ever had. Will definitely be back here soon. And the best past you can sample as many flavors as you like.
author: Iryna P.

description:
BEST. ICE CREAM. EVER. 

I just recently realized that I don't like general ice cream anymore-- its usually too sweet and one dimensional. After 2 bites and I'm done. BUT NO. Not Garden Creamery! Their flavors.. they just sing! 

I've tried most of their flavors, the lovely people behind the counter are so friendly and don't judge you when you wanna try every flavor before you narrow down your choices either. Even their seemingly "normal" flavors like cookies & cream or strawberry are out of this world delicious. 

My favs so far are definitely ube pandan, mango sticky rice, strawberry, black sesame, and of course-- hojicha!
author: Maggie Y.

description:
I'm a Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous fan for life, but Garden Creamery would definitely be my second go-to spot for ice cream. The flavors are just so good and they're open later than most ice cream shops!

If you like Mitchell's, then you'll love the flavors they offer at Garden Creamery. I tried the Japanese Milk Coffee, Mango Sticky Rice, Coconut Pandan, Salted Plum (Li Hing Mui) and Thai Tea and all of them had the right amount of flavor without being overly sweet! I especially loved the Mango Sticky Rice, Li Hing Mui, and Japanese Milk Coffee. Where else can you get li hing mui flavored ice cream besides Hawaii?! I wish I tried more flavors, but there was quite a line out the door at around 9pm on a Thursday.

The employees are super sweet and let you try as many flavors as you want. They also have non-dairy options and they actually tasted pretty good! My only gripe is that the scoops are tiny, but somewhat reasonably priced at around $4 for a single scoop with the option of 2 flavors. Also, parking is terrible around the area! Love this place.
author: Joyce E.

description:
I've always walked by this place and seen the sometimes long lines that this place often has and I'm glad I was able to finally try it!

This is probably the best ice cream I've had in the bay area. It's creamy and thick, with just the right consistency and texture whether you like to lick or chew your ice cream. All ice cream in the bay area is around $4 - 5, so this place costs $4.50 for a "single" which is 1 or 2 flavors of your choice. So I had the brownie and cream and cookies and cream and they were both so good. I've never had brownie and cream before and when I noticed that flavour was almost empty I knew it had to be good. 

We came around 1:30pm in the afternoon on Sunday and there was a small wait of around 10 minutes. But, it was totally worth the wait and I'd definitely visit again!
author: Christopher L.

description:
Their flavors speak to me. I don't want to be that person that asks to try all their flavors but I'm tempted to. I haven't though, there's usually a line out the door so I want to be mindful of the patrons behind me. 

Favorite flavors -- Hawaiian mochi, Black sesame, hojicha, ube pandan
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Pros: the ice cream!
Cons: parking? why would you need that? Lines

I heard this vicious rumor that someone had better ice cream than Bi-rite and I decided to finally find out if this was true. After my first experience here, I will only say that I am undecided, but the fact that I'm hesitating is impressive enough. 

Garden Creamery is the perfect neighborhood ice cream shop. It's small, the staff look like they're in high school, and it's tucked into a residential neighborhood. What this means is that for the sake of your sanity, try not to drive here. It's a perfect place to stop by if you just enjoyed dinner on Mission or Valencia. 

The ice cream is really phenomenal. I can't recall the prices but frankly, whatever it was it is worth it. There is a quality and creaminess to their ice cream that makes it stand out in your mind (and crave it later). The variety of flavors is also awesome and well, this is the first black sesame ice cream that can actually go toe to toe with Bi-rite's legendary black sesame with honey lavender. 

So, put your low-carb diet to rest one of these nights and try it out!
author: Andrew C.

description:
YUM! Saw a line out the door on a Saturday afternoon and couldn't help but be curious about what Garden Creamery was all about.

The ice cream shop serves up hand-crafted flavors, including non-dairy/vegan options. I happened to be around when they were offering their very instagrammable chimney cone - Saturdays between 2 and 4. It's basically a churro cone, cinnamon-sugary on the outside, soft and doughy on the inside. It seemed to have a bit of a citrusy flavor as well. Anyway it was delicious, but very filling! I ended up getting a scoop of the black sesame flavor with it. 

I'm excited to come back and try some of their other unique flavors!
author: Judy C.

description: As one who has been smote by God with lactose intolerance, usually going to get ice cream is complete and total masochism. HOWEVER, Garden Creamery has multiple, delicious flavors of dairy free ice cream that make me feel like a person and not an undesirable. I tried the thai iced tea and chocolate recently. Dear god, so delicious and flavorful and ice cream like enough for me to feel normal again. Join me, fellow milk-rejects, you'll thank me when you get here.
author: Marissa F.

description:
My roommates and I threw a party one evening, and someone there suggested going to Garden Creamery after having so much savory BBQ food. We couldn't think of a better idea! We hopped in a Lyft and stood in the line going out the door. We waited for about 20-25 minutes, but it was totally worth it.

My main complaint is that it's impossible to see the ice cream flavors on the board behind the counter. It only lists the types of servings you can get, all of which sound amazing. I need to get the chimney cone next time! Anyways, we took our time sampling ice cream. The main appeal was the vegan ice cream that our friend could only have.

Personally I got scoops of ube and black sesame ice cream, which complemented each other so well. They were some of the most unique-sounding flavors... I could have eaten a whole pint in that moment. I got super excited to try the mango sticky rice flavor, but it was more of a sorbet, and I didn't like it.

The décor of the place felt cozy and inspired interior design conversations as we ate and shared our ice cream. There's not many seats, so you'll either have to wait around or head out. We got lucky and snagged some seats in the corner. We stayed for quite awhile as the crowd died down. We'll definitely be back here again for more ice cream adventures!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Ice Cream that makes me want to scream, it's soo good! SF serves up a lot of ice cream so competition is fierce. What makes GC stand out?

It's made here in Northern CA with local ingredients, they use Strauss milk, but also have vegan options that are plant-based with coconut milk and agave sweetened. Not only that, but most of the flavors range from classics to more exotic/tropical/Asian flavors.

Got in line after grabbing dinner nearby and decided to share a cup of Vegan Mango Sticky Rice and Taro Pandan after sampling a few items. The Vegan Mango Sticky Rice was soo good, really creamy which was surprising since most ice creams with a coconut or soy base ends up either too icy or lack creaminess. Definitely tastes more like sticky rice, similar to vanilla rice pudding and a hint of mango. The Taro Pandan, brought me back to my childhood eating Pandan popsicles, its an aromatic plant that has a vanilla like flavor and almost subtley similar to coconut. The taro wasn't too overpowering and worked well with the Pandan. The texture of the ice cream here is great, almost gelato like and you can tell that all their flavors are of good quality.

Service is good, they are more than willing to let you have samples. The line goes by pretty quickly. Price is more on the pricey end, but for organic and local ingredients used ... I'm all for supporting local farms and those businesses that support them as well. Delicious!
author: Janet N.

description:
Came here and tried a couple of flavors. I think what this place does well is make high quality ice cream. The texture and richness were well done.

My favorite flavor was probably the strawberry fields one. I tried ube, black sesame, and coconut.

I think this place does simple flavors very well. I would imagine vanilla being very good as well.

I still will prefer salt and straw.
author: Victor D.

description:
Ice cream: 5 stars
Service: 5 stars

Came in today right when they opened, there was a little line, but the staff was very friendly and didn't mind that my boyfriend and I wanted to try a couple of flavors. We ended up getting:
-Ube pandan, matcha gold and Japanese milk coffee on a sugar cone
-ube pandan, mango sticky rice and matcha gold on a sugar cone.

Top 2: matcha gold and mango sticky rice.

The other 2 were really good as well, but matcha gold, which had toffee bits, and mango sticky rice really stood out. Everything tasted to fresh, quality ice cream. The mango sticky rice tasted like you were eating a real mango. For the single scoop, you can split it into 2 flavors, double 2-3 flavors which is really cool if you're indecisive like me! Prices are $4.50-$7, extra for cones. Can't wait to go back to try the other flavors in the chimney cone, which is o my sold on saturdays from 2-4pm!
author: Pauline E.

description: Love the creative flavors here as well as the multitude of non-dairy selections. I particularly liked the non-dairy mango sticky rice flavor, which tasted just like its Thai dessert namesake! Since I was there when they had the limited chimney cones (Saturday 2-4pm), I felt like I had to try one. They're pricey and doughy -- you can pull it apart, like monkey bread -- with the flavor of a churro. Honestly it was just okay and I wouldn't shell out the $$ for it again, but I'd definitely come back and get more ice cream!
author: Tiffany P.

description: Garden creamery has easily moved its way up as one of my top 3 ice cream places in SF. They offer a variety of dairy free options (good cuz I'm lactose sometimes). My favs are their mango sticky rice, coconut, and matcha flavors. On Saturday they have their chimney cones which is like a churro cone. I got the cone once for the IG, but wouldn't get again since you can only have one flavor on it.
author: Daniel S.

description:
This ice cream shop honestly has all the best asian flavors of ice cream that I could find anywhere in SF and I wish I had the stomach to eat all of their ice cream. Flavors ranging from hong kong milk tea, genmaicha, uji, black sesame, ube, thai tea.. honestly the list goes on. YOU NEED TO TRY THIS PLACE!! 

I honestly don't think you can go wrong with any flavors, I ordered the hojicha with ube and fell in love. Some flavors like their thai tea doesn't even include dairy which is a plus for some and the quality of the ice cream is exceptional! I also like that you can split two scoops so you can try different things. I'll stop talking now so that you can just head right on over.. like NOW :)
author: Stephanie C.

description: They offer a huge selection of flavors that we tried a lot of, all rich & creamy. They have Asian flavors as well, like pandan coconut, Thai tea, Japanese milk tea... and also vegan/non-dairy options. It is artisan ice cream with unique flavors so it is on the pricey side but it's a nice treat after dinner or such.
author: M L.

description:
This ice cream is really as good as it gets! Don't remember what flavor I had, but it was incredible.

Word of caution though: The flavors are highly experimental.  Don't order without trying it first.  My friend that was with me had been there a few times and ordered wrong.  He said, "I can tell that this is amazing ice cream, but I just don't love my flavor."
author: Leslie T.

description: Totally worth the expensive scoops for some creative and delicious flavors! I would totally recommend anything Ube and also the variety of dairy-free options.
author: Cindy K.

description: this place was on my wife's list for a while, and we were finally able to go! They definitely don't skimp on the portions, which is both nice and also bad (for my waistline!!!). They definitely had a lot of more Asian-influenced flavors like Ube and the like. I had the Japanese milk coffee and mint chip, which complemented each other nicely and were a perfect treat- not too sweet, not too icy. If you're in the mission, this place is definitely worth checking out.
author: Samir K.

description:
The first time I walked into Garden creamery, I wasn't expecting the chimney comes but was gladly surprised. It is churros filled with ice cream and can't go wrong! But is that's not your thing, their regular waffle cone is pretty darn good too! But the best part is most def the ice cream!! They have tons of flavors - dairy, non-dairy and vegan.
Black Sesame and horchata may be my top two. But you can't go wrong with any of them really!
author: Nidhi M.

description:
This place is a gem! Delicious flavorful ice cream that isn't too sweet. 

Roasted green tea (hojicha)
Matcha
Known for their purple ube (yam)
Thai tea
Black sesame (bomb!)
Mango
author: Andy L.

description:
Cute little ice cream spot that offers a variety of non-dairy options for those who still want dessert, but can't handle the milk.

Because this was a spontaneous trip after dinner, I was still sort of full, but also wanted something sweet, so I went with a small cup with the mango flavor. With a small you can get either one large scoop or two medium sized ones - I just went all in with the single serving, however, I was kicking myself for not doing the Earl Grey as well.

Service is super friendly and they'll let you sample to your heart's content. Flavors change often, so it's great excuse to make return visits in the future!

Will for sure be back!
author: Ryan C.

description:
BEST ICE CREAM!  Many people recommended Garden Creamery and I now see why!! We wanted the chimney cone, but didn't realize it was on select days! (I think Saturdays?).  Got here right before closing so the line wasn't so bad and were able to hang out for a bit.  Even though seating was quite limited, we were able to snag seats by the window.  The service was amazing! Such friendly ladies helped us out.  I also really like the plant vibe and decor.

There were many many flavors to pick from, each so unique and delish.  I ended up getting black sesame and hojicha, but all the others I've tried were great.  

So far, this has ranked as my favorite ice cream place in the city!
author: Lyn C.

description:
Ooh I really liked it here! First off, there was a line out the door and parking was kind of difficult to find on a Sunday afternoon, but I insisted on trying it since I saw all of its great reviews. 

The single allows you to choose 2 flavors! Which I LOVED because then you can mix and match ice creams! I ordered the matcha and the strawberry with a cone. It was delicious! My boyfriend ordered the matcha and coffee I think? He seemed to really like it since he finished it before me! 

Great ice cream spot. I will definitely have to come back if I'm in the area.
author: Heather I.

description:
The line may be long, but it moves quickly and is TOTALLY worth it. I'm stingy with giving giving out stars, but I'm happy to shower allllll of 'em on Garden! 5 stars well deserved! 

There's a mouthwatering selection of Asian-influenced flavors. My boyfriend is lactose-intolerant and was still able to find something delicious that I unashamedly started digging into as well (the Mango Sticky Rice).  

We ended up getting the Black Sesame, Coconut Pandan, and Mango Sticky Rice. All the flavors were delicious!! The Mango Sticky Rice was somehow able to delicately and intricately weave in notes of sticky rice - it was super impressive! Also A+ for the richness of Black Sesame without being too nutty/overwhelming. It's a fine balance! 

Definitely recommend. You won't be disappointed!
author: Joyce W.

description:
Short line on a warm Sunday afternoon in the Mission?! Wow! Meanwhile at Bi Rite, line was all the way to the street light. No matter. The ice cream flavors here one of a kind!

Pros:
+ Adventurous flavors and basic flavors made with a twist
+ Ice cream consistency not too creamy, not icy at all
+ Line moves fast

Cons:
- So many flavors to try! So much anxiety about holding up the line.
- Space is small. Seating is limited. Take it to go and enjoy a walk around the area

Recommendations:
+ Tahitian Vanilla with Brownies, 5/5
+ Guava Li Hing Mui Sorbet, 5/5

Just Ok:
- Earl Grey

Guava was refreshing, sweet with a slight sour hint to it. Tahitian Vanilla with Brownies can do no wrong. Nothing too crazy here. Earl Grey was good at first, but with a few more bites, the flavor got too strong for my liking. My friend loved her Mango Sticky Rice, but the Ube was a miss.

$14 for 2 double scoops. Will be back to try other flavors!
author: Fanny W.

description: Thrilled my friend introduced me to this magical place! I'm in love with all of their flavors (especially the selection of non-dairy they have) and can't wait to come back for more when I visit SF again.
author: Wesley C.

description:
The quality and flavor selection of the ice cream here is superb!

It was difficult deciding what to get, because they have so many uniquely cozy asian flavors (ex. hojicha-roasted green tea, ube, mango sticky rice). I ended up with their special chinese rice cake flavor, which actually had a glutinous texture to it - amazing!

The service was great as well. Def had me wanting more!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I somehow end up here every time I'm in the Mission, but for good reason! The ice cream here is legit, and they have a great variety of (a lot of asian) flavors. You can't go wrong with any of the green tea variations, black sesame, or ube! 

In Saturdays they have chimney cones, which are delicious! They kind of have the texture of a thin bread, but you just have to try it. They still had some after 4:30 or whatever time they have listed on the day I went.
author: Allison Y.

description:
SF has great ice cream everywhere, and this is no different. What helps Garden Creamery stand out is the unique flavors they offer. Nostalgic about your time in SE Asia? No problem-- just come here and get the ube, mango sticky rice, or coconut flavors. Missing Japan? There are 3 matcha flavors for you to try. Their dairy-free options are also great. I'm usually not a fan of sorbets, but they managed to keep the mango sticky rice dairy-free and creamy, all while letting the flavors of the natural ingredients shine through.
Portions here are also very generous. The kids size is usually 1 scoop at most ice cream shops, but they give you double here!
author: Amy C.

description:
This has got to be my favorite ice cream of the moment. Granted, this is a fleeting title because I'm such a ice cream fiend, but Garden Creamery you are IT right now.  I even waited in a line for you. It was a short line, but still.  

I loved my double scoop Ube and Black Sesame. My husband enjoyed the one of the tea flavors along with a scoop of strawberry. I love that they use local herbs and fruits. I gotta tell you, that was some of the most strawberriest strawberry ice cream I've ever had. Delicious.

Even their sugar cones, which I tend not to like, are delicious. Someday I may brave the Saturday line to try the famous chimney cone.
author: Nikki M.

description:
I come here at least once a week, and some of the servers recognize me. I have an ice cream problem. Garden is my favorite, and their texture is super amazing. It bets all the other ice cream places for me (over Salt & Straw, Smitten, Birite, Humphrey Solocumb etc). 

But by far the reason I come almost exclusively to Garden is because they have the best flavors (for my taste). They change it all the time based on what's in season. Their ice cream is so naturally vibrant. 

Basically Garden Creamy is the best thing ever.
author: H. L.

description: This is some of the best ice cream I've had in the US. Amazing interesting flavors that you want more than just a taste of and the ice cream is light and refreshing. Ingredients taste fresh and perfect for whatever season you come and try this place. A must try for ice cream lovers and visitors to San Francisco!
author: Molly K.

description:
SF boasts a number of unique, high-quality ice cream shops and competition is Game of Thrones fierce.  As of last Saturday, Salt and Straw has officially been dethroned by Garden Creamery... in my tummy anyway.    

Undeterred by the line that overflows out of this tiny oasis and down Lexington, my two friends and I huddled together outside on a windy Saturday afternoon.  Like Salt and Straw, the crew here highly encourages you to try ALL the flavors you're interested in.  This was my first visit and they did not need to tell me twice, haha.  I sampled the nian gao, ube pandan, black sesame, macapuno and banana lilikoi (passion fruit).  Unlike Salt and Straw, I find Garden Creamery's flavors to be interesting AND delicious.  While I admire Salt and Straw's creativity, the actual execution of flavors usually leaves much to be desired.  Garden Creamery, on the other hand, actually delivered on intriguing flavors.  Sample after sample of perfectly captured favorites... I honestly still can't believe they got nian gao so spot on!

After my sample frenzy, I decided on the ube pandan in their signature chimney cone.  At first I thought I would only order it for the 'gram, but I began to unravel and dip it into the ice cream and ended up finishing the whole thing.  One tip - there's a hole at the bottom of the cone and your ice cream will drip through; make sure to ask the people at the front for a bowl.

There are some seats inside, but you'll more than likely take your ice cream to go.  Luckily this spot is right in the middle of the Mission and there are plenty of places to go!
author: Iona C.

description:
This place along with a couple of the other highly rated ice cream spots on my list has weird hours but is a super cool venue.

I tried the : in order of fave to least fave
Japanese Milk Coffee- Pretty darn good! Tasted similar to milk tea as others have noted
Hojicha- Pretty good as well. Usually not a fan of green tea ice creams but this one was pretty good! 
Black Sesame- Was not a fan and would not get again.

So many good ice cream/gelato/chocolate spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 

I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Polly Ann Ice Cream
5 Salt and straw
6 Milkbomb Ice Cream
7 Garden Creamery
8 Chocolate Covered
9 Loving Cup
10 Smitten Ice Cream
11 Teuscher Chocolate 
12 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
13 Over the Moon
14 Lush Gelato
15 The Ice Cream Bar
16 Coletta Gelato
17 Cako Creamery
18 Bi-Rite Creamery
19 San Francisco's Hometown Creamery 
20 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
21 Mitchells Ice cream
22 St. Francis Fountain
23 Z Cioccolato
24 Joe's Ice Cream
25 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
26 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
27 Ghirardelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop
28 Recchiuti Confections 
29 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description: MY FAVORITE ice cream spot of all time. It's a bit far away from me in the mission, but that's why it's a special treat! And why boyfriend decides to buy 4 double scoops packaged to go (since they don't sell prepackaged pints)!! The staff is super friendly too and very helpful, one of the ladies behind the counter gave us samples of all her favorites and then let us try a whole bunch. Between the two of us, we tried ALL the flavors!! I liked that it's not too sweet, has asian flavors like uber and pandan or mango sticky rice, but also really fresh. Favorites were cantalope, nectarine for farm fresh refreshing flavor, for creamy we liked mango sticky rice, ube and pandan, then for unique we liked the lihing and pluot flavor! yummy
author: Anh Thu P.

description:
PSA to all my fellow lactose intolerant yelpers, our ice cream dreams have finally come true. Say goodbye to the days of unsatisfying, icy sorbet and hello to flavorful and bright sorbet that makes you swear that you're consuming dairy. 

I came to the Garden Creamery close to closing time on a cold Sunday night and there was still a significant line out the door. Once at the ice cream counter, they make it very clear between ice cream and sorbet (it's dairy free and also vegan btw!). They've got so many different flavors to choose from in both categories including calamansi, matcha, hojicha, black sesame, pandan, Thai tea, etc. plus traditional fruit flavors and chocolate too. Let's just say I tried almost everything and the workers encouraged it too! After what must've been my 8th or 9th flavor, I felt bad so I stopped asking for samples but the workers even pushed a couple more on me just so I could be sure about what I wanted. Ultimately I just chose the flavors that I liked best and guess what, they were dairy free! 

Thai tea- favorite #1! This was so amazingly creamy and it definitely made me feel like there must've been some sort of full fat cream in there
Mango sticky rice- favorite #2! I'm not sure how they made this but it actually tastes like mango and sticky rice
Hojicha- you can definitely taste the roasted flavor but was abit strong for my taste
Matcha/ pandan with ube- super yummy! Although I didn't go for it because I normally have these flavors of ice cream
Japanese milk coffee- if I was gonna get another scoop of ice cream, this definitely would've been it 

11/10 would recommend this place. They've got a wide variety of flavors that hit the spot and their service is stellar as well.
author: Megan D.

description:
Ice cream my love for you Garden Creamy ;)!

This place has been my go-to ice cream spot for over a year now and I'm glad to see they're really blowing up. This place deserves all the hype for their unique flavors and I've never disliked anything I've tried here. I'm pretty obsessed with all their Pandan flavored combos!

My favorites have got to be: Ube Pandan, Pandan Coconut, Mango Sticky Rice, Haupia Macadamia, Hojicha
author: Kathy L.

description:
I'm so glad that I found this creamery. HYPE is REAL. Love their ICE CREAMM :P Just WOW!

I was only here for their churro cone,  ** churro cones (only available on Saturday, 2-4pm). I got here with Amy T. around 1pm. We were a bit early so we got to try all their flavors. Good thing we did because once it hit 2pm, the line went out the door. It was a big mistake that we left.. we thought we would have time to come back 2pm and not wait. DON'T DO IT.. I think we waited about 25 minutes +, not too bad. 

I was debating on getting 3-4 flavors: matcha (toffee), black sesame, banana caramel (not sure if that's the correct name), and cookie n cream (classic) on a churro cone. They had so many delicious flavor it was hard to pick. However, they only limit one scoop on a churro cone, I was so sad. So I ended up with black sesame. It was super creamy and rich, best black sesame ice cream I've ever had. They also have other unique flavors that is non-dairy like thai tea (strong flavor), earl grey, and sorbet flavor. 

**Churro cone ($8). Does it taste as good as it looks in photo? Hell yess! Although it doesn't taste like an "actual" churro, it tasted yummy. It's a bit doughy. I like to compare it to a croissant. 

Overall, I loved it. I would love to come here again, if the timing is right. Parking is a pain, so GOOD LUCK!
author: Noel K.

description:
I love this place.  I love the variety of flavors.  The ice cream is rich, smooth and full of flavor.  I really enjoy their black sesame and all of their variations of green tea.  

Will always come here if I'm in the area.
author: Rachel L.

description: They have special/limited edition flavors all the time. There's currently 2 flavors with pluots that I'm obsessed with: one salted pluot sorbet and one with dairy. Their mango sticky rice (it's dairy free with coconut milk) is a forever hit but i also love the coconut pandan - it's my current favorite. If you like coffee, the Japanese milk coffee is fantastic
author: Weich Y.

description:
Flavors here are pretty unique and so delicious!! The scoops are also decently sized and priced. I tried a few flavors and while all were delicious, I ended up choosing the Hojicha as well as the Matcha (this one had some sort of berry jam in it that kind of reminded me of the matcha drink at boba guys!!). The line was a bit long but it moved very quickly! 

Note that it's a pretty small pace and seating is quite limited!
author: Janice L.

description:
Of all the dessert places around SF, this place takes the cake (and replaces it with ice cream)! 

Food: This place is a dream come true for anyone with an Asian palate and a sweet tooth. They serve rotating ice cream flavors that include flavors like Pandan, Ube, and all kinds of tea flavors! They've even got great classic flavors like chocolate and vanilla brownie.

Service: They're happy to let you try as many flavors as you like - with a smile! Plus they let you do extra flavors (like 3 smaller scoops to replace the 2 scoop).

Location: Just one block off from the bustling mission district streets! Only street/residential parking available.

Ambience: Hip, popular, small ice cream shop.

Pros: Amazing ice cream, good service, good vibe.

Cons: Often times a bit of a wait (usually no more than 15mins), tad pricey - but still so worth it.

TLDR; Asian and classic flavors made well with great service makes for best ice cream ever. Highest ice cream recommendation!
author: Julian L.

description:
For $4.65 for a single cup (which really is like a double because you can put two different flavors into one and it's two pretty big scoops) you can't go wrong with this place! This ice cream place is so so so good and is one of my top favorite ice cream spots in the city!! They have a variety of flavors that constantly change every week or so and let me tell you all those flavors are dank af. They also have a lot of non-dairy options and sorbets which is always nice to see and good for those lactose-intolerant folks! 

Overall, I think this is a great ice cream place and is priced fairly well. I think a single scoop is defiantly enough and a decent sized portion, since you can get two flavors in one! If you're in the mission area I would say to defiantly check this place out for ice cream you won't regret it!!
author: Rithika V.

description:
Have heard about this place for awhile and finally had the chance to try it. It is a fresh looking, minimalistic ice cream shop. Love that majority of the flavors are Asian-inspired, which differs from other nearby places. 

I ordered a single cone with a scoop Ube and Banana salted caramel. Both flavors were great and the waffle cone was probably one of the best I've had. 

I would love to come back and try the chimney cone! Looks like the trdelnik you can get in Prague, which I loved! Very good creamery, just don't know if I'd choose it over bi-rite.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Glad to find more variety of ice cream joints in the Mission. On a lovely "SF warm" Saturday afternoon, I waited about 25-30 minutes in an outside line to  finally sink my teeth into creamy ice cream.

Samples available and I'm grateful to the staff for being patient with each person wanting to try different flavors. I finally settled on the Thai tea flavor. The ice cream was sweeter than what I'm use to, but I liked the texture and creaminess. 

I also had couple bites of the caramel, green tea, and vanilla. Surprisingly of those 3 flavors, I liked the vanilla the best even though most people, including myself, consider vanilla a bit plain. The caramel was way too sweet for my liking. 

Not much seating inside. Clean restrooms, convenient location. I'm a fan.
author: Jean L.

description: They have the best flavors!  I got the li-hing sorbet and it was delicious!  Been meaning to go back for more.  Soon I'm hoping!
author: doris c.

description:
My friend and I came here for ice cream one weekday evening. They don't have the chimney cones all the time, I believe only on Saturdays during a certain time window, so if you want one of those make sure to check the times.

I ended up getting the Hojicha and the Ube flavors. The Hojicha was delicious, it had an on point roasted green tea flavor, and it tasted quite amazing. It was pleasant, while also being decadent in flavor.

The Ube was good but my favorite. It was made well with the right flavors and everything, but I've also have had better.

The ice cream here did feel quite rich and creamy though, kind of like the dairy content was higher than normal, which was quite enjoyable and made the ice cream feel very ice creamy.
author: Tyler T.

description:
We were super lucky and there was no line.

I've been to Bi-Rite and Garden Creamery has more (Asian-inspired) exotic flavors as well as a better price to portion ratio. $4.50 gets you a "single", which is actually two scoops and a very filling serving.

They let you sample a LOT (though I limited myself to 3)! There was a crazy furikake popcorn flavor that was DELICIOUS.

Would love to come back!
author: Annie C.

description: worth the wait standing outside in cold weather ! The line wait can be over an hour since the place is very small but this will be my ice cream spot when I visit SF. I recommend the taro and Thai tea! Prices were very reasonable! Don't be shy and get 2 scoops lol
author: Damaris Yulet M.

description:
Third time IS the charm! My previous 2 experiences went like this...
Searched on Yelp for hours. "It's open! Let's go!" And arrived to taste the bitterness of locked glass doors... This time, pure luck brought us here to a pair of welcoming doors (Not really :P you have to open them yourselves).

Anyhow, there is a variety of matcha flavored ice-cream. All are a little sweet for me.
author: Sherry Z.

description:
The best flavors!! 

So far I've had their Ube, Kalamansi Creamsicle, August Glow, and Japanese Milk Tea

Please don't just get vanilla or cookies & cream; TRY SOMETHING NEW! You'll be pleasantly surprised
author: Nikka C.

description:
They have six vegan ice creams each day. I particularly loved the coconut one.

I split a scoop of cookies and cream and scoop of vanilla brownie with my boyfriend and didn't like those nearly as much.
author: Julia C.

description:
After seeing their IG posts for quite some time and just tempting us time and time again showcasing the Chimney Cone we were delighted to make our way to Garden Creamery over the weekend. 

The signage of Garden Creamery outside on a street corner has the vibes of a neighborhood ice cream shop in a small town.
To no surprise we were in a line that began outside. It gave us enough time to figure out what flavor to get. The staff was friendly and patient in allowing me to sample a few of the flavors. 

I selected some kind of brownie/vanilla flavor in the Chimney Cone. 
The sweettooth facet of me was a bit bummed that only one scoop could go in the cone but seeing as how another scoop would soggify and ruin the cone's texture it was understandable. The cone was excellent and definitely was reminiscent of a churro. The ice cream was so yummy and had me wishing I would be able to purchase a pint of it. 
Probably the most expensive 1 scoop I've had to pay for ($8) but hey, I was happy to have tried it.
author: Kyle Y.

description:
Hands down my favorite ice cream in the entire city. I am known among friends and family as an ice cream fiend, and this place satisfies ALL of my cravings and desires. 

First off, the low-key atmosphere is unpretentious and immediately makes me feel like I'm at a local ice cream shop, not like I'm at a high-end boutique I don't belong in (like some places). The line is usually out the door because everybody loves the spot so much, but it always goes quickly enough.

Secondly, the ice cream itself is so amazing I find myself constantly craving the texture and flavors. My favorites are the Ube and the Matcha Gold, but I'm always pleased with the new flavors they have in rotation and willing to try whatever they have to offer.

It's also well-priced (for SF) at $5 for a single scoop that can really turn into 2 servings if you split the scoop. I always share with a friend because as much as I'd love to eat all the ice cream in the world, I know at the end of the day it just isn't the best idea. 

In the end, I will never stop recommending this place to friends and strangers I run into in the city. This will knock your socks off - no doubt.
author: Jenny D.

description:
I kept seeing a lot of people posting about this place on Instagram, so I decided I needed to give it a try.  

I visited early on a Sunday afternoon and I seemed to be the first customer of the day.  The staff was super helpful in talking about the different flavors and the chimney cones which I unfortunately missed out on.  I was amazed by the unique selection of flavors.  I was amazed I could find some of these flavors outside of Hawaii.  In the end, I went with the guava li hing sorbet and chocolate haupia in a waffle cone.  These flavors tasted amazing and were spot on in the ways I remembered eating haupia and li hing in Hawaii.  It also helped that the waffle cone was fresh and added a nice crispy crunch to later bites.   

On another visit I had the hurricane popcorn and mango sticky rice which were also amazing.  This place has hands down become my favorite ice cream spot in the city.
author: Mitch T.

description:
How can I not review my favorite ice cream joint in San Francisco?! After ShakeDown in the Tenderloin closed down (::moment of silence::), I was on the hunt for my next favorite. I was looking for The One.

Salt & Straw is good, but super hyped, and the flavors can be hit or miss.

Bi-Rite is as high quality as it gets, but the flavors almost never change. Zzz.

Humphry Slocombe is aite (yeah I said it).

Enter Garden Creamery.

Like many basic girls, I love Asian flavors, especially ube, matcha, and black sesame. Garden Creamery has those and more: Hojicha, matcha with toffee, Thai tea (with a vegan version as well), mango sticky rice, etc. 

The line can be long, but so are most of the above places, and I'd much rather go here. I also just learned you can get condensed milk as a topping so that's gonna be a life-changer. Haven't tried the infamous chimney cone but I'm extremely meh about those trends - just give me good Asian-flavored ice cream in a cup and I am a happy camper!
author: Valerie L.

description:
Came on a weekday thinking there were chimney cones but only to find it's only on the weekends  Went after dinner and it was relatively crowded. You can try multiple samples. The Hong Kong milk tea flavor has a strong tea flavor with a bit of a bitter after taste. The ube pandan was very good and not overly sweet! My boyfriend and I mixed the two flavors and it was amazing!! 

Might come back on Saturday to try the chimney cones.
author: Nathalie N.

description:
I've been seeing Garden Creamery pop up all over my Instagram and Yelp, so I definitely had to check it out and see what the hype is all about. Is it my favorite ice cream spot in SF? I can't say. You see, I don't feel qualified to judge, since I'm not a huge ice cream person and haven't tried some of the classic spots such as Mitchell's, but it definitely was very good and I walked away impressed..

I came on a Saturday afternoon as their chimney cones are only available from 2-4 every Saturday. It was a day in SF (i.e. perfect ice cream weather!) so of course there was a line out the door when my friend and I arrived around 2:30, but the line moved at a decent pace and we were at the front counter within 30 minutes.

Prices were as follows:
Ice cream: 1 scoop (1-2 flavors) is $4.50, 2 scoops (2-3 flavors) is $6.75
Sorbet: 1 scoop (1-2 flavors) is $4.75, 2 scoops (2-3 flavors) is $7
Chimney cone with scoop is $8.50
Sugar and cake cones are free, and waffle cones cost an extra $1

They had other items too, such as popsicles and ice cream sandwiches, but I didn't look too hard at that side of the menu.

I tried a number of flavors of both the ice cream and sorbets, and while everything was delicious, t I was instantly blown away by a flavor called mango lihingmui. I didn't know what lihingmui was and tried it out of curiosity since I love anything mango flavored, but it turns out it's the Chinese sweet/sour/salty dried plums I grew up eating and absolutely adore. This flavor mixed with the mango was phenomenal, since the sourness of the lihingmui perfectly balanced the sweetness of the mango. 

I immediately decided to get a chimney scone with the mango lihingmui flavor, and spent the next 20 minutes very enjoyably finishing it off. To be honest, if there was any special flavor to the chimney cone, I could not taste it over the mango lihingmui, but I did enjoy the texture which was slightly crunchy on the outside but soft and doughy on the inside. 

I liked that were was some limited seating inside. My friend and I got lucky as a table opened up right as we were paying, so we were able to leisurely enjoy our ice cream inside out of the sun.

Parking in this area is all street (and metered along Mission), so good luck finding something! I got lucky and found a residential spot maybe two blocks away, but I don't always get so lucky with parking in the Mission...
author: Dianna H.

description: I don't remember what I ordered now, but I do remember that this place has some really unique flavors! Including Milk tea, hojicha, and black sesame. If I'm ever in the area, I would definitely be open to coming back to try other flavors!
author: Kenny N.

description:
This place has come along with the wave of ice cream shops that's hit SF in the last few years but it definitely stands out from the rest.

Once you make it past the long lines during peak hours, take in the color scheme of calming pastels that get you ready to appreciate ice cream that's soft, velvety, and subtly sweet like marshmallows. The flavors have the power to transport you as far away as a tropical beach in Thailand or a bustling food market in Japan. 

These are some of my favorites- made from scratch with Straus organic dairy and a coconut-based vegan sorbet sweetened with organic agave nectar:

BUTTER MOCHI TOASTED SESAME
Rich Butter mochi with toasted sesame seeds

BLACK SESAME
Intense Black Sesame

THAI TEA
Authentic, rich thai tea

MANGO STICKY RICE

COCONUT PANDAN (Vegan)
Coconut with a hint of tropical panda leaf notes

These taste great in a cup or cone, but if you have an extra half hour on a Saturday between 2pm-4pm, you can line up to get the elusive Chimney Cone- a handmade pastry cone that's like a cross between a churro and a croissant. Just keep a cup at the bottom to keep your ice cream from falling all the way through!
author: Mitzi G.

description:
Super good ice cream in the Mission! Love how there are both non-dairy and dairy flavors with a wide variety.

Today I had the Thai tea and honey dark chocolate, both of which are non-dairy options I would highly recommend. Bryan had the honey dark chocolate and liked it a lot as well.

The Thai tea flavor tasted just like if you were drinking Thai tea and the dark chocolate had a rich chocolaty flavor with a hint of honey.

Not much of a line when we got there Sunday afternoon but not much seating inside either. Excited to have tried this place and to return in the (hopefully near) future!
author: Melissa W.

description: I finally got to try Garden Creamery and was blown away by how great their flavors are! I'm a sucker for tea-flavored ice creams, so I the first ones I zoned in on were the Hong Kong milk tea and hojicha flavors. Now, the thing is, most ice cream or soft serve places I've been to that serve milk tea flavors make it SUPER mild. (Many milk tea places do as well, to be honest...) But Garden's flavors were not shy at all - they really packed a concentrated punch of tea flavor, and I absolutely love them for it! Would love to come back and try some of their many other flavors as well - they're definitely one of my favorites now!
author: Delia Z.

description: The mission is one of my favorite areas to be when visiting SF, it's a little more relaxed. I see many places that serve ice cream and I think this is one of the best places I've been to. They specialize in more exotic asian flavors and I'm very happy to have tried the mango sticky rice, which was dairy free and tasted awesome. The taro pandan was also spot on in tasting traditional. Definitely felt nostalgic when eating here. The also play some really good bangerz
author: Alex L.

description: As described accurately by the name, this place has a lot of green plants and churns up gallons of ice cream all day. My girlfriend has a fascination with plants and I love ice cream, so our obsessions brought us here. There is always a line that wraps around the corner, but for good reason. We sampled a few flavors, but decided on the hojicha. She normally doesn't like ice cream, but inhaled the whole thing even the churro cone that the ice cream came in. The few bites that I managed to come up with, I noticed that the ice cream captured that distinct roasted tea taste, while maintaining a silky smooth texture. That is how you know it is good when the ice cream has that perfect balance of flavor and texture when consuming it. Staff was friendly and seem to really enjoy helping all the customers sample the unique flavors. There were so many unheard of flavors probably because all the ice cream was made in the back. There is no doubt I will be coming back, but I will be smarter this time and order my own.
author: Ronald M.

description:
Really killer ice cream
Vanilla is on point 
Whole different league than the garbage at salt & straw
author: Buc N.

description:
Came to Garden Creamery after a dinner date at Mission Cheese....was definitely trying to max out my daily dairy intake capacity I guess...

Overall, very good. Best ice cream in San Francisco? Mmm...not quite there in my opinion, but still very good. Flavors are made in house and are generally "unique" but unique flavors in SF these days are pretty damn standard.

That said, I thought the Ube Pandan actually was on par, if not better than Mitchell's (I know, crazy!). It was much more fragrant and smooth whereas I've found Mitchell's version to come off as too sweet at times. The Japanese Milk Coffee was also great. Tasted like Milk Tea in ice cream form! But towards the end, it felt a little too creamy and just kind of heavy. Definitely should have gotten the Ube on the bottom!

All in all, I'm excited for return trips!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Yummy ice cream! Located in the Mission district. This ice cream shop has many asian inspired flavors such as matcha and hojicha(both types of tea); they have ube, and many other flavors.  They have a vegan ice cream section which uses coconut milk to substitute the regular milk base.  

On Saturdays, they have a time where they have the chimney cones, which is a pastry in the shape of a cone and covered in cinnamon sugar.  It is often likened to a churro, but the texture of the pastry reminds me more of asian bread, which is fluffy.

I tried the Ube and pandan ice cream in a chimney cone.  The Ube flavor was distinct and the pandan flavor made this different from other ice cream shops which offer Ube.  It was quite delicious.  The chimney cone was slight hard to each with the ice cream as it towers over the pastry.  The cone itself was quite fragile, so be careful not to squeeze too hard.  The cone also has a small hole on the bottom, so if you eat slowly, you will drip(like any other cone). 

Overall, a welcome addition to the many ice cream shops in San Francisco!
author: Jacky C.

description:
I'm not a big ice cream gal, but Garden Creamery is a place I would highly recommend going for unique flavors, fast efficiency, and personality.

I've gone to a few places in SF for ice cream, but Garden is my and my boyfriend's favorite. I have bookmarked this place because of their CHURRO CHIMNEY CONES! Yes, their famous log-like cones are deliciously cinnamon-sugar'd and fluffy. Apparently they are only on sale on Saturdays midday like 2 to 4PM, but we've been after 4PM both times and they still had chimney cones--AND both were hot days. Anyways, get the chimney cone just to try it...but I think the fun factor is what I paid for. I have no desire to get the chimney cone again, so I just get the regular cone which allows for 1 or 2 scoops for the small size. How generous.

They have a variety of flavors from matcha gold (matcha and toffee bits) to sour plum and thai tea. I am obsessed with the ube flavor, and we got that scoop with the sour plum. The combination is delicious AND the colors are so vibrant. I also like the matcha gold, even though I'm not a fan of toffee. They have a variety of matcha flavors like hojicha (roasted green tea) and genmaicha. I've had their black sesame and pumpkin (seasonal) too. It's like a neverending stream of flavors...how exciting! I am always excited to see what different flavors they're cooking up. It's great when your local ice cream shop serves the variety you want, but keeps them edible and delicious too.

Because I stay in Mission a lot, I think Garden is my #1 ice cream spot. Bi-Rite is just not my favorite texture--the ice cream always melts by the time I walk to Dolores Park...and a lot of other places are pricier, and scoops are just too small. PLUS the greatest thing about Garden is their service and people. The owner's birthday was very recent. She is clearly loved by her workers and neighborhood friends--we sang happy birthday to her, her friends brought her a large cake and they shared it with us!! RANDOM CUSTOMERS! It was so sweet. I have seen the same workers working on both weekends I have gone, and they are always SO patient and kind...which is the HARDEST thing to do in a ice cream shop. Tip them, smile, and be friendly. They work so hard giving hundreds of people tasting scoops...so that's the least we can do.
author: Jodi H.

description:
This place just makes me so happy! Granted I've only been here once in my lifetime but sometimes once is enough. Don't worry, I'll be paying this place a visit many more times in the near future to get a more statistically significant rating and a better hold on their offerings.

Let's just say the flavors are simply bold and exotic! Anything with an asian flair to it can be considered exotic, we're quite the breed LOL!

They boast flavors such as guabanero, green tea, japanese milk coffee, black sesame, and also main staples like cookies and cream. EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS I wish my stomach was bigger!

The milk and ingredients they used was of top tier quality and you can taste it, especially in the green tea! I WILL BE BACK.

Stand by for my future review folks.
author: Connie M.

description:
Garden Creamery has many unique flavors of ice cream & sorbets.  A lot of them are tea-based, such as Hojicha and Earl Grey.  If you want to come for the chimney cone, it's only available on Saturdays and they usually run out within a couple of hours.  If you're not trying to get the chimney cone, I would try to avoid going on Saturday at 2pm because that's when we went and the line went out the door and into the alley, but it is worth waiting for the ice cream.

There are so many choices and it was hard to choose, but I ended up getting the Ube Pandan Coconut and the Japanese Milk Coffee.  They were both amazing and creamy.  A single scoop ran me $4.50.

It's kind of odd that they open at 6pm W-F and 12pm Saturday & Sunday and are closed on Mondays & Tuesdays.  Even with so many ice cream shops around, this place can keep up with the competition and offer their own twists.  I recommend trying one of their many flavors if you have the chance because this is some high quality ice cream!
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
Definitely loving all the unique flavors that are here. I get the hype. 

I came on a Sunday night, around 9pm. There wasn't a line that extended to the end of the block, but there were a fair amount of people waiting in line. It was a solid 10/15 minute wait. There were more people behind me as well, so I definitely felt like I couldn't taste everything I wanted to. 

I didn't get the chimney cone here. And honestly, I don't even think it's worth the gram. I like my ice cream hard and really frozen. The chimney cone would just make a melty mess. 

I ended up with the ube/pandan and the hojicha flavor. I definitely liked how strong and prominent the flavors were. I love that they have a lot of tea flavors. The ice cream is nicely made and had true flavors. I would say that the ube/pandan was on the sweeter side for my tastebuds. But it's fine. I liked it regardless. 

Overall, I'll come again if I'm craving ice cream. I like the flavor selection they have compared to Smitten across the street and Bi-rite down the block.
author: Tina Y.

description:
My co-workers and I came here a few Saturday's ago, since we were in need of a sweet treat.  I'd heard really good things about Garden Creamy and especially about the variety of flavors they offer.  The line wasn't too bad when we arrived, so we got in line and waited to enjoy our treat.  I know they constantly rotate their flavors, but I did take a sneak peak at their online website to get an idea to help me decide what to order.  

Once we got to the counter, I did ask to sample a few flavors, which only made my decision harder as to what to actually order.  I ordered a double scoop that included banana/lilikoi and cookies and cream inside a waffle cone.  The banana/lilikoi wasn't too tart and was just sweet enough.  The cookies and cream was really good and contained some good chunks of Oreo cookies.  The waffle cone was a bit thin, but had a lot of flavor to it.  

There are a couple of tables and benches inside, that we were lucky enough to grab, so we could enjoy our ice cream inside and avoid the heat.  I really enjoyed the large variety of flavors and the creaminess of their ice cream.  I'll definitely be back to sample more flavors.
author: Lon H.

description: Great experience and friendly staff! We tried the Mango Sticky Rice ice cream in a chimney cone and it was delicious. The only downside to this is that it was a little on the pricey side, one scoop chimney cone being $8. The line looked long but it moved quickly and the people there were all in good moods as well. Family friendly with a chill vibe to it. I will gladly go again soon.
author: Libby M.

description: Went on a Saturday afternoon and luckily had a wait of 5 minutes. I love this place because they have not just one, two, but typically 5-6 vegan options. And they are all freaking good. I had the coconut and earl grey and husband had the Thai tea and chocolate. Both of us were Extremely happy with our combo and serving size was perfect. I am hoping to make it there one day when they have either their Matcha or black sesame made vegan. Those are my favorite flavors and hard to find ice cream establishments that make vegan options. Nevertheless, this trip pleased my sweet tooth and you really can't tell that these are vegan options, as the ice cream is smooth, rich and creamy. I dislike always resorting to sorbets, so very happy that they provide the cruelty free option so that I can have my peace of mind and enjoy dessert too!
author: Grace L.

description:
Flavors: If you're looking for more traditional flavors like Rocky Road and Neapolitan, this isn't the place for you. They have more eclectic flavors, which I love; Earl Grey, Mango Sticky Rice, Arroz con Leche, Black Sesame, and Hojicha (roasted green tea) just to name a few. I got the Thai Iced Tea and Hojicha (yes, I love tea) on a simple sugar cone. My fiancé got the Arroz con Leche in the infamous chimney cone. The flavors were definitely five-star. 

I'm reserving a star because it's quite pricey for the scoop. I spent $6.75 for two very small scoops. You can just as easily head to another ice cream shop and get a split scoop (which is what the sizing for this was) for much less than $6.75. 

If you like cinnamon bread with your ice cream, I would recommend the chimney cone. I took a bite off my fiancé's cone and it was a nice texture change, but I still prefer the classic sugar cone.
author: Melanie N.

description:
9/10/17

San Franciscans love their ice cream.  Clearly.  I mean, check out the line at Bi Rite... what's Bi Rite?--ask that and you'd probably be shunned out of all SF social circles in existence.

BUT, that also means SF loves to overrate ice cream parlors too.  And in this case, CRAY CRAY overrate.  Yes, in some ways we all drink the same juice--as long as it looks old-time modern, has a slight hipster flair, and triple the correct price, and most importantly serves flavors you cannot pronounce, you probably got a winner.  Doesn't even matter that the strawberry ice cream tastes less flavorful than Dreyer's/Breyer's from Safeway, let alone whatever non-GMO organic free range free lovin' college-learned cows were used.

A single scoop of ice cream will cost you $4.50.  Two scoops?--damn... hope you are tech salaried cause you're out $6.75.  Your kid wants a cone?--$1 more........ oh wait....... that's actually reasonable!

1. [Strawberry Something]:  As I said, it was probably the worst strawberry ice cream I've had besides the cheapest of the cheapest that you buy in bulk.  Most importantly, it had little strawberry flavor.  Secondly, there really wasn't any fruit, though I guess it's not a requirement.  Really don't get how you could screw up strawberry ice cream!?!?  Anyway, it sucked.  1/10

2. Agua de Jamaica (Hibiscus Punch):  This was actually pretty good.  Definitely taste lots of jamaica flavor, exactly how you would think it would taste.  And I guess that's the thing--it's just jamaica flavored ice cream.  $4.50 for one scoop?  6/10

3. Banana Salted Caramel:  I like this one too.  The banana flavor is very strong, yet inoffensive.  Tastes like real banana too, not some crappy artificial flavor.  However, neither of my 2 friends nor I could taste the "salted caramel" part.  7/10

4. Mango Rice:  Yeah it tastes like mango.  Couldn't tell you what prompted them to add "rice" to the name.  3/10

5. Brownie Supreme $8.00:  Two scoops.  Brownie chunks.  Drizzled chocolate sauce.  I have to admit, their brownie is damn good--extremely moist and rich.  Anyway, otherwise nothing all that special.  5/10

Bottom line--it costs more than 31 flavors, perhaps has some more exotic flavors but most are hit and miss.  And costs more than it's worth.  I think I'd rather go to 31 flavors, but admittedly it would be like going to Whole Foods after Amazon drops their prices--then I wouldn't get that I'm-better-than-you feeling no more.

2/5

#icecream #sanfrancisco
author: Dean C.

description:
This cute little ice cream place is a hidden gem in the city. It's very small, There is always a line and it does take pretty long since they also give out samples when you're deciding/ordering. BUT it's definitely worth it! 

A bit expensive but their ice creams flavors are phenomenal!!! They have some/limited traditional flavors but honestly if you're here then might try their exotic flavors that you cant find at Safeway!! (black sesame, matcha, ube, earl grey, rose...etc) They're all very distinct flavors, not too sweet. The ice cream itself is just creamy enough without being too milky. 

If you stalk their Instagram, they will tell you what day/time they have the chimney cone.
author: Veronica N.

description:
An excellent ice cream shop that's a solid alternative to big names like Bi-Rite!

I really liked the atmosphere at Garden Creamery. The white honeycomb shaped tiles and bright seating area cushions manage to be simple yet aesthetic. The owner and employees were all smiles, cracked jokes, and I enjoyed seeing them interact with regulars. It was very warm and gave me a sense of community. 

As for the ice cream, very good flavors. There are several Garden Creamery staples, as well as seasonal flavors. I would usually prefer ice cream over sorbets, but the Earl Grey tea sorbet was my favorite flavor. It tastes like an earl grey milk tea, and is very creamy. The texture is almost like ice cream! 

Another flavor I loved is Matcha Gold. It's got a pretty strong, almost bitter matcha flavor, which is offset by the toffee bits. The combination is excellent because it's still creamy and not grainy at all. I really wanted to try the Hojicha and Genmaicha, but they weren't available to make room for the holiday flavors. My friend highly recommended it, so I'll trust his (good) taste and say it's probably pretty good. There's a holiday flavor that's a spiked eggnog (called Santa's something, forgot the name whoops) that was also pretty good. I didn't get to try the chimney cone, but if you're interested, keep in mind it's only on Saturdays from 2-4PM. They gave us sugar cones for free, so that's a nice touch!

The price seemed a tad high at first, especially for the single scoop, but for that price you get two generously sized scoops and you can mix and match flavors, so it's definitely not bad at all! 

Overall, I came away very impressed with the flavors, ambiance, and friendly people here at Garden Creamery. Would definitely recommend!
author: Vincent L.

description:
Came here for the first time last night and the flavors we got were perfect. I'm a chocoholic and I'm surprised I loved my flavors so much considering they weren't chocolate. 

I got Thai iced tea and my husband got a mix of flavors: Thai iced tea, mango sticky rice and coconut. The flavors we got are all vegan btw. The workers are nice too. 

The only reason I took off one star is because the vegan chocolate option had honey in it and some vegans (such as myself) don't consider honey as vegan, cruelty free or free of animal products. Maybe they can consider using agave for us vegans and put the chocolate honey with the non-vegan flavors? Otherwise, it was overall a great experience and I can't wait to go there again!
author: Reese E.

description:
Oh my gosh, this place is so tasty! stopped by on Saturday since we're in the area and coincidentally  they only have chimney cones (churro cones) on Saturdays! It's very filling, so split with a buddy. With tax it came out to be $8.50, very soft and yummy, does easily come apart and make a mess though. A hot... tasty mess :) 

Flavors I sampled.
- matcha gold: eventually settled on this for the cone, uji matcha ice cream with toffee bits!
