- mango sticky rice: almost exact replica of the flavor of the Thai dessert , very impressed
- Japanese milk coffee: subtle coffee, but probably can skip 

Impressive selection of unique Asian flavors and also non-dairy options.
author: Wendy L.

description: Garden Creamery is my fave ice cream joint in SF. Maybe even the whole world. The flavors here are so different and not too crazy either. Every time I come here I enjoy the experience. I've gotten the chimney cake cone once and it was more lemony than I thought it would be (if you've had chimney cake in Prague, don't expect the same taste). The ice cream is so rich and flavorful. If there's cookies in your flavor or chocolate, the balance is perfect. Below is a single scoop with salted caramel w/ cheesecake bites and malted vanilla w/ brownies. THE LINE IS WORTH! Garden Creamery is mouthwatering!
author: Caitlyn S.

description:
I came to garden creamery after watching a movie. The shop is located in a corner and is pretty small. The line was out the door when I came which was around 9:00 however the line moved pretty fast. I love how there are so many unique flavors to choose from that you don't see at other ice cream shops. I also love how they have sorbets and ice cream that are vegan! They have a special churro cone which is a thick churro wrapped in a cone shape! I ordered the matcha berry ice cream which was matcha ice cream with some sort of berries that made it a little tart and sweet and it was very unique and tasted amazing!! I also got the HK style milk tea ice cream which tasted very delicious as well, it has a very strong tea flavor. My cousin ordered the Vietnamese coffee ice cream which had a lot of coffee flavor as well as the plum ice cream which included bits of real plum! ( we both got our ice cream in a cup)
FOOD RATE: 5/5 
The servers were very nice and didn't try to rush you when you tried the different flavors of ice cream! They are very welcoming and helpful to explain the differences between the flavors. 
SERVICE RATE : 4/5
The storefront is pretty small however they have some tables and a bar with stools you can sit at. It's pretty cramped but gives off a very clean atmosphere! 
INTERIOR RATE: 4/5
author: Carissa C.

description:
This has been a go to spot for my boyfriend & I. They have a wide range of flavors which are always really yummy. So, try some! My go to's are usually the black sesame, matcha, and mango sticky rice. Every here & there I'll get something different. There's usually a line, but definitely worth it!

On Saturday's only from 2-4pm, they have chimney cones which reminds me of a churro tbh. 

Its a just blocks away from a couple of parks, so get some ice cream & wander to the park or around the Mission!
author: Vangielynne P.

description:
A must-try if you're in the Mission area! (10-15min walk from the Mission Dolores Park) 

ICE CREAM:
- Both dairy/non-dairy options available
- Many Asian flavors (several types of Matcha, Thai tea, Mango w/ sticky rice, etc) 
- Definitely try allllllll the Matcha flavors. My fav was the Hojicha (roasted Matcha)!
- Another favorite: Lychee Black Tea!
- All flavors super creamy, rich, and ORGANIC

CHIMNEY CONE:
- Not... that... good ): disappointing!
- If you trynna do it for the gram, go for it. But taste/price wise, NOT worth! 
- Difficult to eat (everything tries to unwind)
- No better than Costco's $1 churro
- Doesn't go well with the ice cream
- Only available Saturdays 2-4pm
- Pricey... $8.50 with a scoop of ice cream

TIPS:
- Was in line out the door on a Saturday, but it moves quickly!
- Limited seating inside

Recommendation is to try all the flavors until you find your favorite and to NOT get the chimney cone. Maybe buy yourself a Costco churro and bring it here instead lol enjoy!
author: Reena C.

description:
Very tasty and very good! 

I had the genmaicha (sencha matcha and toasted rice) and the hojicha (roasted matcha). I love me some matcha! 

My sister had the black sesame (the best) and salted caramel cheesecake chunk.

Looking forward to coming back.
author: Angelica G.

description:
How can one say no to ice cream?! This place has some spot on ice cream! Love their selection of flavors. I like that it's always changing so you're not always stuck with the same ole same ole. Plus, it's another reason to come out here again. 

The first time I came, I actually came right before the 2pm mark on a Saturday afternoon and got to try the chimney (churro) cone. I think it was a good 20-30 minute wait, but all things considered, that's not a long time for something they only offer for 2 hours in a week. As mentioned, wth their widespread selection, I decided to go with the guava habanero in a chimney cone. I think separately, they taste pretty good, but together, it wasn't the greatest. The kick from the habanero and the cinnamon just didn't mesh well. It was my poor judgment thinking "ooh! I like guava" and "I want a chimney cone!" would work well together. Just wished it didn't melt so quickly that I felt like I had to rush to eat the chimney cone. 

Another time, I came and tried their black sesame and that was pretty good! Looking forward to trying other flavors!

My only wish is that they offered the chimney cones more often throughout the week, or at least just the weekends
author: Karen Y.

description:
Came in on a sunny Sunday afternoon, there wasn't much of a wait and I was excited to see all the flavors. the staff were super nice and very helpful. You can try as many flavors as you want! This was great because I wanted to try them all!

I ended up getting a single scoop with 2 flavors: Tea Time (matcha ice cream with shortbread) & Ube Pandan. The ice cream was so good! Creamy, delicious, full of flavor, without being overly sweet. I'm a fan of Asian flavors and Garden Creamery does this well.

I'll definitely be back. I'll be looking forward to trying more flavors! Garden Creamery is my favorite place to get ice cream in SF.
author: Sophia N.

description:
Who else came here because they heard of this place from visiting the Color Factory!? After sweating from the ball pit I had the banana ice cream sample they gave us at the end and it was the best little ice cream ever! So I bookmarked this place and checked it out myself.

I came here on a Sunday afternoon and there was a super short line, but after sitting there for 20 minutes eating my ice cream the line would become long and then short and then long again. Just be prepared to wait a long time because people sample at least 3 flavors!

I got the Madagascar Vanilla Brownie and the dark chocolate. The brownie bits in the vanilla were sooo delicious and the ice cream itself was perfectly creamy! I paired it with the dark chocolate because I thought it would go well together, and I was right! I also sampled the Banana Salted Caramel which was my second favorite! I really wanted a side of that, but it wouldn't have been good to mix with Vanilla Brownie. 


Anyway, check this place out for yourself! There's a ton of odd flavors.
author: Meliza M.

description:
Vegan ice cream!!!! Is that even a thing?  My fiancé is a vegan and we stumbled upon Garden Creamery. They have so many vegan flavors to choose from.  I remember when they were new to the neighborhood and there was always a wait. I've been a couple of times on the weekdays and there was actually no line. 

All of the flavors that I've sampled were amazing and it was hard only choosing 2. I decided to go with the taro and Thai tea (vegan). You can't even tell that there is no dairy in the vegan option. 

Saturday's they have a churro cone that I've been dying to try. I heard there is usually a wait and sometimes they run out. I'd hate to wait an hour in line and not have a chance for he churro cone.  Hopefully Garden starts selling this cone on a weekday to help avoid the tourist line.
author: Justin Y.

description: Love love love this place! Hands down the best Ube ice cream in the city (and yes, I've had Mitchell's)!  All the flavors are fully formed, fresh and absolutely delicious.  I've brought many friends here who also were pleasantly surprised.  They switch flavors frequently but they always have something new and delicious.  Plus they have many non-dairy options that are equally as delicious as the dairy inclusive options.  It's a small place and the line is frequently out the door but they work quickly and the staff is always friendly.  They focus the thrills on the flavors instead of gimmicks which I really appreciate.
author: Lauren G.

description: This is probably my new favorite ice cream shop in San Francisco. They have amazing flavors paired with quality ingredients. You will amazed by all of the flavors. The owner, Erin, is an absolute sweetheart, along with her wonderful team. I was craving nondairy Macapuna so we had to come back. This time we got the coconut ice cream, Japanese milk coffee, and my new favorite Hazelnut chunks! Double cup was not enough, I need more! I'm definitely excited to come back to try more of the flavors.
author: Fei S.

description: So good! I am vegan and the selection of vegan flavours is better than most creameries in the Bay. I do hope that there will be more vegan flavours in the future like the Ube and Matcha ones which I used to love as a vegetarian, but would love to try a vegan version of!
author: Hiyanthi P.

description:
Awesomely unique flavors! With the number of speciality ice cream spots popping up in SF, I was pleasantly surprised by how unique the flavors were at Garden Creamery. If I counted correctly, there were 4 or 5 different flavors of matcha alone! And I wanted to try them all! But I didn't. Didn't want to be THAT person. 

Okay, but I will say that I came here for the churro cone appeal. Little did I know, it's only available on Saturday's btw 2-4pm?! Something like that. I was there at 8pm on a Friday. Sad times. BUT to make up for it, they do give complimentary sugar cones, if that's what you're looking for. 

In the end, I opted for the matcha rice flavor + Mint choco. Both were excellent flavors. Maybe not together. But still excellent. Would def come back...maybe on a Saturday btw 2-4pm :)
author: Jennifer L.

description:
NEW FAV ICE CREAM SPOT !!!

They just make quality and solid Hawaiian-inspired ice cream and sorbets flavors.

You will find delicious flavors like Ube x Pandan Jelly, Hojicha (roasted green tea), Genmaicha (roasted barley), Mango Sticky Rice, Blood Orange Sorbet.

Most of the flavors are spot on, not too sweet, not too creamy, instead just a right blend of flavor and texture.

My favorite Instagramable / delicious flavor combo is Ube with Black Sesame in a single scoop split into 2 half scoops in a cone. They aren't shiesty on the scoop size so this will probably be too much to eat by yourself, I recommend sharing.

Make sure you try some different flavors, the people who work here are always super friendly and nice so don't feel shy asking for samples to try.

This place is also right off of Valencia St. so it's a great place to go during the weekends and walk around.
author: Mike L.

description:
So. Good. Not usually a fan of yams, but the ube ice cream (not to be confused with taro!) is seriously some of the best ice cream I've ever had.

The tornado cone ($8, only Sat 2-4) is pretty interesting and worth getting (or sharing!) once, but I'm usually satisfied with just getting a single ($4.50) in a waffle cone (+$1).
author: Yves L.

description:
Smooth and delicious ice cream with lots of traditional Asian flavor options like black sesame and ube. YUM! Flavors were rich but somehow not heavy or too sweet. I still prefer true frozen custard (ie Kopps in Wisconsin), but this place is one of my new favorites for SF. 

The night I went, I sampled 5-6 flavors (there was no one in line, don't hate) and ended up getting the Thai tea and ube. I also really liked the earl grey and matcha gold flavors. 

I'll be back the next time it's warm out!
author: Jean L.

description:
TLDR; My top choice for ice cream in San Francisco. 

After having tried countless ice cream locations in SF (e.g., Mr. & Mrs., Bi-rite, Humphry Slocombe, etc), I would definitely say that Garden Creamery is my favorite. 

If you are looking for your traditional flavors - vanilla, chocolate, cookies and cream - you may be disappointed. While they sometimes carry these flavors, that is not their bread and butter. You come here because you want to experience the authentic tropical / asian inspired flavors from the owner's experience in Hawaii. You come here to try out multi variations of matcha, ube (purple yam), black sesame, etc. Garden Creamery provides the most authentic ice cream flavors and never disappoints in their ice cream consistency. 

Whether you are a local or tourist, this place is a must!
author: Michelle H.

description:
I don't think I'll ever go to any other ice cream places after trying out Garden Creamery. It's literally all the flavors I would have ever possibly dreamed of in reality! 

They have so many flavors that I have never saw at any other place. I got the Matcha Gold (Uji Matcha with Toffee), Mango Sticky Rice, and Strawberry Lychee! I'm going to say I love every flavor because it's the truth! 

The Matcha was like any other Matcha I've ever tried it was the REAL DEAL! I love Matcha ice cream and this is the best. It has such a perfect and smooth Matcha taste then the toffee bits adds an extra surprise! 

The Mango Sticky Rice tasted EXACTLY like Mango Sticky Rice! If you took every dimension of it all from the mangos, the coconut milk, the rice you can literally taste each layer in every lick or bite you take. That's just how AMAZING IT IS! 

I tasted the other two flavors before deciding I wanted it. As for the Strawberry Lychee I just got it because it's my two favorite fruits put into one! Omg it was so good. You can truly taste the Lychee AND the Strawberry in equal parts. 

My friend got the Matcha Gold, Ube Buko Pandan, and Caramelized Banana and he enjoyed every flavor as well! 

They have so many more flavors I wanted to literally get a scoop of each one! 

It's super cool how for the double scoop you can get 2-3 flavors and for the single you could get 1-2! Perfect way to stack up more flavors! Also on Saturday's only from 2-4 I believe they have their chimney cones! I have to come back and try those out. 

If you're in the area YOU MUST try it out! It's so delicious!
author: Yinja L.

description:
Heard a lot of hype on this creamery. Currently, this is their only physical location, but they also have an ice cream truck and they cater at events. This is a GREAT alternative to Bi-Rite, since lines are significantly shorter and the ice cream is just as good! However, I wouldn't go as far as saying that this is the best creamery in SF or the Bay Area.

I understand the appeal however: Cute ice cream shop in the heart of the Mission. Unique flavors ranging from Black Sesame to Golden Matcha. High quality stuff- I mean, it's really creamy and they make their own waffle cones in-store!
author: Vasiliy M.

description: Expectations were high and this place did not disappoint!!!  This Ice cream is so creamy and sooo fresh!!  The flavors were so yummy!!  Many choices of ice cream to choose from and on Saturdays they have a special chimney cone from 2 to 4.  We tried many of the flavors as they were generous with their samples and help finding the perfect flavor to our liking:)
author: Cynthia H.

description:
Pretentious ice cream is my jam. Give me all your weird fusion flavors appropriating durian ice cream and combining odd things like garlic and basil. Pair that with weird toppings and cones and you've made my stomach quite happy.

If there's a line, even better...not. It took me 45 minutes to get through the door, because people take forever to sample ice cream flavors. Saturday is their notorious chimney cone day, which explained the long wait.

When we finally made it to the cases, I was pleasantly surprised to find a plethora of non-dairy flavors. It's incredibly difficult to find a non-dairy flavor that isn't simply a mango sorbet -- I sprung for a single scoop with the non-dairy fresh mint chip and banana lilikoi, which had passion fruit. You're allowed up to two flavors with a single scoop and up to three with the double scoop. My boyfriend went for their dark chocolate, ube, and strawberry flavors.

Although the chimney cone looked tasty, we really couldn't justify paying $8.50 for one scoop in it. It might be cute for the 'gram, but the fresh waffle cone tasted just as good. All of the non-dairy flavors are delicious and creamy, rather than being icy and disappointing, and I find that the fruity flavors were the best of the batch. The banana lilikoi was nicely tart and my favorite of the five flavors I was able to taste. A strong passion fruit flavor comes through, while the banana flavor's presence is noticeable and welcome without being overcoming.

It gets uber-packed in there, so take your picture and take an urban hike over to the top of Dolores Park. Miraculously, this is close to public transit, and definitely worth the stop.
author: Gwen W.

description:
Amazing!

I finally got to try this spot in the Mission and was not disappointed. They boast plenty of unique flavors and I wanted try them all! Flavors I tried: Hoji Cha, Matcha Gold (matcha + toffee bits), Ube Pandan, Black Sesame, Japanese Milk Coffee. All of them were really good, pretty true to flavor, some a little too sweet but that's just me. Definitely try the Hoji Cha if you like tea.

Will be back again!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
When you give up sweets for Lent and you come to Garden Creamery to celebrate the end of your long journey. This is the journey toward heaven. 

Garden Creamery offers a variety of unique flavors that change, so you're constantly being blessed with so many choices. I feel like I'm melting into a puddle of satisfaction whenever I try their ice cream. It's creamy, full of flavor, and solid quality. Some of my favorites: Mango Sticky Rice, Matcha Gold, and Hawaiian Butter Mochi with Toasted Sesame. I'm sure this list will grow as I continue to come back.

Their famous chimney cones are only offered on Saturday from 2-4PM. Be sure to get there early, because there will most likely be a line! The cones are soft and makes you feel all warm and fuzzy inside, ironically enough, while you eat your cold ice cream. The cone + ice cream is a great combo together. 

Overall, one of my favorite ice cream spots and "gardens" in SF. Come check it out!
author: Kristal D.

description:
With all the delicious fancy ice cream shop options in San Francisco this place really stands out for their creative and delicious flavors. I initially came here to try their chimney cone, which is a pasty like cone they only make on Saturday's from 2-4pm that's coated with cinnamon and sugar and topped with your choice of ice cream. (There serve their ice cream in traditional cone options as well as in a cup). The chimney cone made for a nice IG, but it was super good. It came out hot and fresh and it was nice the doughy/flaky, it reminded me of how a tartine morning bun pulls apart but this was in the shape of a cone with ice cream. There was a line for it but definitely worth it for a unique and delicious experience for only $8.50.
What got me to come back and now made me a regular was their ice cream flavors, much like bi-rite or Humphrey slocombe, this place makes their flavors and have very  unique flavors. My favorite was the Japanese milk coffee, which took coffee ice cream to another level for me. They offer a handful of non dairy based options which I found to be just as tasty as the dairy based. Some of the interesting flavors I sampled were the Thai tea, earl grey, matcha, bday cake, and almond ice creams. If you get there and you're not sure ask for a sample, the staff are very friendly and welcoming. The prices here are on par for most fancy ice cream shops in the area so there's no sticker shock. As far as the shop itself, it has some seating but not enough that you could come hang out especially when they are busy. My recommendation is to stop by get your ice cream and enjoy it as you walk .
author: Peter P.

description:
First time trying Garden Creamery's ice cream this last weekend and it was amazing. I visited the shop (not the food truck) and got to sample a lot of the flavors. 

Ice cream shops are everywhere, but I really do think Garden Creamery and Bi-Rite are the best ones in SF. Garden Creamery's ice cream is super creamy, made from organic dairy, and not too sweet (!!). The flavors are fun and my favorites were definitely the Ube and the Black Sesame. No crazy overpowering extracts or sugar and even the flavors that sounded "weird" didn't taste weird at all. 

The line was long but moved quickly. The service was fast but friendly. 

I'm a fan and can't wait to be back!
author: Nelya T.

description:
Dare I say it? Is Garden better than Bi-rite?! I'll have to taste a few more ice creams (excuse to go again) to make a decision as a fair and loving ice cream judge. 

PROS SO FAR:
- Shorter line than Bi-rite: The line goes out to the alley but honestly I feel like the line moves quicker? This is largely due to Bi-rite having years of fame + prime location next to Dolores, but I'll take the shorter line a couple blocks away from Dolores for ice cream that tastes just as good

- Vegan friendly: Yes! For those vegans, lactose-intolerant, and those looking for healthier options, you hit the right spot. And they're not limited to just a few flavors, there's a whole SECTION dedicated to it. Thai Tea, Early Grey, Kona Coffee, just to name a few. Flavors that usually have dairy in them. A++

- Chimney cones aka CHURRO cones: Saturdays only! These look large, but you only get one scoop because the churro is so soft and fluffy that it cannot sustain two scoops before meeting its demise on the ground. I was VERY surprised at how good these were. It was warm and fresh - fluffy on the inside and crunchy with the perfect amount of cinnamon and sugar on the outside. For maximum eating pleasure, get a paper bowl so you can lay it down and rip the cone to eat the ice cream at the same time (too barbaric? ... we did make a mess). Worth the $8.50 IMO! 

- So many UNIQUE flavors: I am in love with Ube and it is a shame it is not served nearly enough as it should be. They also do a creative job at mixing different flavors together as one flavor, for ex: Saffron Rose, Thai Peanut (with Coconut), Strawberry Lychee

- More seating: And a bathroom! Yep, now you can actually enjoy your ice cream sitting instead of standing outside, sometimes with the wind so strong, for a fleeting moment, you think your ice cream will get thrown out of your grip T_T 

They change their flavors often which we are blessed with. More the reason to be a repeat customer!
author: Vickie Z.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE. The most unique ice cream flavors that exist in SF. So many Asian-inspired tastes. :) I ordered a single, which allows you up to two flavors - the matcha gold and lychee black tea. Omg...haven't had anything like em! The matcha gold had bits of toffee in it for an added crunch and sweetness, and the matcha was potent. The lychee black tea was super interesting (never knew it was possible to experience all these flavors at once?!) Both flavors were really creamy and light. Other notable flavors that they have are mango sticky rice, guava li hing mui, and haupia chocolate almond. 

I thought the portions were perfect for $4. 

Lastly, none of the flavors are too sweet, so that's a huge plus for me. Oh, and one more plus is that they have a handful of non-dairy options!
author: Jazzica D.

description:
I have been anxiously waiting to get my butt out to SF. Ever since I changed jobs I am barely in the city anymore.

Debates should I go on Saturday from 2p-4p to try out their Churro cone or just go!

Well it happens I planned it out correctly and went on National Ice cream day.

When I arrived the line was about 30 people deep. Ugh patiently looking through the window, my thoughts were what flavors did I want? 

All Garden Creamery's flavors consist of hand crafted ice cream from scratch. Vibrant flavors and great variety of choice.

After sweating and eagerly waiting I finally decided what I wanted. 
So.. I would like a scoop of the Ube pandan and the black sesame and the matcha green tea. Pls don't judge me but I had hungry eyes lol

The outcome? I loved every lick that went to my tummy. Totes worth all the calories. I can't describe to you how satisfied I was, so if you're reading this, take your butt out to Garden Creamery. 

P.S. they also have Vegan ice cream, for those who are Vegan.

I will be definitely back for the Churro cone and more Ice cream.
author: Kathy V.

description:
Hands down my favorite ice creamery in SF! Their wide variety of Hawaiian/island-inspired flavors is what makes this place special. Whenever I visit, I can't help trying as many flavors as I can because they're all so intriguing. Never are my final choices for my ice cream order as difficult as they are here! Though I tend to favor coffee or caramel flavors in general, the mango sticky rice sorbet is my personal favorite.

The only real downside is the parking, but that's the Mission! So if you're in the neighborhood for dinner and want a unique ice cream experience like no other, visit this one-of-a-kind ice creamery! (Note: I have still yet to try their Insta-worthy chimney cone, but I certainly intend to try it soon!)
author: Ryan M.

description:
Unique flavors and truly intriguing. Most of the flavors were not super sweet in taste (super sweet =yikes) but very fun to try and nibble on.
Black sesemie was my top fav. Ice cream.
Coconut sortbet was impeccable!
Matcha was fine
Purple yam was super mellow in taste

Those who worked there was just amazing to deal with :).

Def. a place to get ur next scoop from
author: Mary N.

description: Love all these amazing flavors, I tried their habanero and guava ice cream and it leaves a kick near the end. The thai tea and mango sticky rice were definitely my favorite. I want to go back on a less busy day to try more flavors
author: Alena N.

description:
garden creamery has made its appearance on my ig feed for awhile now, so i have been eagerly waiting for the perfect opportunity to pay a little visit. i was so sad to find out that their churro cones are only offered on saturdays! shouldve done better research before coming. i settled for a regular sugar cone.

the staff was REALLY nice about letting me try as many flavors as id like. the selection had a plethora of interesting flavors, majority of them being actually tasty!

my FAV: honey dark chocolate and japanese(???) milk coffee. not too sure about the name of that second flavor..i could be wrong. both were good, but especially that honey dark chocolate. it was silky and just absolutely delicious. the honey taste balanced out the slight dark, semi-bitter taste amazingly well. it appears they rotate flavors quite often; be sure to try this flavor out if you happen to see it!
author: Abby Q.

description: Garden Creamery is easily my favorite new ice cream shop in the city. I've been here so many times and I'm pretty sure I've tried all or most of the flavors. My favorites are the Ube/Pandan, Japanese Milk Coffee, Banana Salted Caramel, Tahitian Vanilla w/Brownies, and Genmaicha. They have so many unique flavors and twists on basic flavors. The ice cream itself has such a wonderfully creamy texture. I feel guilty wanting to try them all, but the service is always so welcoming. I love this place and I can't wait to be back.
author: Elaine N.

description:
If you know me, then you know, my absolute favorite ice cream spot is Mitchell's. But I must say, this is a close second. 

First discovered Garden Creamery through instagram and I knew the next time I had a free Saturday I had to come here for their chimney cone. 

It's located in the Mission so parking is a bit difficult. When we got here the line was out the door so I knew it had to be good. They had so many different flavors I wanted to try them all! But the one that I walked away with was a scoop of Haupia Macadamia Nut on top of the chimney cone. The chimney cone is only served on Saturdays from 2-4ish, and it only comes with one scoop :( The cone itself isn't overly sweet like a churro. It was nice and doughy, it held the ice cream nicely and it was delicious. Plus they give a bowl with our chimney cone, that way you can utilize it to dip pieces of your chimney cone into you ice cream. So good! 

I definitely would come back. Only downside are their operating hours and also it's a little on the expensive side. 1 scoop of ice cream in a chimney cone for $8. Otherwise, it's another great ice cream spot added to San Francisco!
author: Mellani L.

description:
Love, Love, Love Garden Creamery.  My go to ice cream shop, with the nicest crew there is. Erin is a real gem and we love to stop by and say hi while checking out their new flavors.  We've probably sampled most of the flavors here and they are all amazing.  The texture is really smooth, flavors really strong, and I love how the ice cream isn't too sweet (unlike most ice cream shops).  

If you can catch them during Chimney cone time then it's definitely worth the trip.  Looking at the cone there are a bunch of reasons why I didn't think it would work....it's going to melt, the dough is going to absorb the ice cream, it's too thick, it's to filling....however surprisingly it was perfect.  The dough was soft but slightly crispy on the outside, with the perfect thickness so that it was light and not too doughy.  I've never had a cone like this, and it's definitely worth trying if you haven't either.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I tried a number of ice cream spots in SF, but this place is definitely my favorite and, dare I say, one of my top ice cream spots of all time!

The different types of unique and original flavors blew me away. Many of them had asian influences so you had your typical asian flavors: black sesame, thai tea, green tea, etc. But they also had flavors I had never seen before: li hing mui, guabanero, lychee black tea, japanese milk tea, and mango sticky rice.

I ended up splitting one scoop with lychee black tea and hojicha (roasted matcha). The hojicha was great but the lychee black tea definitely stole the show! It was sweet and fruity but had enough flavor from the tea to balance everything out. It's probably one of my top 5 favorite ice cream flavors. The cone was almost like a buttery waffle cookie - SO GOOD! 

You better believe I'll be back during my next SF trip!
author: Ellen J.

description:
Oh man! When I saw the photos for the chimney cone i kneeeew I had to get it. Cinnamon pastries are the bee's knees, and Garden Creamery's chimney cone is the perfect size with the right amount of sweetness.

I expected there to be a line since the chimney cones are only available from 2-4 on Saturdays. At 2:30, the line wrapped around the corner but the wait wasn't long at all (roughly 10 minutes). Two employees to help sample each flavor. I really regret not trying more flavors (felt bad...) Matcha and black sesame are sooooo good though. Didn't care for the ube. Unfortunately, you can only get one scoop (I really wanted both on there HAHA) per chimney cone. 

While the ice cream flavors were delicious, the two didn't necessarily compliment the cinnamon cone. My friend thought vanilla might be a good flavor... I think strawberry might be a good one! Anywho - I'm sure you won't be able to go wrong with any flavor. We still killed it super fast because it was really delicious. 

I am hesitant to give Garden Creamery five stars because at $8 per cone, that is one expensive ice cream dessert. The price is reasonable with other options though.... so perhaps the next time I come here I'll try more flavors and get a (much) cheaper cup.
author: Cathy C.

description:
To my dearest East Bay ice cream lovers,

I am writing to inform you of this PSA: Garden Creamery has the flakiest, most buttery waffle cones in all of norcal. They have unique and inventive ice cream/sorbet flavors with lots of them being asian-inspired. The flavors I chanced upon are as follows:

Matcha gold - I almost always order a matcha scoop if one is available. The matcha was on the milder side but the nugget provided a nice bite.
Japanese milk coffee - you know the plastic bottle coffee with the white cap you normally buy at the Japanese market in Japantown? It tastes exactly like that.
Earl Grey - very lovely and potent.
Banana salted caramel - you definitely have to love bananas because every lick is like a banana smoothie. So good.
Fresh mint chip - not that seafoam green goodness but that yeah-you-bet-I-made-this-by-blitzing-a-handful-of-fresh-mint-leaves.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
My friends and I were in the Mission District on a Saturday, and we decided to try Garden Creamery after hearing people rave about the place for months. They are known for the chimney cone, which is basically a cinnamon-dusted bread roll, that is available on Saturdays. The chimney cone was $8, and I couldn't justify spending that much for ice cream, so I opted for the regular small scoop on a sugar cone. 

I tried all of their tea flavors, including earl gray, thai tea, matcha and hojicha. The flavors that most stood out to me were the earl gray and hojicha; the other two had only a faint tea flavor. The ice cream consistency was smooth, but nothing too special --to my surprise, the thai tea flavor was actually somewhat icy when I tried it. I decided on the hojicha and the ube, which was a vibrant purple color. The ice cream tasted good, but it was honestly nothing special.

The lines were also super long! We waited almost 30 min for ice cream, and it wasn't too special. The experience was really a 3.5/5, but I am rounding it to a 4 since they are pretty innovative and their ice creams were fresh.
author: Sandra S.

description:
It's been a long time since I've gotten an icecream cone and I came here for one with my coworker when he told me about this place! Originally, we wanted to come here for the Chimney cone, but we soon realized they only have it on Saturdays from 2-4pm!

I love Garden Creamery because they have a huge variety of unique flavors or Ice Cream and Frozen Yogurt especially asian flavors! I got the small for myself which includes two scoops (1-2 flavors) and it was $4.50! The flavors I got were Ube and matcha toffee. Both flavors were really good.

Overall, I will definitely come back to try their other flavors! It is only a few blocks from bart and it is Summer season so I can't wait o come back!
author: Allie Y.

description: Very delicious and some unusual ice cream! Mango, coconut and a salted plum/ green Matcha were the latest I had there. They are just open in the evening, so check the hours before you go.
author: Karen J.

description:
Finally made it out here on Saturday around 2 to try both the ice cream and the rare chimney cone (only available Saturdays 2-4PM). We sampled a few flavors and chose the Genmaicha and Macadamia nut flavors. Man, these two were so good! The Genmaicha was strong enough so that you could tell what tea flavor it was (and I LOVE Genmaicha) and Garden Creamery has got their ice cream consistency so creamy and so right. The Macadamia nut had real macadamia pieces sprinkled in and it was so light and the nut flavor also really shines through. The chimney cone was like a soft churro. It was more of a side star to the ice cream but glad to have tried it. It could definitely stand on its own as a dessert pastry. 
Chimney cone + scoop = ~$8
Single scoop = ~$4

Parking in the mission sucks but you've got to give Garden Creamery a try. Their unique flavors make them quite the contender to nearby Bi Rite, plus the line (at least for when I went) wasn't ridiculously long. I can't wait for my next visit!
author: Christine L.

description:
I've been Bi-Rite faithful since day one, BUTTTT after trying Garden Creamery I think there's enough room for both of them to share the #1 spot in my heart. 

This place is a must if you're into Asian-y flavors i.e. black sesame, teas of all kind such as hojicha and Thai tea which btw is vegan - wuuuuuut! I've tried all of those and they were A M A Z I N G. Ugh, the black sesame was literally the best I've ever had *cue Drake*

Their waffle cone is also really good! Super crispy. 

With so many flavors left to try, I will definitely be back, and back, and back again!
author: Laverne N.

description:
Second time back here in like a week. Again a great neighborhood icecream shop with fantastic assortment of flavors. 

Got the pickles strawberry and golden matcha. The latter was incredible.
author: Sean W.

description:
I love love love this ice cream place. I came at around 11, right before they close. There were still lots of people waiting in line. 

They offered a wide range of unique ice cream flavors. I tried almost every unique flavors under the encouragement of friendly staff. I have to admit, their tea flavored ice cream were amazing. My favorite among the one I tried are Ube (not too many places selling Ube flavor ice cream!! If you don't know, Ube is Japanese purple yam), black sesame (so rich in sesame taste! Love it), geimaicha (nice tea flavor and not too rich dairy taste) and guava (it was refreshing but has a mild spicy kick). Kinda sad that they didn't have the sticky mango rice flavor when I went. Definitely will revisit again!
author: Clare L.

description:
Someplace BETTER THAN BiRite? YEEEES!

This place just opened up 3 months ago and I can't believe I am just finding out about them! What a find! They have a ton of unique ice cream flavors, many of them tea infused, as well as a huge selection of non-dairy flavors which include coconut milk options as well as fruit sorbets. 

Price is high and a bit more than BiRite but the ice cream here is better so in my opinion well worth paying a premium. Just comparing the black sesame flavor with the one at BiRite, I get much more black sesame flavor with less sugar and it's a little more grainy so you get more of a mouth feel for the sesame in the ice cream. 

Today I got the Mango Li-Hing Mui and Guava Serrano. Wow o wow that Guava Serrano is fantastic! This is definitely my new favorite ice cream spot in the city.

We came middle of the week around 2pm so there was no line and parking was not too horrendous. I'm sure if you try to come on a weekend, parking on Mission and Valencia is a nightmare so maybe BART or Lyft is the better option. There is probably also a line so try to come during off hours if you can. If not, it's worth the wait so go anyways.
author: Betty R.

description:
---- ICE CREAM FLAVOURS ----

GC Waffle: 4 stars

Hojicha: 4.5 stars
Roasted Oolong: 4.5 stars
These two taste really similar to me... but I love my tea anyway!

Banana Caramel: 4 stars

Ube Pandan: 4 stars

Matcha Gold: 3 stars

Mango Sticky Rice: 2.5 stars
I've yet to find a dairy-free ice cream that I really like. Does Ben and Jerry's froyo count?
author: Letitia L.

description:
We were intrigued by the line out the door and decided to see what all the fuss was about. It happened to be during the two hours a week (Saturdays from 2-4pm) that they sell chimney cones, which are essentially cones made out of pastry dough and covered in cinnamon sugar, so of course we had to get one. A chimney cone can only hold one scoop, so we split one chimney cone between the two of us and ordered extra scoops separately. It's so soft and buttery, and goes really well with the ice cream.

I generally don't like overly sweet ice cream, so I really appreciated their large variety of flavors. I got the Ube Pandan Coconut & Genmaicha, both of which were AMAZING, and had really unique tastes. The ube pandan coconut is a strong flavor, and the coconut really comes through. It was a little too sweet for me, but I still enjoyed it. My favorite was the genmaicha (green tea + toasted rice), which I think actually had chunks of toasted rice in it, adding a nice texture. I'll definitely be back to try other flavors!
author: Apoorva A.

description:
Another great ice cream spot in the SF Bay Area! Pink storefront is just as vibrant as the delicious and colorful ice cream Garden Creamery is churning. It's refreshing they have a variety of flavors that differs from some of the other most popular ice cream shops in the area and they are executing fantastically well.

Sure, Ube and Matcha flavors are getting more and more popular these days and they offer them, but only here have I found flavors like Butter Mochi and Banana Lilikoi to name a few. Also, almost half the case are vegan flavors and not all of the flavors are Hawaiian/Asian focused. There's something for everyone.

All of those positives led me there but the taste and quality got me sold. The flavors are strong and shine nicely in the ice cream, the texture pleasantly creamy. Also, they are licensed to pasteurize their own base, not a super common but pro-practice. Definitely looking forward to more trips to Garden Creamery in the future.
author: Lindsey C.

description:
My best friends have turned me into ice creamaholics.  After every dinner or drinking escapade, we inevitably wind up at an ice cream place.

Garden Creamery is in the rotation.

They have a good selection of exotic flavors (guava habanero anyone?), and their single scoop is actually two scoops and yes, you can have two different flavors.

Staff does take their time and lets you sample as many as you want.  It's best to go either very early or very late to avoid the crowds.
author: Ron L.

description:
I've tried a handful of legendary ice cream shops in San Francisco, and I can now declare that Garden Creamery is my absolute favorite, which is a big statement! I can't believe I haven't tried this place sooner and it's a bit dangerous that it's within walking distance from my apartment in the Mission... I must find some self-control!

I was amazed by the unique selection of ice cream flavors they have to offer here. They have flavors such as Mango Sticky Rice, Ube, & Black Sesame. I opted for the Hojicha and Genmaicha Ice Cream and it was seriously love at first bite. I loved the roasted green tea flavor and couldn't get it enough. I devoured the 2 scoops of ice cream within minutes and was left craving more! 

If you're a huge fan of asian ice cream flavors, than Garden Creamery is your place to go. I'm getting my wisdom teeth removed soon and I'm sure the ice cream here is all I'll be indulging in! I'm definitely trying the churro cone next time too!
author: MyTien P.

description:
I have never not been 100% satisfied at Garden Creamery. Seriously, the ice cream here is tip top, whether you're dairy free and sorbet minded or into full-on salted caramel creamy goodness.

Yesterday I had the salted caramel banana flavor and it tasted like my childhood banana shakes mixed with ribbons of pure homemade-tasting caramel - and not too salty to boot. Def get this if they happen to have it!

The Tahitian vanilla brownie is like a choco chip ice cream on crack - the vanilla must really be scraped from real vanilla beans in house because there is no other way to get such a perfect flavor. And I NEVER like vanilla because it truly bores me.

The third flavor I'd recommend is the japanese milk coffee - so subtle, and not overly sweet! For coffee lovers out there.
author: Farrah N.

description:
I came in at an off-time and was the only customer in the store.  It might go without saying I got excellent service.

I was encouraged to try whatever I wanted.  I only needed 3 samples to make up my mind though.  I settled on the banana salted caramel and the haupia macadamia nut.

I got a "double" which in retrospect wasn't necessary.  A "single" would've done fine.  You can get 1-2 flavors in the single and 2-3 in the double.  The double is a pretty big portion, and probably not responsible (not for me anyway).

It was $6.50 and a very generous portion.  Pricing is in line with most any other ice cream shop in the area.

Try out their unique flavors!  Lots of stuff here you might not see elsewhere.
author: Brent T.

description:
Wait - Roughly a 20 minute wait around 3:00 pm on Sunday.

Value - $4.50 for a single scoop (1 or 2 flavors)

Dish Size: Medium sized. 

Thai Tea - Tasted exactly like thai iced tea condensed milk. The one thing I did notice was the texture was a bit different because it didn't contain dairy. Therefore resulting in an ice cream in a less creamy texture.

Black Sesame - I really enjoyed the Black Sesame flavor. The toasted sesame flavor paired nicely with the creaminess of the ice cream. 

Earl Grey - I was surprised by the prominence of the Earl Grey flavor. Usually the subtly of the tea flavors get lost in the ice cream but the Early Grey is forefront and not an aftertaste.

Genmaicha - Similar to the Earl Grey, I was surprised that the tea flavors were so prominent. You can definitely taste the Genmaicha in every bite. 


I'm a bit biased towards Garden Creamery mainly because they tend to favor asian eccentric flavors. If you enjoy asian desserts, then Garden Creamery is definitely your place. They have a wide variety of flavors ranging from traditional Black Sesame to more exotic flavors like Mango Sticky Rice. What I liked about the ice cream was that it wasn't overly sweet.  

Located just off Valencia, it'll be hard to miss Garden Creamery. On a warm day, you can count on a seeing a line snake out of the store and around the building. So if you decide on Garden Creamery, be sure to calculate at least a 20 minute wait. The space itself is not large, with only very few seats in the back. I would recommend getting your ice cream and walking down the street and finding a spot on a stoop. 

Garden Creamery is a solid ice cream joint with a lot of exotic flavors to choose from. If you are a fan of asian flavors, this is the place for you. If you're not big into asian flavors, then there's a few other ice cream joint right around the corner to choose from.
author: Julian L.

description: This has to be one of my favorite ice cream places in SF. The flavors are unique and delicious. There is an array of flavors, which my go-to's and faves are: Match Gold, Mango Sticky Rice, etc. Ughhhh it's soooo delicious on a hot and cold day!! I recommend it to everyone who is willing to head over to the Mission and try it!
author: Loreah D.

description:
Delicious and such courteous staff! I was bummed to find out that the Chimney cone is only sold between 2-4pm on Saturday. I got over it real quick..after tasting their dynamite flavors. They had some truly unique flavor combos, and I enjoyed trying nearly all them. 

I opted for the Genmaicha and Ube combination on a sugar cone. Definitely a plus that the sugar cones are free and take me back to a simpler childhood, filled with lots of sugar. The Genmaicha ice cream was so creamy and toasty, and the Ube had the perfect amount of sweetness. 

Needless to say, I thoroughly enjoyed my first visit to Garden Creamery, and encourage you all to visit!
author: Monica S.

description:
Flavors: as with most ice cream places, you can get as many samples as you want. But in this case, it only took me 3 samples to decide on what I wanted which was the valhala chocolate but once I ordered the server informed me that in the single scoop you can get two flavors so I opted for the ube pandan since I've had it a lot growing up. 

Price: $4.50 total for single scoop with 1-2 flavors 

Parking: street parking in a crowded area, may the odds be in your favor 

Seating/ambiance: medium volume music playing, small corners of tables of chairs and benches

The workers that day I came were really nice so that's always a plus :)
author: Lili L.

description:
Went to get the chimney cone on Saturday and saw that there was a line. I guess I'm not the only one with a list of highly instagrammed ice creams 

I loved the variety of flavors that they had, especially all the different types of matchas! I think it's rare to see all those different matcha flavors, and it was really great to get to sample all of them. My friend and I wanted to get two scoops with a chimney cone, but the worker informed us that the cone isn't strong enough to support two scoops. Apparently the people that take pictures of the cone with two scoops buy a separate scoop and place it on top themselves for the picture!!

We shared a single scoop with the chimney cone and it was just right! The cone was absolutely delicious and went so well with the ice cream. As the ice cream melted the cone soaked up the liquid a bit and it just tasted so good. 

I would definitely recommend this place. Even with a line, the wait wasn't long at all!
author: Hanna K.

description:
After all the raves I have been hearing, I finally was able to come here with a friend on a Saturday afternoon. Surprisingly it was not packed even though it was a hot day (probably  because it was Pride weekend). The first time we drove by on a weekend, it was wrapped along probably an hour wait, so be prepared.

After a 15 minute wait it we were able to taste test a few of their delicious and exotic flavors (guava habanero, strawberry/lychee, hojicha)  I loved their salted caramel banana and lihing mango! They also have a huge selection of sorbets (perfect for a vegan!). It was extremely creamy but without that "fatty" residue taste on the roof of your mouth. My friend got the churro cone and did not like it stating it's just cakey... more for the Instagram photo. 

I highly recommend this creamery for some exotic flavors and can't wait to come back!
author: Sharon L.

description:
Another awesome ice cream spot in SF, and it's my favorite place to go for ice cream after getting Mexican food in the mission. The quality is similar to all the top ice cream spots with smooth and creamy texture for all of the ice cream. I think where garden creamery stands out is the unique flavor combinations, especially with a twist on Asian flavors.

The ube and thai tea is flavorful, and I definitely want to come back and try some of their other flavors here!
author: Kevin C.

description:
I tried the Tahitian vanilla brownie and it was dope. 

Tahitian vanilla is where it's at, man. Vanilla is no longer boring.
author: Cynthia G.

description: Love this place. It gets busy and there's not a lot of seating inside... the line wraps around the corner and can go fast or slow depending on who is ahead of you. I loved the pandan-ube flavor and the Japanese milk coffee. The HK milk tea. Tahitian vanilla brownie, and black sesame were great as well. I love how unique their flavors are - very asian inspired. The owners are from Hawaii. Of note, if you wanted your ice cream in a bowl and a cone on top, they will charge an extra 25 cents. For me, the ice cream was unique enough and good enough to where I would wait in that line again
author: Cindy L.

description:
Had this place bookmarked for ages and I was so excited to finally get to try it. This place definitely ranks at the top of my ice cream lists! Came on a Friday around 8pm and there was a short line and a few people in the store. 

There flavors are more unique than most places but also not quite crazy. They serve quite a few Asian inspired flavors and have a wide selection of sorbets. For my 3 scoops I got the Genmaicha, Matcha Gold (Matcha w/ Toffee bits), and the Li Hing Mui (sweet salty plum). Wow I was blown away. All the flavors are so strong and fresh and the texture was perfectly creamy for the ice creams. The sorbet (Li Hing Mui) wasn't as creamy but very refreshing and it went well with the other flavors. The matcha gold I would pass on in the future but it was fun to try once.

My friends got the Strawberry w/ Umeboshi and another friend got the earl grey tea + black sesame. I wasn't as big a fan of the strawberry w/ umeboshi because the umeboshi wasn't strong enough compared to the strawberry. My friend's earl grey was good but I believe it was a sorbet and I definitely would prefer an ice cream version. The black sesame was rich and delicious though.

Overall Garden Creamery is wonderful! The only downside is that it's definitely more costly than even some of the nicer ice cream places in the city. I believe I paid ~$8 for a fairly small cup (it was three scoops but not 3 big scoops). Still worth it though. Can't wait to come back especially for the chimney cone.
author: Vivian C.

description:
I'm at about a 3.5 for this place. 

This is another place I definitely found and chose because of the gramability (yes, that is a word that I may have just made up). The chimney cone was what I was after so I knew I had to get in line and just wait my turn. 

I was able to try a few different flavors, but went with an old favorite of cookies and cream. I ended up trying the Matcha gold - not a super sweet matcha flavor, but dotted with toffee bits - bitter, with a little bit of sweetness. Also, the Genmaicha, which is a roasted tea, delicious, but I knew I couldn't have a WHOLE school of it. 

Just be forewarned, the chimney cone has a whole at the bottom so if you don't eat fast enough, it definitely gets a little messy. Also, the one I got was just slightly undercooked I felt. I thought it was just a little doughy - not much, but slightly. 

Protip: get there between 2-4PM on a Saturday and get a great flavor in a chimney cone.
author: Nina Y.

description:
So good! I love all the flavors, and actually had a hard time choosing two. Ugh! I would so love to work here and be able to sample every flavor everyday, all day!! I wish I wasn't so far away from this place, or I would be a frequent customer. I eventually decided on the black sesame and genmaicha one! Both great! 

My friend got the chimney cone with black sesame and though it looks great, it was a bit too much. The cone wasn't really a great addition or pairing with the ice cream, which is already sweet. It was like have a slightly dried donut. I say, enjoy your ice cream alone or with a traditional cone!
author: Kelsey C.

description:
Came here for the first time on a Saturday afternoon around 1pm and there was no line. I've been wanting to try this place after seeing all the positive reviews on yelp.

Once I walked in, I was greeted by a very friendly employee. I told her it was my first time there and she explained their popular flavors and encouraged me to try as many flavors as I wanted. I tried at least 7 flavors and loved all of them! I ended up opting for the mango sticky rice, golden matcha, and coconut pandan. If I could have had 5 scoops of ice cream in one cone, I totally would have! That's how good the ice cream was!! 

I will definitely be back!
author: Clarissa L.

description: Much too creamy for my liking. Although the ice cream itself tastes good, i prefer smoother and lighter ice cream types like Matcha love and the ones in Japan. I do like how this place has a ton of Asian flavors like Genmaicha, Hojicha, HK milk tea, ube and pandan. I personally tried a double with Genmaicha, Black Sesame, and Japanese Milk Coffee. Of the three, i liked Genmaicha the best. The matcha flavor was really strong and just the way I like it. Three scoops will set you back $7 which is pretty steep, in my opinion. And this is coming from the girl willing to pay $5 for a scoop of ice cream in Japan. The flavors and textures are just not comparable but it all comes down to personal preference. If you like creamy ice creams like Dreyers, you will probably like this place!
author: June Y.

description: Amazing flavors! Fantastic quality! I really appreciate they use local and organic ingredients. Also, love their dairy-free selection. Helpful staff! Love coming back here!
author: Kristina Y.

description: I cant say enough about this place. Today was especially Amazing the Banana Lilikoi was perfect as well as the special flavor for Chinese New Year. Both Owners are hands on and take quality serious. My advice is go try it and you will know why they are my favorite ice cream in the city.
author: Manny G.

description: I had their vegan Thai ice tea and the earl grey ice cream. I don't what sort of milk alternative they used for their vegan ice cream, but I can't tell what it is. It's not like the tea flavors are masking over anything. The tea is strong but not overpowering and perfectly complements whatever milk alternative is in the ice cream. This vegan ice cream actually tastes and feels like ice cream, smooth and creamy. This is what all vegan ice creams should aspire to be.
author: Norman S.

description: Came here on a hot Saturday afternoon and found relief with the ice-cream! They had many Asian flavors, which were really unique. I ended up choosing Ube and HK Milk Tea, which are both very creamy and strong-flavored. Would highly recommend and come back!
author: Tammy T.

description:
Oh duuuuude, this place is amazing! So many unique flavors-- and I believe they change out their flavors frequently as well, so that's nice! (Also could be a bad thing, but hey we're being positive here.) We sampled the majority of the flavors available (we shared samples kkkk, we weren't thaaaat annoying!), and they were honestly ALL good!! 

A single scoop can have two flavors, and I ended up with matcha toffee and hazelnut crunch. Very generous portion sizes here! I found the ice cream incredibly creamy-- perfect texture. It wasn't too sweet, yet still flavorful at the same time. I can't wait to come back to try other flavors I haven't yet!

Service was also super friendly, and our lovely ice cream scooper constantly encouraged us to sample other flavors and gave suggestions. Oh, and the churro cone is only available Saturdays 2-4pm... I wish they had it on an everyday basis, but I believe they make it fresh and it takes a while to make.. so I guess it's understandable.

Will be back, for sure!
author: Kris C.

description:
Amazing choice of flavors! I love love the texture of their ice cream-- sort of chewy(?). 

My bf and I had to wait in line for a while but it was worth it! They let you try as many flavors as you want. I wanted to buy everything, but I just couldn't.. I was so sad hahaha 

I got the mango sticky rice and Ube and they were both amazing.
author: Rina P.

description: UM. Where has this place been all my life?!? I think it's my new favorite ice cream spot! The flavors are so unique and well done! Some of my faves are the genmaicha, butter mochi, ube with pandan, and mango sticky rice! The texture is smooth, not icy and all the flavors I've tried never seem to be too sweet! I'm hooked.
author: Christina C.

description:
Oh I needed to sit down before I gave myself an aneurysm raving about this place. Oh my god. Literally one of the best ice cream experiences I have ever had in my entire life. I'm not sure how they make their ice cream, but dang they do it well. 

I dropped by just before opening time (3:00 pm) on a Wednesday. There were a few eager souls *like me* waiting at the door, but not much of a line. Once the doors opened we were all greeted warmly and allowed to sample a plethora of flavors before deciding on what we wanted. The great thing about Garden Creamery is that they have something for everyone. There are a variety of flavors from thai tea to cookies and cream and there are a good amount of dairy vs non-dairy options. You can enjoy your ice cream in a cup, cone, or chimney cone (only during certain weekend hours). 

Cake and sugar cones are free whereas it is $1 for a waffle cone. I ended up getting the thai tea (non-dairy!) and the japanese milk coffee in a waffle cone. First off, I was thrilled that my waffle cone was literally still warm! Definitely made me feel like I was getting something fresh for that additional $1 charge. I say that the waffle cone is a must! It was flaky, buttery, and sweet. It held together well and didn't overwhelm the ice cream in terms of flavor. 

I highly recommend this place to basically everyone who likes eating delicious food items.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
-unique ice cream flavors (including several different types of green tea)
-churro cone served only during certain times but definitely worth it! A must-have if you're coming here
-expect to wait in line for awhile
author: David K.

description: Super friendly staff that will great you will a smile. Shop is super cozy.  You can try lots of flavors. On any given day they do have few vegan options and the creamy and yummy and vegan cones are available as well. CC accepted.
author: Magda G.

description:
Came back here for the n-th time and got the Ube coconut pandan with Haupia. I was sooo sad when I didn't see my fav coconut pandan flavor on the case but then i noticed the Ube coconut pandan and decided to give it a try. Oh boy, my sadness was instantly lifted away. 

Ube coconut pandan taste pretty much the same as the coconut pandan with a hint of ube which makes it even more special. This version of Ube ice cream is much better than your typical Ube ice cream. Its so delicious you have to get this or any other flavors they have. 

I also forgot to mention that they do have chimney cones available only on Saturday from 2pm to 4pm.
author: Valerie H.

description:
Came back to try this place since they first opened and they're still BOMB AF! I was raving to my friend about how delicious the ice cream here is, so we decided to pay a visit to Garden Creamery after already having dessert at another place (no judgement plz) 

This time around I ordered a single scoop in a waffle cone. I opted for the Hawaiian Butter Mochi w/ Toasted Sesame & Hazelnut Crunch!

Both were absolutely delicious! The toasted sesame seeds add so much fragrance to the Hawaiian Butter Mochi flavor. As for the other scoop, if vanilla, Nutella, and Ferrero Rocher made love and had a baby, the product would be Hazelnut Crunch!
author: Zizi W.

description:
Conveniently, I was in the Mission right before 2pm on a Saturday so I figured I'd stop by to try the famous chimney cone. A lot of my friends on Instagram have been raving about this place and they did a good job doing PR work so I figured it was worth a shot. I arrived about 20 minutes before 2pm so the place was still pretty empty and they let us try samples until we knew what we wanted. They had 3 different matcha variations and we decided the Genmaicha (matcha with toasted rice) tasted the best and decided to get that for our order. With the chimney cone, you can only get 1 flavor which was unfortunate. It's also a whopping $8!! It is without a doubt overpriced. 

We then patiently waited for it to turn 2:00 while the place got more and more packed. There is only a few counter seats and about 4 tables so the place doesn't accommodate large crowds easily. I figured the staff knew how to handle the large crowd but it was so hectic and there was no line formed by the time the chimney cones were coming out. The cool thing was that we could see the cones being made in the kitchen through a window. Luckily, I got to make my order quickly before everyone else because I had come in before the rush. I then ate it as quickly as possible because it started to melt so quickly!! To be honest, the chimney cone actually tasted better than I expected - it was doughy inside like bread, which is my favorite. It wasn't good enough for me to come back and I do think they should work on their organization of handling crowds for the future.
author: Catherine S.

description:
Garden Creamery

This was my second attempt coming to this place. I arrived on a Thursday night roughly around 7pm. The first time was back in June when the lines went out the doors so I had to pass. My friend and I bet the line by 10 minutes so I suggest coming a little early before serious prime-time dessert time. Finally, today's the day I'll be able to indulge in getting lost with the chimney cone. There weren't any in sight so I'll try again next time.

I was immediately greeted by friendly staff and was told I can try as many flavours as I want! I asked my scooper if he was sure about that but he was all in all polite and patient with me. I tried out one flavour and was sold right then and there. I ended up ordering a double scoop of Black Sesame & Ube Pandan Coconut (purple yam with coconut, a Filipino delicacy)  which I found to be A+. Next time I know to ask to put the Ube on top instead of the black sesame since it overpowered the other. 

I cannot wait to try other flavours .... and the cone!!!
author: Liza H.

description:
Don't fall victim to the Saturday chimney cone hype. Trust me folks, it's not all that, especially since you're only permitted one scoop if you opt for it (additional $3.00 for an additional scoop--BOO). Just go for the traditional cone or cup. 

Focus on appreciating all of the intriguing ice cream flavors. I was SO close to being THAT annoying person in line wanting to try every tempting flavor. The day of my visit I only got to sample the Hawaiian Butter Mochi (a tad bit too sweet for my liking) and I ordered a scoop of the Genmaicha flavor: a beautiful marriage of green tea and toasted brown rice. I recommend this *not too sweet* flavor if distinguishable nutty and roasted flavors delight you. The ice cream from here is exquisitely creamy. No doubt I want to come back to try more of their other flavors! 

+ Vegan sorbets are available! 100% plant-based made w/ coconut milk and agave nectar
author: Merica S.

description:
One of my new favorite ice cream spots in SF! A bright red shop right on the corner. This place offers flavors of ice creams I've never seen before.  Parking is a pain in the mission as always. :/

Hojicha ( roasted milk tea), ceremonial milk tea, mango sticky rice, Thai iced tea -- and all in ice cream form? YES. When I heard milk tea ice cream, my first thought was, "WHY DIDNT I THINK OF THAT.. just genius"

The vegan ice cream is all on the left side and non vegan on the right. Honestly, they really did a good job w their vegan ice cream! Everything I've tried is really rich and flavorful. The hojicha, mango sticky rice and the black sesame so far are my top 3 favorites! 

I love this place haha! They let you try all the flavors before you get them so definitely come in and check it out. The line can get long, but it's kinda fast. 100% worth it!
author: Melanie T.

description:
I've tried so many highly rated ice cream joints in SF from Bi-Rite to Mitchell's to Humphry Slocombe and none have won me over the way that Garden Creamery has.

First off, they have a great, friendly staff who was willing to allow me to sample as many ice cream flavors and I wanted. There is a great variety of flavors here with many asian/hawaiian inspired flavors as the owner comes from Hawaii! I definitely enjoyed the ube pandan, black sesame, matcha gold (which was matcha with toffee) and japanese milk coffee flavors. The ice cream was rich, creamy and flavorful. For those who are vegan or... cannot... tolerate milk, they do have ice creams with coconut milk as a base that are just as delicious.

Of course, I came on a day where the chimney cone wasn't made... so I actually came back on Saturday slightly before 2 to grab one. The cone itself was like a cinnamon flavored brioche. It was light and fluffy, however it will drip and get messy therefore ask for it in a bowl. 
Definitely coming back again. Also, the various bright colors and the chimney cone make for a pretty picture so come for the gram, snap, or whatever it is you like to use to make your friends jealous of what you're eating.
author: Ashley W.

description:
The ice cream tour continues! Garden Creamery offers some awesome unique flavors and serves it up in generously sized scoops as well.

I had a scoop of Hazelnut Crunch and a scoop of hoji-cha. Not going to lie, I was hoping for Nutella in ice cream form and let me tell you, I was not disappointed. The Hazelnut Crunch tastes like a cross of Nutella and a Ferrero Rocher so basically freaking amazing. The little bits of hazelnut also provided some nice crunch and texture. The hoji-cha had a delicious roasted taste and had a natural sweetness from just the tea flavor so it didn't feel too sweet on the tongue. My friend had a scoop of the mango sticky rice which was delicious as well. Certainly unique, it had a delicious natural mango taste and almost no hint of artificial flavors.

For a creamery in the heart of the Mission, I was really surprised by the number of Asian-inspired flavors like mango sticky rice, hoji-cha, genmaicha and black sesame. Tasting these flavors in ice cream is still pretty novel to me as a recently budding ice cream connoisseur so I'll definitely be back to try some more!
author: Jason W.

description:
Dairy and non dairy organic options.  Most people opt for the chimney cone after 2pm special is perfect to share on date night, really too much for one as if you take longer than 15min to finish are left with a soggy mess on a hot summer day.  Usually opt for the single cup (honey dark chocolate) can be split into 2 flavors, is a good portion for $4.50.  For $1 more ask the the waffle cone upside down on top of cup scoops to avoid the mess. 
Full flavored dark chocolate with raw honey flavor hit the sweet spot.
    Inside seating on a hot day was full, the line was about a 15min wait at 2:30pm was not horrible.  Would go again but look for free non metered parking around 21st and Guerrero is 1-2hrs is close enough to walk with minor uphill builds the appetite to nosh on a cool treat when you get there.
author: David K.

description: We got there around 3pm on a Saturday and the line was not too bad. We waited about 10 minutes to get our turn.  The staff were nice and very willing to help us try the ice cream flavors.  We love the variety of flavors available.  Tried Thai Ice Tea flavor and the Matcha flavor. Both were good.  I already had my mind set on the matcha flavor from a recommendation from a friend so I got the matcha+toffee flavor in the chimney cone.  Chimney cone is only available during weekends 2pm-4pm.  I would've like a more authentic bitter matcha taste so the ice cream was just okay. The chimney cone reminds me of a churro + cinnamon roll. Its dusted with cinnamon sugar.  I will probably just get a waffle cone or sugar cone next time, the chimney cone is kinda heavy. Imagine eating your ice cream with a cinnamon sugar dusted crisp dinner roll.  Would've liked that the chimney cone can come with two flavors of ice cream too but it has a fixed price of $8 with a scoop of ice cream.
author: Abby Q.

description: dilemma, really want them to get the recognition but don't want the line any longer. I've tried 90% of the san Francisco ice cream spots and by far this is the best. they dont try too hard with their combintion flavors just to seem complex but keep it real simple but don't really really well. flavors ranging from plum to matcha, they taste exactly like the name where you wouldn't even have to sample the flavors but you'll definitely want to just because they're so good. plus service is great, they aren't snobby or pretentious at all and you don't feel rushed. great place again best ice cream in the city.
author: David K.

description:
I was SO excited for the chimney cones, but sadly, they're not worth the hype. 

The first time I tried Garden Creamery, I was blown away by how creamy their ice cream was. All their flavors were really tasty and unique, and the creaminess was consistently present. 

Chimney cones are only available on Saturdays from 2-4pm. There's a consistently long line, so be prepared to wait.

I was expecting a churro-like cone, however, this was just bread with cinnamon sugar. The cone was also extremely messy to eat and you had to eat it fast before it melted everywhere--I was not a fan. Also, at $8 a pop (with only 1 scoop of ice cream), I was left extremely disappointed.

Don't get me wrong though, their ice cream is excellent! You're better off getting a cup or cone/waffle cone.

TL;DR - I'd stop by if I was in the area and craving ice cream, but I will not be waiting in line again for the chimney cone.
author: Shirley H.

description:
If you're looking for super creamy, almost gelato-like ice cream, Garden Creamery is where it's at! It's hard to find an ice cream place that can compete with Bi-Rite, but Garden Creamery puts up a good fight. They have super unique flavors, the staff is really sweet (you can sample a lot of different flavors), and they also have chimney cones (a cone made of chimney cake/cinnamon sugar flavored). However, the chimney cones are only available for a few hours on Saturday afternoons. It was busy but not crazy packed when my coworkers and I stopped by on a Wednesday night around 6:30pm. I tried:

-Japanese Milk Coffee: Yum, I loved the flavor of the coffee. This was a bit on the sweeter side, but still really good- highly recommended!
-Cookies n Cream: Also really good, and I loved the cookie pieces in here. Highly recommended!
[https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=HNipXoUuJoHIQk9mXvwWLg&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg]
-Mango Sticky Rice: Really good mango flavor, but I didn't taste the sticky rice part. I would have gotten this but didn't think it mixed well with the coffee flavor. Recommended!
-Black Sesame: Very good roasted sesame flavor, and recommended for black sesame lovers!
-Canela Toffee (Cinnamon): I'm not a huge cinnamon fan, so I didn't like this flavor. A few of my coworkers really liked this though.
-Pandan Leaf: Very aromatic, and too perfume-y for my taste.

This was a great first experience, and I will definitely be back to try other ice cream flavors!
author: Amy D.

description:
Garden Creamery is such a gem!  However, I wish they were located in an area with easier parking.  

My co-worker showed me a photo of the chimney cone and I knew I had to try it.  I love anything cinnamon and when you add ice cream to it, it makes the perfect combination.  We ordered the mango sticky rice and black sesame ice cream.  Both flavors were spot on!  The ice cream was creamy and had just the right amount of sweetness to it.  

I've seen various pictures on Yelp and IG with people ordering two scoops of ice cream when ordering the chimney cone.  When I asked for two scoops, the girl told me they couldn't do it (minus a star).   Aside from the two scoops ordeal, service was friendly and the workers didn't rush you if you wanted to sample flavors.
author: Candice H.

description: I'll definitely be craving this place!! I got the single scoop, but you can get up to 2 flavors. I got the Tahiti Vanilla Brownie and Matcha Gold (which has toffee bits in it). I wanted 2 other flavors, such as the black sesame and the Japanese Milk Coffee. My friend got the Japanese Milk Coffee and it was so good! We got here too late to try the hurricane cone. I'll be coming back to this place to try more flavors. The ice cream is made with quality ingredients. It's pricey for ice cream, but I like supporting local businesses and it's worth it to treat yoself here :D
author: Kirby P.

description:
The Mission is chock full of some of the city's best ice creams, but Garden Creamery holds its own with its super fun, delicious, and original flavors--and incredibly creamy texture. Their flavors change often, but my very favorites are the ube coconut pandan, butter mochi with toasted sesame, matcha toffee, and haupia coconut pudding. Even the vegan sorbets will blow you away. As a bonus, when you step into the store, it smells like an absolute dream. Self-control is definitely not a thing here.

I go out for ice cream at least once a week, so I know my stuff, and Garden Creamery is my favorite ice cream shop in the world.
author: Kelly R.

description:
My favorite ice-cream place in San Francisco! They have really unique flavors - love their multiple variations on matcha green tea ice-cream and the interesting chili mango. My favorite flavors are Ube and Black Sesame. 
I just wish their portions were bigger! Coming from LA, I'm used to the generous scoops from Salt & Straw and After's.
author: Dorothy T.

description:
This is one of my favorite ice cream spot in San Francisco so far. I love their unique flavors of tea and many flavors that are not basic like Vanilla or Chocolate. I came here twice and was never disappointed. The line is always long for this poppin Garden Creamery, so the wait time is usually 10-15 minutes wait for busy hours. They give you generous amount of samples to try and I am already was kind of full from asking to sample different types of ice cream. 

My all-time favorite flavors are Hojicha (HIGHLY RECOMMEND for first timers), Uji Matcha, and Japanese Milk Coffee. Lots of Asians flavors ice cream like Thai Tea, various Matcha flavors, Pandan Coconut, Genmachia, Mango Sticky Rice, and etc. 

A single scoop is $4.75 with the choice of 1-2 flavors, and they are pretty generous with the amount they give you, especially the amount they give you for sampling. 

I will definitely come back because they change flavors each time and I am ready to taste more! :)
author: Judy M.

description:
Quite possibly my new favorite ice cream place in San Francisco wow. Swung by hoping for churro cones only to find out they're only offered on Saturdays at certain hours but that's ok! Gives me an excuse to come back another time ;)

First impression: Tiny, tiny ice cream shop in the Mission about a block away from the busiest streets. Cute hexagonal white walls and nostalgic plastic furniture. The workers were super sweet, dealing with me and my boyfriend asking for way too many samples!

What I Ordered: 

1) 1 scoop of hojicha and 1 scoop of pandan ice cream in a cone (5/5): So I've never had pandan ice cream before, but I grew up eating pandan waffles weekly so this flavor hit me right in the feels. It was spot on--creamy and not overly sweet sigh. The hojicha was also excellent! I'm a huge fan of green tea ice cream in any form, but roasted has to be my favorite. The only downside was that the ice cream melted extreeeemely fast :( but it's okay, it just motivated me to eat it faster LOL

All in all, I would strongly recommend swinging by here if you're ever in the Mission. It's well worth your time!
author: Stephanie N.

description:
This is gold standard ice cream with a Hawaiian twist. There is no other place in SF that has such a unique variety. 

My bf and I tried 6-7 flavors (loved them all), but ended up getting the genmaicha, haupia macadamia nut, and Hawaiian butter nut+toasted sesame. Other notable flavors were mango sticky rice and coconut pandan.

Service was excellent, and I didn't feel rushed. There are about 3 tables inside, and a viewing window into where they make the ice cream.

Definitely will come back!
author: Corinna T.

description:
4.25 stars. I came here on a weekend night and the line was wrapped along the outside of the building. However, it was so worth the wait! As you can guess, there wasn't much seating because of all the customers, but I was lucky to snag a table. 

All the flavors I sampled were creamy and delicious and it was difficult to choose just two. If you're Filipino, you'll recognize a lot of the flavors! I grew up LOVING ube everything! Especially ube ice cream. Ube basically runs through my veins. So I was nervous that Garden's wouldn't live up to my expectations.
