Since it got a little crowded with waiting for the chimney cones, the nice gentleman told us to wait outside on Lexington.  

They surprisingly were done making the chimney cones and brought them out, letting us in, before 2 (I believe it was 10 minutes prior).  We got ours in a few minutes since we were second to the other couple.  I knew I was going to get the banana & lilikoi, and he was going to get the butter mochi toasted sesame.  I'm not sure if the banana & lilikoi was sorbet or vegan ice cream, but the flavors popped.  And I like how it's a not so common combination.  I enjoy banana ice cream, but the lilikoi shined here more and worked well with the banana.  The butter mochi is definitely unique, but we enjoyed it.  Not sure if I could taste much sesame but I tasted the butter and mochi.  We also sampled the cookies and cream, and the mango sticky rice.  The mango sticky rice was strong in mango flavor which I love but since I could easily get that anywhere, I passed on it for my cone.  The cookies and cream was a little faint in flavor for my liking.  

I think we chose the right flavors for the cones.  Since the chimney cones have a light thorough coating sweet dusting of cinnamon, if we had gotten something like chocolate or the hazelnut crunch it would've been a bit overkill on the sweetness.  They gave us a good size scoop of ice cream and the cake was light but still very filling being so big.  While it was good, I think next time I'll skip the chimney cone and get instant relief with just a regular scoop or waffle cone.  I definitely give the friendly staff kudos for being organized, letting us in early and allowing us to sample lots of flavors.  Enjoyed Garden Creamery more than Salt & Straw & Mr. & Mrs. Miscellnaeous.  Try to explore outside the norm and try their Hawaiian themed flavors!
author: Cat C.

description: Pan-DAMN ube, ice cream too matcha when you're having sesame. This definitely hits the spot and it's a must-go when you're in San Francisco. I got the black sesame, ube pandan, and matcha gold (matcha with toffee). I must get the Coffee flavor next time as that brought me back to my childhood when I had Breyer's Coffee ice cream.
author: Richard L.

description:
Chimney Cones reel you in...

...but then make you super sad because they are elusive. ONLY from 2PM-4PM on Saturday's. That's it! Well, at least their ice cream is bomb and it makes up for the fact that you are devastated you missed the ice cream version of Happy Hour(s)!

Although the line is out the door, do not be deceived. It is fairly small in the store, so the line quickly moves out the front door with a line of more than six people. 

They offer a huge variety of flavors, but also stick to some of the mainstream flavors too -- which is great for kids who aren't used to the more obscure options. And for those kids who are, well kudos to them for their fancy pallet.

Even though you feel the pressure of the line growing outside, the staff never makes you feel bad for tastings. I mean, with so many fun flavors how can you not ask for a few tastes of goodness? They even use actual mini spoons, instead of the plastic or wooden stuff.

I went with the Ube Pandon Coconut and Earl Grey in a warm waffle cone. Both were made just right, the Ube was not overly sweet and the hint of coconut was perfect. The Earl Grey, while the color was kinda weird, was really flavorful and delicious. I really enjoyed my ice cream. The cone was warm and had the perfect taste, yet it was crazy delicate. It broke many times, before I could even eat the first scoop. The cool thing about them is if you order one scoop, it really translates to two -- and you can have two flavors.

I really enjoyed the pricing here. It was as expensive as some of the other ice cream spots in SF. We try to stop at a new one every time we are in the City lately, and this one by far was the best priced.

It's quaint with a cute honeycomb tiled wall, but has the worst parking ever. We left J in the car, parked where we probably shouldn't have been, while we secured the ice cold treats! There is minimal seating, window bar top to the right and to the left are small booths with benches attached to the wall and chairs as well. There thankfully is also a bathroom with the cutest little colored ice cream mirror :)

Obviously I came for the Chimney Cones, but I still left happily without one!
author: Steph G.

description:
Fascinating flavors phenomenally executed. For a one-of-a-kind experience, try the Hawaiian butter mochi. 

FOOD: 
- The basics: there are ice creams and sorbets at Curbsite. While called sorbets, the dairy free but coconut rich ice creams are every bit as indulgent as their dairy counterparts. Vegans, rejoice! I am in love with the texture of the ice cream here--full enough to savor the dairy but light enough so that the flavors can shine though.

- Many cones into life, I thought I had come to understand the realm of possibilities when it comes to ice cream texture... until the Hawaiian butter mochi. My best guess is that they've added mochi rice flour or starch to the base. Whatever it is, the product is a light flavor with a rich texture: an indulgent ice cream with a touch of mochi's elastic texture. 
- I believe similar rice-powered forces are at work in the mango sticky rice flavor, as there were no discrete pieces of rice. Separate from texture, it is one of the best flavored mango ice creams I've had in the Bay Area (tastes like Philippine Alphonso mangoes w/o an overwhelming amount of cream). 
- COCONUT PANDAN--I am biased here. I love pandan and rarely find it outside of Southeast Asian pockets. Pandan is a grass with a delicate, fresh flavor that that enhances tropical ones like coconut or mango without a bitter aftertaste (looking at you, wheatgrass). (Update: ube coconut pandan is also bomb. Plus it's purple!)
- The coconut based Thai tea sorbet I loved--the tea flavor was prominent (often the ice dairy fat dulls the flavor with every lick) and complemented well by the coconut. 
- Mint chip is exceptional--and I don't even like mint chip! Garden makes it with fresh mint (none of that "essence" business) and it makes for a refreshing rather than the usual toothpaste feel. Chocolate flecks are just the right size and distribution to impart flavor without chipping a tooth.
- Earl Grey ice cream and sorbet were great, but I like milk in my tea and the richer consistency of the ice cream version won out in my book.
- This place is a matcha connoisseur's dream (ceremonial, sencha, and even genmaicha). 

I have yet to try a flavor that doesn't wow. 

The waffle cones are a buttery, crisp delight. I had one warm last night and I might just have to camp out there from now on for fresh batches :). 

Considering the quality, the price is phenomenal. A single scoop (4.50) gets you two flavors and what I consider 1.75 scoops. I am dreading the day these lines rival Bi-Rite's. 

SERVICE: I love how upbeat and smiley everyone there is. What is outstanding is the sample service! Both times I've been, I've been guided toward an unexpected gem of a flavor by the staff. Even with a line ahead of me and behind me, I didn't feel rushed.

AMBIANCE: Very cute! Small store with painted wooden signs in fresh colors. Bright interior where you want to linger with your cone (if you can find a seat!).
author: Helen W.

description:
This ice cream is so delicious! Super large variety of flavors that will leave you wanting to try more and more every week. Pricing is pretty standard for any type of artisanal ice cream these days with the ability to do split flavors with one scoop of ice cream I wouldn't recommend ordering the churro cone as it doesn't taste too well with the ice cream IMO. A sugar cone or cup should suffice for ya. 

They have a LOT of different matcha flavors here, my favorite was the matcha toffee. The hojicha, pandan coconut (similar to the coconut waffles offered at Vietnamese sandwich shops), banana, thai tea, you really can't go wrong with any of the flavors here. Will definitely be stopping by again!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I'm so happy I found this place! The owners really know their ice cream. The ice cream was soooo good, the flavors were pretty exotic, and the quality was really fresh. I was impressed by the selection of ice cream here, everything is unique and they have flavors I haven't tried/seen before. We got the Japanese milk coffee and the Golden matcha (matcha green tea ice cream with specks of toffee in it). I would recommend both flavors. I'm a little sad/happy they don't sell pint sizes to go. I think they should, they would make a killing. 

Nestled in the Mission, parking isn't great, but there are other things to do in the area so you can take advantage of that. We came before heading to Urban Putt (indoor mini golf w/ alcoholic drinks available--a pretty cool place), and it was definitely worth the walk. You can't miss Garden Creamery. It's the cute, little corner red building with a line going out the door, but don't worry, the line goes by pretty fast. There is limited seating, but they made use of the small space as much as possible. The walls have white tiles on them, and there's a ledge along the front window with high seats, which I love! There's also table seating with benches in the back. 

+ Some flavors they had: Golden matcha, Japanese milk coffee, Mango sticky rice, Ube and Pandan Jelly, Genmaicha (roasted barley), Hojicha (roasted green tea), Black sesame, Vanilla bean, Fresh mint chip, Cookies and cream, and Banana Salted Caramel.
+ The specialty Chimney cone similar to a churro cone is only available on Saturdays from 2-4.
+ The waffle cone is delish too! It's super thin and tastes very fresh.
+ There are vegan options! Great for people who are vegan or want a healthier alternative.
- If you're a customer, and you're going to use the bathroom, please shut the door behind you when you're finished. The bathroom is located right next to the cashier, so that's pretty gross and rude if you just leave it open.
- Only street parking is available.
author: Karen P.

description:
Everything I've had here is scrumptious! I particularly like the black sesame and the hazelnut. They also have a decent size of non-dairy options, so it's finally fun for my boyfriend and I to go out to ice cream again.

Be prepared to wait in line for at least 10 minutes most days. But honestly the line moves pretty quick and it's worth the wait. 

The perfect spot after seeing a movie at Alamo Draft house or before taking a stroll in Dolores Park.

Ones of these days I'll make it for their chimney cone.
author: Jessica A.

description:
Matcha. So many types of creamy matcha. 

Within one month this place went from being brand new and having no line to having lines down the block :( but good for them - they deserve it.

The ice cream is super creamy and delicious and flavorful here!
author: Nicole L.

description: I finally got to try this place and it was honestly some of the best ice cream I've ever had. I got the hazlenut crunch in a chimney cone (I didn't even know this was an option before coming here!) which was an excellent decision. The chimney cone was perfectly soft and held the ice cream well. It wasn't messy at all. The flavors all blended really well together. The ice cream is super creamy and isn't overly rich so you don't feel heavy afterwards. Even though there was a line to the door when I got there, it moved quickly and the staff were friendly. Highly recommended!
author: Pooja C.

description:
*** In Short ***

As if we didn't have enough amazing ice cream in the city!

*** In Depth ***

Garden Creamery's been on my radar ever since I first heard they opened up shop earlier this year, if not solely because I have somewhat of a love affair with churros. And never mind that they'd sold out of the churro chimney cones by the time I swung by (come early if you really want one), because I was blown away by the number of flavors they had that were biased more towards an Asian palette: black sesame, Japanese UCC coffee, Thai tea, three variations of matcha, and more?!

If you like your ice cream flavorful and creamy, but lighter and not diabetically sweet, you owe it to yourself to come here. Definitely give their tea flavors a try: even the vegan sorbet Earl Grey is fantastic.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Your typical ice cream parlor counter with the tall display cases that you have to reach up over to grab samples from. Seating consists of two tops and counter stool seating, as well as whatever you can find outside. As accessible as most other ice cream joints are.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description: This place is a dream for vegans! Most ice cream shops only have 1 or 2 flavors (usually sorbet), but this spot has SIX creamy, coconut-based flavors and let's you sample them all! I ended up going with the mango sticky rice and coconut meat, and this coconut meat ice cream best out every other version of coconut ice cream I've tried yet
author: Sophia C.

description: New favorite ice cream spot.  Matcha Gold is the best matcha I've ever had.  Lots of other really good japanese/hawaii-style flavors.  You'll have trouble picking just two.
author: Doran I.

description:
Delicious new ice cream spot in the city!
Matcha toffee- Matcha flavor was very pronounced and loved the sweet, crunchy toffee bits
Ube Pandan- I'm a fan of the coconut pandan flavor so I had to grab this one
author: Kristen T.

description: An additional solid place to get ice cream in SF. I love that their flavors are super special and that they're constantly changing. The staff is super nice about samples. I tried three flavors before settling on banana salted caramel and vanilla. (I know I'm kinda a plain Jane when it comes to ice cream) The price is fair as well. I think the small is 4.50 and comes with two small scoops.
author: Kim W.

description: One of the better and more unique ice cream places in the Bay area, and I've been to my fair share!! We got the hojicha and other green tea flavor (that I forgot..). Super yummy and good price too, $4.50 for two scoops! Definitely a must try!
author: Vivian C.

description:
Easily ranks as one of the best ice cream spots in the city. Just walking in, you feel like you are in an ICE CREAM GARDEN. So many fragrant and creative flavors, it's hard not too try everything! 

I don't know about you, but I love myself a banana or caramel ice cream and Garden Creamery Offers a Banana Salted Caramel that is seriously DIVINE. Pair that with one of their more kookey flavors like the Mango Sticky Rice, Haupia (Hawaiian Coconut pudding flavor), Butter Mochi Sesame, or the Geinmacha. As eccentric as these flavors may sound, the texture and vibrant colors are so enticing and puts the CREAM in CREAMERY. 

On another note, the staff is usually super nice and the lines can be long, but they go quick. I really want to come here on a Saturday when they have those chimney cones (churro cones), but overall, so glad Garden Creamery is in the city and can't wait to come back!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Blown away. Unique flavors of amazing vegan ice cream - this place is my new favorite ice cream place in SF!

I seriously have eaten some bomb ice cream in my lifetime so when my friend suggested checking out this really good ice cream place nearby, I didn't really expect too much.

Upon entering, just the ice cream flavor names were so unique and interesting, I wanted to try everything! Their flavors are split half non-dairy and the other half dairy. From flavors like black sesame, uji matcha, strawberry lychee, guabanero - I loved that their non-dairy options went beyond just your standard fruit sorbets or vanilla.

We decided to go with 3 flavors, 3 scoops of non-dairy flavors - Thai Tea, Earl Grey, and Chocolate Sorbet. Oh my lord, I think they just have a knack for tea flavors as the Thai Tea and Earl Grey were amazingly flavorful, and you couldn't even tell they were non-dairy. They did taste a lot lighter than normal ice cream, which I really appreciated. The chocolate sorbet had a thick chocolate flavor to it, and was really good, but just wasn't as special as the Thai Tea and Earl Grey.

I will most definitely be back, this place really makes some unique ice cream!
author: Jingxi Z.

description: Cute! The vegan non-dairy mango thai rice was delicious. I am so glad the single order includes two flavors. The line stunk, but I guess that's to be expected in the city.. Overall, I'm very glad we went!
author: Cami G.

description:
I finally came here and no Erin Lang, the owner. I would had given her 5 stars for the place. 

The place is not bad. It is in a nice neighborhood. I had no problem finding parking. 

The people that work here are friendly. 

How are the product? My answer is great! No difference compare to the truck. Erin added more flavor and she added the Chimney Cone which is good!

Will I come back here: yes but it will be hard to get my lady friend to come with me.

I will give Garden Creamery 5 stars when I see Erin Lang.
author: Ronald N.

description: Came in for my first time tonight. I'm originally from Hawaii and while looking at the flavor offerings I immediately thought "the owners must be from Hawaii or be inspired by local Hawaii foods." I was happy to meet the owner Erin who shared that she is indeed from Hawaii! She was so sweet and friendly and encouraged my boyfriend and I to sample as much flavors as possible despite the long line. Everything was SO good it was hard to decide. They offer many dairy free options and going in I didn't think I'd walk out picking two dairy free choices but I couldn't resist. You wouldn't think it's dairy free either! I got the guava li hing mui and macapuno. The macapuno is coconut based with coconut meat in it! My boyfriend got the hurricane popcorn (!!!) and black sesame. So so so so good! The hurricane popcorn had a subtle popcorn taste and literally tastes just like hurricane popcorn without being overwhelming. I can't describe it but overall Garden Creamery nails the flavor profiles perfectly. It was nostalgic of my childhood and comforting tasting these unique ice cream flavors. If you're from Hawaii I highly encourage you to go check Garden Creamery out. I can't wait to go back and be on the look out for the butter mochi flavor and try a chimney cone :) yum!!!
author: Natassia S.

description: Came here in search of dairy free options due to my girlfriends lactose intolerance. To my surprise, this was some of the best ice cream I have ever had. The consistency and smoothness was perfect, as well as the flavors. I was bummed I missed churro cone day but will definitely be back!
author: Andrew A.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco! Check out their chimney cones on Saturday afternoons!
author: Ted G.

description: Awesome ice cream shop with happy vibes and unique flavors - they have vegan options as well! Enjoyed trying the black sesame, guava, and lemongrass. From 2-4pm on Saturday's, I believe they have a chimney cone option. #doitfortheinsta :)
author: Camille E.

description: The line for this place is always so long and out the door. Amazing delicious and unique flavors. Unlimited samples, friendly service! I love their fresh mint flavored ice cream, definitely taste legit and made with real mint leaves as well as being creamy. Must try it! There are 1-2 flavors for a single scoop, and even though the cup is small, the ice cream scoops make me satisfied.
author: Vanessa L.

description: So many creative flavors (more so than the other SF staples), unlimited tasting, and delicious ice cream. I had the Ube and Mango Sticky Rice, both of which were fabulous. Small seating area but just a few blocks from Dolores Park so perfect to grab a scoop and walk there on a warm day! (The decor inside is also very nice if you intend to stay)
author: Suman G.

description: What a blessing and a curse to have Garden Creamery in the neighborhood! We are spoiled with ice cream options in the Mission (Bi Rite, Smitten, Humphrey Slocombe, etc.), but I must admit Garden Creamery is my favorite. Their flavors range from the comfort of vanilla brownie to more adventurous (for me) Asian flavors. It's some of the best texture and flavor in ice cream I've had. The staff is also friendly, knowledgeable, and patient with ice cream indecision. Can't go wrong.
author: Galen P.

description:
Stopped in this past Saturday after dinner to get a fix on my craving and I was extremely please! They have so many flavors that can cater to all tastes. I'll have to admit that I was that girl holding up the line trying all the flavors, but can you really blame me? They have so many asian-inspired flavors like green tea, ube, Thai ice tea and more along side your strawberries or cookies and cream.  It was so hard to pick which ones, but I finally settled for the the black sesame and matcha gold. I couldn't quite pick between the two matcha flavors despite the subtleness in difference. I for one, have no regrets. This place has the best black sesame! 

Over Mitchells and Bi-rite, I would say this place is going to be my go to for those craving kicks. One con I would say is that they stop selling their chimney cones at 5:00pm so I'm told. I really wanted that churro cone :( I will get it...soon...
author: Jen V.

description: Came here after seeing the high yelp reviews. There was a line and went slow due to people requesting samples of ice cream flavors. Interesting selection of flavors although many were not appealing to me. I did get the mint chip which is different tasting then conventional mint choc chip so I suggest you try a sample first. It was refreshing. Boyfriend enjoyed his cone. Being that it's organic, the portions are slightly smaller then a typical ice cream place.
author: Laura E.

description:
San Francisco's ice cream game just got stronger! They started off as an ice cream truck and finally have a store in the Mission neighborhood of San Francisco. Those of you who are lactose intolerant, you're in luck because they have vegan ice cream that tastes just as creamy as the dairy options!

Garden Creamery creates all their ice creams, vegan ice creams (coconut-based) and sorbets all on location in small batches from locally sourced ingredients. They pasteurize their dairy on location. I love that they have exotic and creative flavors that I haven't seen or tried anywhere else! Below are some of my favorites so far.

Coconut Pandan - Those of you who aren't familiar with pandan, its a plant used commonly in Southeast Asian cuisine, and combined with coconut, makes a deliciously fragrant dessert! I love it in Vietnamese style desserts and tasting this ice cream was so satisfying.

Genmaicha - Matcha green tea with toasted rice flavored ice cream. Tastes just like the genmaicha tea you have at Japanese restaurants, this ice cream had the perfect balance between the tea and with the aroma of toasted rice, mild and refreshing.

Earl Grey - Vegan option! I was afraid that it wasn't going to be creamy enough, boy was I wrong. The tea flavor was intense, aromatic with hint of sorbet texture but perfectly creamy. If its made from coconut, I couldn't taste it at all!

Fresh Mint Chip - always a favorite of mine. I've never had it anywhere else except at a local Hayes Valley ice cream shop or if I make it myself. Here at Garden Creamery,they make it exactly how I like it. The cream is steeped in real fresh spearmint leaves and the chocolate chip is shaved so that they're flaky and not hard to bite on when frozen. Oh my God, its P-E-R-F-E-C-T. It will make your breath smell like heaven.

I can't wait to come back and try more!
author: Janny S.

description:
10/10 would go again. 

This place has some incredible flavors! I tried the Ube (incredible, and new to me!), matcha gold (incredible matcha, not too sweet, not too bitter, with toffee pieces), and banana salted caramel (more banana, than caramel, but still delicious).

The line here on Saturday was about 30 minutes, but to be honest I expect nothing less form a good place in San Francisco. Very worth!
author: Nikita K.

description:
Um, YES!  

Came here on a casual suggestion from a friend as we were day drinking and I couldn't be more happier that we went.  Nestled on a corner of a small street and 20th in the mission, it doesn't seem like much at first glance.  Well except for its vibrant pink paint and line out the door!

The line went pretty quick, even though people were sampling multiple flavors at a time.  I guess we got there at a good time.  A lot of their flavors seemed to centered around Japanese concepts - Matcha, Teas, Sesame, etc.  I went with the Match Gold, cause it was delicious upon sampling (matcha and toffee).  Great on its own, but even better with the chimney cone...basically a soft churro in cone form!  Consider it Churro al Mode!!!  The warm fluffiness of the chimney cone, just hugs and transports the flavors of the ice cream straight to your taste buds!!!  Drooling just thinking of it now. 

Definitely my new favorite ice cream spot in the city!!!
author: Veasna H.

description:
The variety in flavors here makes me so happy, there's something for everyone -- VEGAN ice creams that are RIDICULOUSLY CREAMY, dairy ice creams and a wide range of flavors inspired by hawaiian / japanese flavors. 

My friend and I came on a Saturday afternoon when they still had the chimney cone. I got to try a bite of it and it's really well made (apart from the hole at the base where melting ice cream leaks a little). It's not TOO sweet, fluffy dough and the cinnamon sugar makes it similar to a churro in flavor. It soaks up the ice cream well but the one disappointing thing is that you can only get one flavor with the chimney cone -- for $8. 

I tried the mango sticky rice, li hing sorbet, haupia macadamia nut. The li hing was probably my favorite, I love li hing everything and this was so so refreshing (and non-dairy!!!) I must come back to try more flavors like the japanese coffee and ume plum.
author: Hana S.

description:
Let me start by saying that I have never written a Yelp review EVER.  I honestly think most of the people on here that take the time out of their day to post hurtful comments about an establishment really needs to get a new hobby.  Just because you've had one bad experience does not mean you have the credentials to post a review on yelp.

So Here it goes my first Yelp review...

Garden Creamery has been my go to ice cream spot since 2015. In my opinion this is the sexiest, highest quality ice cream my taste buds have ever had the pleasure in experiencing.  The way they execute their creativity in flavors is not like any other ice cream shop I've ever seen.  This place warms my heart like no other ice cream spot in San Francisco and makes me feel like I'm back home in Hawaii. 10 stars.
author: Kysa L.

description:
Omg this is like salt n straw but i find it way better as its not so hype! Very good unique asian flavors! My fave is black sesame! The mint has fresh mint and is amazing. 
The girls here are also very sweet! She accidentally scooped me the wrong flavor and graciously replaced it for me! I hope this place thrives! 
Love the fact that theyre eco friendly and use metal spoons as taster spoons! Kudos! 

Will come here whenever im in SF!
author: Quan N.

description:
Amazing, amazing ice cream! Worth the wait and a great addition to the mission neighborhood!! I'm a huge fan of matcha/tea ice cream flavors so of course Garden Creamery is a winner in my book. Line is a little slow, but that's because there are so many flavors to sample! TBH, I wanted to sample 1 of each flavor. 

Out of the matcha flavors, I love the hojicha. It has a stronger green tea taste than the ceremonial and not as earthy/grain-y flavor like the genmaicha.  The pandan coconut was also very delicious and so was the sticky rice. If you love Southeast Asian inspired sweets, Garden Creamery will be your jam.

i definitely need to come back on a Saturday 2-4pm for their fancy chimney cone! I wonder how crazy the line will be then...
author: Janet H.

description: Unassuming little spot with EXCELLENT ice cream! I had the black sesame and the nectarine - made from nectarines from a local farm. Both were delicious! I had also tasted the mint chip, made from fresh mint leaves instead of mint extract and equally delicious. Staff is super friendly. The only thing missing are a few benches outside so you can enjoy your ice cream in the sunshine.
author: CityPixie Q.

description: WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE!!! That pandan ice cream was outta this world!! Hojicha was delicious too but that pandan! Ladies and gentlemen, garden creamery has served me the best pandan ice cream I've had in America!! Pandan is a unique southeast Asian plant. The taste is similar to coconut but a million times better. For the diversity of flavors and quality of ice cream, Garden Creamery is my favorite ice cream parlor in SF!
author: Virginia Y.

description:
This place is so PURE of heart I can't even believe I didn't know about it before. 
We actually stopped by during chimney cone (which is basically a trdelnik shaped like a cone) times (2-4 PM on Saturdays,) which meant the lines were hella long, but didn't get one because I felt like a waffle cone lol. The flavours here are so damn Hawaiian and I love it-- and I just looked at the website and figured out why lol. But it's nice to have a place that has flavours that remind me of home, and taste delicious and also offer amazing sorbets. 

I got a double (2-3 flavors) waffle cone with mango li hing, strawberry ume and strawberry lychee. All flavours were delicious, though I wish the ume and li hing came out a little more-- but I understand why they're toned down a little. Salted plum isn't exactly the easiest to market to everyone (but it's sooo good you guys.) The mango li hing was bomb and one of my favorite flavours! Delicious, a little salty and tart and super creamy even though it was a sorbet.  The lines are super long, but it's worth the wait (and they let your pups come in too!) They're super nice here and patient but keep the line moving. The line looked to be larger than the one at Boba Guys nearby, but was rather fast moving! Would definitely come here again and again for my taste of Hawaii.
author: Christa Lei S.

description:
I'm gonna have to say I think it's my favorite ice cream in SF. Those who come here just to upload a photo of the chimney cone to their social media, don't be that lame person who goes out of their way not for the experience but specifically only to capture it on the 'gram. For one, the ice cream is really what shines here and two, their waffle cones are so much better. 

Consistency was surprisingly and delightfully creamy while remaining not too melty or ice-y. While flavors were bold, it was not quite in-your-face strong and it also wasn't too sweet either. In short, the ice cream was perfect. 

The waffle cone has a nice buttery taste, wasn't too crispy thin that if you took one bite the whole thing shatters. It really held up well the entire time it was being eaten. 

I love that it's not another popular ice cream destination (which shall remain nameless and is SF's default go-to for visitors and tourists) with that dreadful line around the block although I think it's starting to catch on. Plus, with summer around the corner, it'll only get busier. However the last time we came by, there were only two others in here which was fantastic for us. When we saw that there was no wait so we HAD to go in. However, we all know rent isn't cheap especially in the Mission and I'm gonna need this place to stick around so it would be nice (I can only wish) if the lengthy queues occur predictably only on weekends, holidays and really warm perfect-for-ice-cream warm days when I will know to avoid it.

However, let's be real - if the ice cream cravings strike hard enough, Garden Creamery's lines might be the one exception to my no-waiting-in-lines-longer-than-7-minutes rule.
author: Esther A.

description:
I originally ventured over here in hopes of getting my hands on one of their Chimney Cones but alas it is only Saturdays from 2-4pm. BOO!

Anyways, the flavors here are unique and most importantly, taste delicious! I really liked the Banana Lilikoi and Hawaiian Matcha Butter Mochi flavors.

There was a small line but only took about 15 mins to get our orders. Definitely will be back again!
author: Angela D.

description: Simply amazing ice cream! I love so many flavors (purple yam, 3 different green teas, a big delicious selection of nondairy options) and the texture is my favorite in SF. Creamy, smooth and dense...almost chewy. It's so good it's ridiculous. Brings me joy!
author: KarenYaella F.

description:
I was all ready to finally try Bi-Rite Creamery during my weekend trip to SF when my friend took me a few blocks away to have a look at another local ice cream shop that she liked. It has more interesting Asian flavors, she said. I was intrigued, and I figured I should at least drop by before making a decision. My dessert stomach, unfortunately, is not what it was in its younger years and only had room for one this day. 

Garden Creamery was fantastic! I sampled the Butter Mochi Toasted Sesame, the Japanese Milk Coffee, and the Matcha. I knew though, without sampling, that I wanted a scoop of the Roasted Matcha. And boy, was it amazing. It tasted just like roasted green tea, and you know the ice cream's good when the flavor tastes so genuine. The occasional roasted matcha burps made the mind-numbingly long drive down the I-5 so much more bearable.

I need to come back to try their chimney cones! And all their other flavors.
author: Andrew M.

description:
The hype here is real.

This place possibly has the BEST ice cream over any other ice cream parlor I've been to (Smitten, Bi-Rite, Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous, CREAM, Salt & Straw).

The best thing about Garden Creamery are the amazing selection of flavors. I had the pleasure of briefly meeting Erin and Katie (the owners) and it was clear that they make all of their ice cream with love and passion. They won't put out a flavor if they think it's below their standard in terms of flavor/quality.

My top flavors are:
1. Ube Pandan Coconut
2. Mango Sticky Rice (non-dairy for lactose intolerant folks like myself)
3. Earl Grey
And an honorable mention to the Hurricane Popcorn for the most unique ice cream flavor that's still really tasty.

Just be aware that their hours are a little weird so double check before you venture out to the Mission for the best ice cream in SF.
author: Hennie N.

description:
This spot is a block away from home so I'm surprised I've always just walked by it considering my love of all things ice cream. 

There was a long line in front of the store when I went after dinner on a weekday. This is probably because everyone is trying out all the delicious flavours this place has to offer and they really let you try everything!

Tonnes of Asian flavours here, alongside the more traditional flavours, like Thai iced tea, lihing (sour plums) and lilikoi which is my preference for summer ice cream eating. My favourite had to be the ube with pandan which was creamy and flavourful and brought me right back to my childhood. 

It was a little expensive for the not so big scoops but I'd go back.
author: Eunah T.

description: Holy guacamole! Came here on a Wednesday night and didn't have to wait that long. First time trying roasted green tea and brown rice green tea, seriously two of the best flavors I've had in SF. I definitely recommend those two flavors if you love Japanese tea. They have so many flavors to choose from, I'm sure you'll get to satisfy your cravings.
author: Gwen M.

description:
Exceptional ice cream with exotic and full flavors. The ice cream is dense and creamy. Super delicious!!

Besides the very high quality of the ice cream the owners are really cool and always have a minute to say "hi."

I love this place.
author: Thatcher H.

description: Garden Creamery. Good gracious the menu! I can't even begin to explain how happy I was to see all these Asian flavors. I really really REALLY wanted to get the genmaicha but it reminded me of my ex...so I lost all interest in it and opted for black sesame and japanese milk coffee. This is BUTTER. Pure, full-fat, sweet cream evil evil butter with the perfect amount of flavor and sweetness. I was so surprised how vibrantly prominent the tea flavor was. They even have a vegan menu. Just when I thought I've really had enough with this whole organic, vegan, green, gluten-free, soy-free, dairy-free, farm-to-table bullshit that San Francisco's been on for the last 2-3 years, I do have to give them props for being inclusive. Parking's a bitch but give yourself a real treat.
author: Nadeen H.

description: Possibly the best damn ice cream place in SF. 'Nuff said.
author: Geraldine G.

description:
Sooo many unique yummy flavors to try. To all my green tea ice cream lovers, the day I came they had 3 variations of green tea! They also have a relatively large selection of non dairy ice creams that looked amazing! 
I ended up getting the buttered Mochi with sesame and genmaicha. I have never had either flavors in ice cream form before, and there were so many others that I've never seen in the many many ice cream shops that I've explored in my lifetime. The buttered mochi perfectly captures the texture of actual buttered mochi in ice cream form. And the genmaicha tastes just like genmaicha tea, which satisfied my lil Japanese American soul. I still have yet to get their chimney cone, it's a lil pricey, but I will definitely be back to try it!
author: Nina W.

description:
If the idyllic Garden of Eden had a creamery, it probably be Garden Creamery P: I apologize if the punniness offends anyone, but Garden Creamery is seriously heavenly. Although small batch/organic/from scratch/unique flavors have become quite the standard for SF, the quality and thought put into the ice cream here is apparent. There's even a window in the back where you can see them making ice cream, which makes the ice cream seem to taste even fresher than it already is P:

Garden Creamery specializes in Hawaiian themed flavors, including Japanese (matcha, hojicha, black sesame, ucc milk coffee), tropical (haupia macadamia nut, pandan, coconut), foodie-oriented (saffron rose), and guilty pleasure selections (Butterfinger, cookies n cream). Besides ice cream scoops, they also have hand-made pops, ice cream sandwiches, sundaes, and an epic-looking signature chimney cone, but I like to ensure adequate stomach space for ice cream.

The generous, friendly attitude makes the place feel very homey and welcoming, in contrast to the all-too-common pretentiousness throughout SF. The servers are so polite and gracious, and you don't feel the least bit judged in sampling different flavors. I also applaud the $4.25 single for 1-2 flavors and $6.25 double for 2-3 flavors, which means you get an impressive (and incredibly photogenic) three scoops for a double! 

Thoughts on the flavors:
(+++) Haupia macadamia nut: Woaw it is no wonder this is among their most popular. It is an extremely likeable and satiating blend of toasty coconut and macadamia nut; recommended especially if you have a sweet tooth.
(+++) Thai tea: An aromatic blend, centered more on the spices and the tea than the sweetness of the condensed milk. You even see the little dots of black tea leaves! 
(+++) Kinako (roasted soybean): Delightfully mild, almost zen-like. It was the least sweet, which I actually liked because you notice the subtleties of the soybeans layered with light overtones of roastiness. Pairs excellently with everything, especially the more decadent flavors because it helps to tone things down.
(+++) Mango: I think there was mix-up because I asked for mango stick rice but didn't notice anything sticky-rice-like in my ice cream. In any case, the mango flavors were amazingly fresh, similar to Mitchell's except I think Garden uses the local variety of mangos (Mitchell's uses the sweeter Philippino type)
(++) Saffron rose: Fascinating! I think my palate isn't sophisticated enough to gravitate towards this advanced flavor, but it was a memorable mix of floral and a tantalizingly complex degree of aromatic. 
(+) Matcha and hojicha could use stronger tea flavor, though I may be unrealistic standards from being used to tea ice creams in Asia. Also, I'm not a fan of the murky brownish-green hojicha color, but such is life in the all-natural world.

I like how their ice cream is generally not too sweet, the flavors taste distinctly fresh and nuanced, and the texture is decently thick and holds together well but is not overly creamy. Although I do have a weakness for the lusciously creamy ice cream of Humphry Slocombe, I appreciate the focus on the flavors and more down-to-earth style (no pun intended) of Garden Creamery. 

I do think they should wrap the cones in a napkin, especially since you are handling money and then are given a cone. Otherwise, in my opinion everything is quite perfect already without any kinks to work out, despite the store's recent opening in early 2017.

Despite the small space, the seating is sufficient (for now at least), with a counter by the window and a few tables in the back. Color schemes and decor are basic but trendy, with an easy-to-locate bright red corner storefront, hexagonal white tiles, minty teal chairs, and fresh flowers/succulents. Seeing that no one would really want to bring their ice cream into the bathroom, I personally think they should move the cool ice cream mirror from the bathroom to the store--ice cream Instagrams would be completely *lit*.
author: Edna C.

description:
I've been following Garden Creamery on instagram and facebook ever since they had their truck. I was FINALLY able to try their goods this past weekend.  It was a perfect sunny day in SF and we were able to score parking within a block away.  My son was not in the mood to wait in line, so my cousin waited in the car with him, while my baby girl and I stood in line.  The line moved quickly and we were able to try a few different flavors.  The girl who helped me out said one of their most popular flavors was the mango with sticky rice, which was really good.  

I ordered the earl grey and kona coffee for myself, the earl grey and thai tea for my cousin and the mango with sticky rice for my son.  I love their flavors and you can definitely tell that their ice cream is made with love.  I wanted to go back and get more ice cream, right after I finished the one I had.  I can't wait til they start selling pints of their ice cream.  Definitely worth waiting in line for.  We loved it.
author: Christine P.

description:
Went to go see what the fuss over these chimney cones were about. We got there about 10 minutes before they started serving the cones and stood in line. Most people if not everyone was trying to get those cones. Which was kind of the problem since they could not keep up with the demand. So they took your order down and you had to wait for the cone. While I waited, I tried a few of their ice creams. And they were all pretty good. I ended up getting the green tea with my chimney cone. Because they couldn't keep up with the crowd, the chimney cones came out very hot and when they topped it with ice cream, which you can only get one scoop with the cone, it just melted in seconds. For that reason, I give this place a 3. The ice cream itself was a 5 but the execution was poor. 
I'll be back for the ice cream though.
author: Celia Z.

description: Love this ice cream place!! I've been trying to eat less dairy since I found out that it makes my my skin break out, but I can't give up my beloved ice cream! Thankfully there's Garden Creamery and their non-dairy ice cream. Unlike most places, they actually have a big selection of non-dairy flavors instead of just a couple. And they all taste so creamy and full of flavor! The lines can get long but it's worth it!
author: Wendan L.

description: Decently clean bathroom. I appreciate the trash can is right by the door so you can use a paper towel to open the door handle and then toss it in the bin.
author: Rest R.

description: Love all the Asian flavors they have here. If you love matcha, they usually have more than 1 kind of matcha flavor here. When I went last Saturday I got the Japanese milk coffee and halo-halo. The halo-halo was really good, it even had an actual agar chunk in the ice cream itself. I went back for the churros cone thing. That was just meh plus the line was hella long.
author: Novalina N.

description:
This place has quickly become my go-to for ice cream.

There are so many good flavors, it's almost a sin to have to only pick a couple. I think we've tried at least half of their selections. My favorites will always be their tea selections. Their matcha with toffee bits is such an amazing flavor combination. Not too sweet, and not bitter or grainy at all from the matcha. OH AND ALSO always always always get the waffle cone! It's sooooooooooooooooooooo amazingly buttery--it just melts in your mouth.

Can't wait to come back. Like literally.
author: David Z.

description: Favorite spot for dessert, we always come here after dinner on our date nights. Fun flavors, hip atmosphere, great customer service, non-dairy options, nothing but good things to say about this place! My go to flavors to get are Thai Tea and Earl Grey, although all of the non-dairy options are amazing.
author: Savannah B.

description:
Garden Creamery is one of my favorite ice cream shops in San Francisco. They have so many flavors to choose from. If their amazing pops aren't on display, they can have 24 flavors in their glass. Almost half of their flavors are vegan so everyone can enjoy their ice cream. I've tried a lot of their flavors but my favorites are definitely Black Sesame, Haupia Mac Nut, and Matcha Gold. On the non-dairy side, I really enjoy the Strawberry Lychee and Thai Tea. The ice cream is so smooth and creamy and I love the island touch to their product.

The owners, Erin and Donny, are the kindest and friendliest people I've met. Even when the shop is busy, they always take time out to talk to their customers. That's a plus in my book anywhere I go! Make sure to check out their shop on 20th and Lexington. You won't be disappointed.
author: Kerry L.

description:
We are talking about next level ice cream. This isn't your classic "Oh let me a scoop of Vanilla and Sea Salt caramel" place. This is "let me have a scoop of Mango Sticky Rice on that beautiful chimney cone" place.

One of the perks of living in San Francisco, is that we have amazing ice cream spots, especially in the Mission (heard it was 11 last time). That's why you have to be incredible, just to get noticed by people. Aaaaaaand Garden Creamery is incredible, just fantastic.

I've discovered this place accidentally, wondering why the hell there was such loooong line (so uncommon in SF right?) but then of course gave up and got in. Turns out it's that sweet 2 - 4 PM time period where they make their infamous chimney cone. Think about a churro, croissant and ice cream cone, combined in the best way possible. 

After checking flavors (and no I will never forget seeing Yam and Black Sesame as flavors) I decided on Mango Sticky Rice and rest of it was history. Unbelieveable.

I came back again just to discovered that their Cookies & Cream is the best one I've ever had so far. Giving Garden Creamery 5 stars and a long review doesn't even feel like doing them a favor, it feels like my responsibility as someone who lives in SF Bay Area and enjoys ice cream. Cheers!
author: Ali O.

description:
Partner and I ended a jam-packed day in San Francisco with ice cream here since they seemed to have the most vegan options available.

He tried chocolate and coconut. He appreciated the texture and flavor of both the flavors, and the fact that they actually made vegan ice cream and not just fruity sorbet. His major gripe (other than the whole place not being vegan lol) is that most of the vegan options were fruity flavors, and he would have liked more non-fruit options than just chocolate, coffee, and earl grey.

I tried one of their matcha flavors and the Tahitian vanilla. The vanilla was slightly above average, but not spectacular. The matcha flavor, however, was out of this world good and made me think I made a mistake not just getting more of that. Definitely high quality matcha with a lot of complexity of the flavor. The texture was probably the best of any ice cream I've had, it was as soft and silky as soft serve without actually being soft serve or having the airiness of it. Mine had toffee pieces in it and while I didn't get a lot of flavor from the toffee, the pieces were the perfect size (read: easy to eat) and added a delightful juxtaposition of texture. My only gripe was that the cone didn't taste housemade to me. I could be wrong but either way, the flavor seemed a little too generic.

Being in the Mission, the flavors are definitely a little more Asian influenced than your typical ice cream spread. When we went, they didn't have strawberry for example but sweet plum, taro, and three separate matcha based flavors. I like the fresh take but it may not be up everyone's alley.

Service seemed on par with what we received elsewhere in San Fran.
author: Christy G.

description:
Selfishly my first instinct was negative when I walked up to see the line around the block! Anger? Dammit, all those Mission Dolores Park hipsters discovered this place. Jealousy? They discovered *my* secret ice cream spot. Sadness? Yea mostly that - I didn't have time to wait to get to the front of that wrapping mob of ice cream seekers who had managed to get their earlier than me. 

All that aside, Garden Creamery is great. I was remarking to some coworkers recently: coconut has really blossomed into its own the last several years. Went from some weird gross flavored Jelly Belly that you avoided at all costs right to the most in-demand cocktail ingredient, trendiest water product, and now, an essential part of some delicious and creamy dairy free ice cream at the Mission's newest dedicated frozen dessert spot. (A crowded market: they're competing with at least half a dozen other detour-worthy great treats within two blocks)

Anyway....on to the skinny (or maybe the fat if you go here as much as I seem to be these days)....

-about half their flavors are completely dairy free, either coconut milk based ice cream (you can't even tell, I swear) or delicious sorbet
-ownership / staff is incredibly friendly - and Hawaiian! No qualms whatsoever about providing samples of absolutely everything, including the multiple variants of black sesame or matcha (between the two like six flavors in the case)
-that banana caramel and earl grey is the stuff dreams are made of. The Hawaiian/Asian influenced Haupia mac (like coconut pie) and Thai iced tea flavors are also excellent. Classic cookies n cream and their very own extremely rich vanilla are both plenty good too!

So in short - get there quickly, or you'll be waiting long. You might be too late to beat the Bi Rite creamery like lines, but hey-they don't sell by the pint yet, so at least you'll know you did it for the unique experience value.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Out of the wide selection of ice cream shops to choose from in the mission, Garden Creamery is rated 2nd ranking for me, thus far. Please consider, I'm writing this review based on 1st impressions. I have to try other flavors to call it #1. 

  I don't think anyone can deny how generally fresh and rich their ice cream tastes though. 

I've tried my fair share of mango and Ube flavors in San Francisco. I can confidently say Garden creamery offers the most natural flavor and is the closest thing to the real taste of the fruits. Other places' being too synthetic tasting or just taste like ice. Also, I would definitely call any green tea lovers to try their flavor. It's not too sweet or too bland of a taste. 

Vegan ? I couldn't even tell. However, I did notice that I finished my two scoops without the feeling like crap, heaviness, bloatedness and symptoms of fatty-ness.
author: Carleen C.

description:
LOVE MATCHA GOLD (matcha + toffee)!! Love the unique flavors, and this place is now my favorite ice cream shop in the city! I got the chimney cone, and although it's delicious (definitely worth trying it at least once), it overpowered the flavor of the ice cream, so I'll be getting my ice cream in a cone next time.
Came here on a hot day after chilling at Dolores Park... waited in line for maybe 30-45mins (it helped that there was live music in the same block though!)... will probably have to come here at off hours to avoid having to wait a long time in the sun.
author: Annie S.

description:
Seriously never thought I would associate ice cream with PTSD, but lemme tell you. Garden creamery now brings back very stressful memories and a mix of many emotions. The ice cream here is pretty good, a lot of unique flavors, and if I ever get over my PTSD, I will be back to try them all. But you should come here and try their ice cream and infamous chimney cone. The price point is a lil steep tbh, it costs like $10 for a scoop plus the chimney cone.

My traumatic experience all started with IG. My friend and I have been eyeing this place since it opened because of all the IG hype and posts surrounding their chimney cone. If you haven't seen the photos or heard of it yet, it's essentially a churro cone, so it's a bready cone doused in cinnamon sugar.. what can go wrong right?? It sounds right in every aspect.. ice cream n a churro come, BOMB. Moving on, did my research, chimney cones are only available on Saturdays like 2-4PM or until it's sold out. Something like that. My friend and I set a date, Sat @ 2PM to try it. I show up on time like 1:55PM cus you know I'm serious about my ice cream and I'm pumped. This was going to be my first meal of the day. I get in an already lengthy line (bc what's SF food without lines? Nada) and wait for my friend to show up. It's 2:15 and she still ain't here, finally I get a text from her that she's looking for parking. UM GIRL THERE AINT NO PARKING IN THIS AREA AT THIS TIME OF DAY ON A SAT. But I let her go around, I'm almost at the front of the line and I text her like hey, hurry up. She says, just order for me and I'll pull over and get you, then we'll eat it elsewhere, okay, I'm cool with that bc I didn't want them to run out of cones! I finally get in the store, and was greeted by smiling faces and I decided to try each of their 3 different green teas! Ma dam, they were pretty good, potent tea flavor! I get 2 matcha golds on chimney cones. Paid via credit card and texted my friend hey pull up, got the goods, I'll hop in your car. And I'm handed my two cones. TELL ME WHY THESE CONES WAS WARM AND MY ICE CREAM HAD ALREADY STARTED MELTING OMG. So I run out the store frantically looking for a lil blue subie. no. where. to. be. found. Finally I see her pull up, I signal her with my face bc my two hands was holding the two melting cones. This girl really just looked at me, shook her head, and kept driving....?????????? HOW WAS THAT HELPFUL??? So I'm like well there goes that, I can't possibly text you with two melting cones. So I stand on the corner like a doofus while everyone in this line is staring at me like why does this girl have two of the same cones?? But ain't eating it? Lemme tell you, my mama raised me right, I don't start eating without you unless you give me your blessing to. So I waited, through the green sticky mess that was now becoming my hands. So I put my thinking hat on, and I ask this little boy to hold my cone while I called my friend. I told her pull up, ima hop in, and we gna park somewhere, anywhere, cus this ice cream is getting out of control. She pulls up like 4 minutes later and how was I to open the car door???? I beg an innocent civilian passing by to help me, she was about to but my friend swings her door open, I get in and the civilian tucks me in and closes the door. All is good right??? WRONG. My friend starts driving away, with my seatbelt off, y'all know I'm all about my safety first so I'm freaking out then the ice creams began dripping all over the car and my legs. I yell we gotta pull over!! Anywhere! We pull into someone's driveway and hop out the car and we immediately began eating. Half of the ice cream had melted into the bag holding the cone bc guess what else, these chimney cones have a hole at the bottom... but whyyyyyy? Ventilation??? IONO. We leave behind a green sticky puddle in front of this person's house (sorry). And I'm still panicking and hangry so I downed that ice cream and cone faster than I ever eaten anything in my life. It was good though, the warmth of the cone and the ice cream is a wild combination. The ice cream itself was also pretty good! Then I grab the alcohol wipes from my emergency bag and clean our hands, legs, and car up. SMH. That's my garden creamery chimney cone war story. I wrote this with the intention that someone would learn from my mistakes that day, go there, get one cone per customer, with the intention of eating it as soon as it's in your hand or you too may end up with green tea ice cream PTSD. That's it y'all, thanks!
author: Eva C.

description: Oh ma guh, every time I hit up Garden Creamery I want to try new flavors... but I can't get away from the UBE! Thankfully the 'small' size allows for two flavors. Get Mango+Ube and you'll have a great day.
author: Tucker N.

description: An wide variety of Asian-Esque flavors, each high in quality and depth of flavor. I tried all and didn't find any that disappointed. The staff was very kind and helpful, offering personal recommendations and sharing their experiences with certain flavors. Will be returning to satisfy my sweet tooth craving. We came during a slow time at 11am but apparently the line can go or the door so plan accordingly
author: Andrew E.

description:
Unique flavors that are delicious enough to make me visit twice in one week!

I'm always skeptic of places with extremely good ratings on Yelp. Seeing such ratings make me think, "Ok, something must be up. It can't be THAT good." After my first trip to Garden Creamery, I was proven right. It wasn't good. Instead, it was so out of this world amazing to the point where I would give it more than 5 stars if possible!

THE ICE CREAM:
The stand-outs ice creams out of all they offer are their Asian-influenced flavors. Whether it's toasted sesame or pandan coconut, the distinct and true taste of each flavor comes out very well in the ice creams they make. 

THE SERVICE:
Very friendly people at Garden Creamery that make for a pleasant overall experience! While many workers at other ice cream joints look annoyed while you sample different flavors, those at Garden Creamery are patient and even encourage you to try more until you know exactly what you want.
author: Lisa T.

description: Three different flavors of matcha on any given day.  And black sesame!   All things that make me happy!  By far, my favorite ice cream shop in the city.
author: Joanne G.

description:
Having a long layover in San Fran I decided to learn BART that day while in the mood for ice cream. 
Being a vegan it's never easy to find good cream
Ice cream. But, wow did garden creamery hit all the marks!! 
The line was super long when i arrive but, moved pretty fast. When inside i was blown away by the large vegan selection. 
I asked the younger man behind the counter to give me two scoops of his favorite (he was a little shocked i would just trust his selections) and walked in heaven all of the way back to the train to the airport. 
No joke I've talked about trips back to San Fran just to get some more!!!! 
Keep up doing all the amazingness! Between you're awesome selection and staff you all are killing it!!
author: Amber M.

description: Coconut pandan is my new favorite flavor! It tastes like milk tea in ice cream form! Absolutely delicious and worth the wait!
author: Evelyn D.

description: So many different options and flavors!! When we got to the front the line behind us was really long so I felt bad trying a bunch of different flavors. The lady helping us was really nice though and didn't mind. I ended up getting the sesame icecream with the chimney cone. Would definitely come back to try some of the other flavors though. As of now, the chimney cone is only available on Saturday's from 2-4pm. It is on the heavier side though so make sure you're hungry when you get it!!
author: Megan K.

description: I love ice cream. This place is bomb af for ice cream. After taking a stroll in the Mission I finally walked passed one of my bookmarks (being Garden Creamery) and grabbed some scoops. I got the Matcha Gold (has toffee crunch bits) and the Black Sesame. Both tasted amazing! Definitely coming back for more!
author: Kristine C.

description:
Garden creamery is my new favorite ice cream spot because they have very interesting flavors, and the quality of the ice cream is comparable to all the other famous ice creams hot spots in the city and the line is never crazy long!! 

I like that they have a lot of Asian inspired flavors such as mango sticky rice, Thai tea, coconut pandan, black sesame, japanese green tea, green tea with toasted rice, etc. They also have other traditional flavors like chocolate, fresh mint chip, vanilla, cookies and cream, etc.

This place also offers dairy free/ vegan ice cream so go ahead, bring your vegan friends :)
author: Sam M.

description: Delicate, fantastic flavors, including their non-dairy flavors -- had a coconut milk earl gray here that I sometimes randomly think about, tea flavor that bloomed into coconutiness. I adore their mint, which also strikes me as a tea flavor -- tastes like mint tea instead of mint extract.
author: Yinmeng Z.

description:
I kept on seeing pictures of the famous Garden Creamery chimney cones all over Instagram and I knew I had to try it out myself. Unfortunately, I came too late on Saturday and learned that they only serve them until 4 pm on Saturdays. So if you're looking to grab one, make sure to remind the hours.

I ended up getting a waffle cone double scoop of Earl Grey tea and cookies and cream. I really appreciate them filling the first scoop of cookies and cream into the cone directly. The chunks of cookies and crunch of the cone were great together. Above it is a scoop of Earl Grey tea ice cream which tasted pretty true to real Earl Grey tea. I have been obsessed with Earl Grey ever since they started making Boba with it and it's nice to see a well-done ice cream flavor.

Parking is impossible around this area. So if you plan to come here, either take public transportation or take a Lyft or something. I looked around for parking for a good 10 minutes and found nothing. In addition, the people that drive around here are not very nice. The lines are out the door as expected so factor that into your plans.

I would definitely come back another time to try their chimney cones!
author: Anna F.

description:
CHIMNEY CONE REVIEW: 
Hi wanted to be part of the hype so I got THE cone that everyone raves about and it was Good. Not like the best thing ever but good. 
However their ice cream flavors are amazing they have so many choices you don't how which to get! I would skip the cone and just get a double scoop of ice cream . 
The chimney cone is not bad but I thought it would taste more like a crunchy curro. So different than I expected but still not bad if you want to realyyyy try
author: Cynthia R.

description:
I've tried a lot of new places this month--but this is the one place I will write a review for.  It was an unexpected delight.  Each flavor I sampled was better than the last.  And the "local" (hawaii) flavors were spot on in evoking what it was like to love growing up in Hawaii.  The prices were reasonable and the people sampling were fresh and friendly.  No tartine attitude here!  This is one place I intend to go back to over and over again.

I only tried 8 flavors on my first run haha.  But the black sesame and coconut were real winners so far.  They were honestly all tasty.
author: Philip L.

description:
This place is amazing seriously. I don't know how ice cream could possibly get anymore fresh and flavorful. I feel like if they could make something crazy like turkey into ice cream they could LOL. But anyways, you can tell they put a lot of work and love into their ice creams, and I like that the flavors aren't too overbearing or overly sweet; no sugar rush (or headache lol) just pure happiness :) Plus they got vegan options too! 

My best friend and I got: Thai tea (vegan), Kona coffee, Genmaicha (matcha and toasted rice), and they all tasted great! They have cool and interesting flavors needless to say and I will definitely be back for more! 

SERVICE: awesome! I don't know if she was the owner or not, but she was very very kind, definitely humble and appreciative of the customers. Wonderful person :)  

PRICE: single cup ($4.25) for 1-2 flavors!!! 

PARKING: Mission area so it's madness at any time during the day hahah I just double parked outside the shop and ran in.
author: Vivian S.

description:
Solid ice cream spot with a very eye-catching storefront. Has a decent variety of flavors but nothing too crazy or unheard of with maybe like one exception but they do it pretty well. This place will definitely leave your ice-cream craving satisfied. 

Their main gimmick is the chimney cone which is only offered on the weekend in the evening it is worth a try if the line is not too long. Service here can be pretty slow even when there are only a few people ahead. With all the competitive ice-cream spot around this place is a good alternative and has its own charm.
author: Luna C.

description: My friend took me here during my visit to the bay and I would have to say their flavors did not disappoint. They are unique and different in a good way. I tried a few flavors and ended up deciding on the Ube Pandan and Black Sesame. The guabanero, Genmaicha and rose are also worth a try. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in the Bay Area and try more flavors.
author: Sally Y.

description: Another great ice cream shop in the city.  It's a cute little shop on the corner you won't miss.  There's usually a line out the door but it worth the wait.  They have a variety of special flavors and there are so tables inside where you can sit down and devour your ice cream.  I wish they served the chimney cone every day guess I'll have to come back on a Saturday for it.
author: Len L.

description:
Vegan options-- YAY! I am currently obsessed with the Thai Tea sorbet flavor & out of the couple times I've gone they seem to rotate some other great sorbet vegan flavors as well as non-vegan ice cream (I've tried a yummy dark chocolate sorbet & strawberry lychee sorbet that were also yummy).

It's a cute spot in a cute area between Valencia & Mission streets; a great place to hit up after getting food in the area at any time of the day really (since they're open quite a while). Line hasn't been crazy when I've gone & overall the experience of being there and ordering is on point. 

I get three scoops on their lovely vegan cone & stroll about happily afterwards. So happy I stumbled upon this... definitely will remain a go-to for me!
author: Carolyn S.

description: This place has the best vegan ice cream I've ever had. I came back for seconds the next day with another friend. The dairy flavours looked amazing, but they had dairy!
author: Anne S.

description: Before I changed my lifestyle to veganism ice cream was my favorite dessert! And honestly I've found some really good alternative ice creams but they never were exactly what my taste buds wanted. Of course till I found garden Creamery! Omg seriously the best vegan ice cream I've had to date. My boyfriend isn't even vegan and he rather have the vegan ice cream options, that's how bomb it is. Whenever I'm in the city i now always stop by on my way out. Also the girl who always helps me is super sweet. And everyone else is always super nice and friendly.
author: Sarita G.

description:
Drove fifteen minutes for this place and man was it worth it. This place is a must. I believe this place started out as a food truck and now this is the first brick and mortar location. 

They have three different matcha flavors. Forgot the names. I ended up getting black sesame and the Hawaiian butter. Those two are A1!!! 

PSA: Cake Cones are offered on Saturdays 2-4 :(
          Black Sesame is the best I ever had n better 
           than Marco Polos
          Hawaiian Butter is a must!
author: Brian C.

description: We were nearby at Gracias Madre and decided we wanted ice cream and saw this place on yelp. There was a line out the door (that means it's good), and we ended up waiting around 10 minutes to get in there). Everyone LOVED it! It tried 5 flavors and they were all so delicious, I felt there was no way to decide. So, because itw as impossible to make a real decision, I just went with the first two I tried (cantaloupe and toasted matcha). Highly recommend. Worth the wait!
author: Catherine M.

description:
If you think you have a favorite ice cream place and you haven't tried this place, be ready to reevaluate. 

I'm not too sure if they usually give out samples, but tonight they seemed happy and friendly while offering free unlimited samples!

All flavors were authentic and truly tasted after what they were named! The texture of the ice cream was very creamy and soft and rich! It was so good!

I tried about 5 samples and ended up going with the banana and chocolate brownie flavors. Definitely would recommend. My boyfriend got cookies and cream and my brother got mint chip, and both were also "hella bomb."

Every Saturday, from 2-4 they offer a chimney cone which is a churro cone. I hear it's amazing, and will definitely be back to try it!!!
author: Kassie E.

description:
HOJICHA ICE CREAM AND MANGO STICKY RICE
After a nice hike on a warm day, my bf and I went to garden creamer in hopes to get the chimney cone, but it is only available on Saturdays, so keep an eye out, peeps!!
The Hojicha which is a roasted milk tea, was my absolute favorite. the texture was creamy, flavor was nice and light, and to my surprise, the ice cream just doesn't melt :O
My boyfriend had to drive so I held his cone for him, and believe it or not it wasn't running down the sides or anything. It just stayed in its perfect shape and had a nice cool glaze to keep it all in place. This place is magical and I can't wait to go back to try out more flavors!!!!
author: Tram H.

description:
I enjoyed the vast selection of Asian-themed flavors. I tried hojicha, black sesame, matcha, strawberry lychee, and roasted soybean. I think the hojicha, matcha, and roasted soybean flavors were not as strong and tasted milkier than I would have liked. In my opinion, the ice cream is creamier than Bi-Rite, and it seemed the flavors were not as strong as a result.

I forgot to order ice cream in a chimney cone! If I'm in the area again, I'll definitely stop by for one :)
author: Stephanie C.

description: One of my to go ice cream shop now. My bf loves the ube flavor while my go to is mango sticky rice , its so good , not too sweat but super flavorful. There are so many flavor and some of them are dairy free so everyone can enjoy it without worrying about allergy
author: Nguyen H.

description: Very unique and delicious flavors. We got the Thai iced tea and matcha gold (had toffee bits in it!). My husband and I usually fight over what flavors to get when we share, but here everything is so good that he just lets me choose because he knows regardless of what flavors I pick it will be amazing ice cream.
author: Maryam D.

description:
Came across this place as I was wandering around the area taking pictures for the 'Gram of all the murals and beautiful art spread across the alleyways.

There was a line before entering, but it went by fairly quickly. The workers were joyful and tried their best to accommodate all the customers. No complains in that area. The atmosphere reminded me of a good ol' ice cream parlor that was made to keep grandma's secret recipe from dying. It was great. The ice cream itself was also incredible. The texture was on the creamier side, which I enjoy, and the flavors were so diverse. A ton of choices were presented that you usually wouldn't find elsewhere and seemed to be very "Asian based". Even when the ice cream flavors melted into each other, it mixed into another type of ice cream that still tasted incredible.

5/5 stars. I'd recommend this to anyone in the area as a must-see whenever they decide to visit.
author: Miguel R.

description:
My review is:

Overall an ice cream shop with cones and cups as well as ice cream. I arrived with a skip in my step and high hopes. Needless to say, this is NOT the way I left. This establishment advertises for its "the chimney" cone, and many people come for this reason. HOWEVER. It was not snooty enough for this place to serve its most highly advertised menu item only one day of the week (Saturday); they serve "the chimney" only 2 HOURS each week (2-4). This creates a lot of buzz and attracts hopeful customers like me only to serve them a freezing disappointment, confusion, and sense of loss.  Their ice cream is cold, I'll give them that. If you are looking for some senseless, no-strings attached matcha ice cream to light your waning fire, this might be the place for you. If you are looking for less-sexy, higher quality ice cream that warms your heart, I'd look elsewhere. Overall: Over-priced snob-fest of a place. 1 star.
author: Tella S.

description:
Amaaaazing unique, fresh ice cream. I had Thai tea and Earl Grey (both delicious). My friend had the mint chip and it literally tasted like fresh mint leaves. 

Highly recommend this place. A little pricey but worth it for sure.
author: Paola M.

description:
Lots of flavors to choose from and some unique ones as well. Tons of hipster ice cream places popping up and this one is another one you can add to your list. 

Didn't try the bread cone but I can appreciate the creativity there.

Take a stroll through this garden!
author: Jennifer C.

description: I don't do so well under pressure.  So when my friend and I stopped by Garden Creamery for dessert and it was my turn to order and I freak out, I stick with the safest option I know instead of trying one of their unique flavors.  Can't go wrong with Cookies & Cream.
author: Linda N.

description:
This is one of my top ice cream places in the city, period. And as someone who eats ice cream an alarming number of times a week, that's no small praise. The flavor variety and quality of product make it stand out far above the crowd. Not only are the lines way shorter than bi-rite, but if you're looking for those more subtle flavors of ice cream (Matcha Gold, Mango Sticky Rice) those flavors are definitely done justice here.

The chimney cone is the latest in those insta-able food trends, but I prefer to eat the ice cream on its own, to be honest. The cone didn't add that much for me in terms of flavor and it actually got pretty messy within 10 minutes or so of eating it.

Also, big ups to this place on its nondairy section, I usually just eat ice cream and deal with the consequences of being lactose intolerant, but if you're smart this place has got tons of options for ya!
author: John P.

description:
So grammable and so cute. The chimney cones (soft, hollow churros) are only available on Saturday! So if you're going for the chimney cone ice cream picture, go on Saturday :)

Located just off of Valencia in the Mission, Garden Creamery is ideally located for a park and stroll ice cream treat. They have some fun, cool, flavors, along with delicious, creamy (coconut milk based) vegan options. They have some delicious Asian flavors such as matcha, black sesame, hojicha, genmaicha, pandan, Hawaiian butter mochi, and so much more! You can sample a few before choosing. I think if I were to critique the actual ice cream, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is still much better, but Garden Creamery is a worthy adversary to Bi-Rite. Definitely the chimney cone is a fun option for a cone that's worth trying. For me, it was a little to heavy with the ice cream, although on its own, I like the texture of the soft, warm cinnamon churro. 

The inside is pretty small, although they do have some seating options. I did go on a Saturday so the line was fairly long, but it goes quite fast. Don't let it deter you!
author: Kate M.

description: I used to be 'meh' about ice cream and then I discovered Garden Creamery. Game changer. Amazing flavors, not overly sweet, and they're chill about sampling. I go here once a week
author: Supreet C.

description:
VEGAN FLAVORS. And lots of 'em. Do you need some Thai tea in your life? Coconut? Earl grey? Come on down. This ice cream shop has a little bit of something for everybody's taste. It definitely has the largest/best selection of non-dairy flavors I've come across. 

I'll probably run into you there...
author: Lydia L.

description: I came here thinking I could get a chimney cone no matter the time or day. Luckily I came on a Saturday during the only time throughout the week that they were being offered. Definitely double check (or call ahead) because chimney cones aren't offered everyday!
author: Caitlin A.

description:
I just can't rate this higher than 3 stars mostly because 2 scoops or 3 small scoops/flavors costs $7 with tip. It's real. The medium sized cup fits nicely in the palm of your hand and can easily be finished by a single person or a pint sized (get the joke lol) kid.

Ube was prime. 5 stars
Mango. 3 stars
Chai. 3.5 stars

Price. 2.5 stars

I'm always in the area so I plan to give it another try.
author: Joshua F.

description: I came here for their collab with Third Culture Bakery. This was a mochi muffin sundae, with earl grey and matcha ice cream. 10/10 totally worth the $10. The texture of the creamy ice cream mixes so well with the mochi muffin pieces, which totally soak up the ice cream as it melted. As a bonus, the vegan ice cream flavors here are soooo creamy (the earl grey was vegan)!
author: Michelle L.

description: Still a solid 5 stars, and still the best ice cream in SF, hands down! The chimney cone gets all of the hype here, but the ice cream is definitely the star of the show. Everything from the airy and smooth texture to the strong flavors are just perfect. I definitely enjoy the more unique flavors like their hojicha, matcha gold, black sesame, Japanese milk coffee, etc. which really taste like the real deal!
author: Kazu O.

description: The Tahitian vanilla and Japanese coffee were insanely good! Not too sweet and jam packed with flavor. Its a bit pricey for ice cream but not to worry, its about the same price as the average yogurtland cup ($4-5 for two scoops). The environment was cute! Came with a party of 5 and the tables were filled so we ate outside. No line! Haven't tried the chimney cone but I hope to one day!
author: Kathleen N.

description: Pretty solid ice cream.  I like that they had good options for people with different food aversions.
author: Michael E.
