description: This place has the best vegan ice cream in SF hands down! I'm obsessed with the Mango Sticky Rice flavor omg I literally uber 25 minutes just to get it. That's one way, not round trip lol.
author: Julie N.

description: My favorite ice shop in the city right now. It's not buttery or over creamy.  I always get ice cream here if I am in the hood.
author: Fatty A.

description: The ice cream is soooo creamy. I like the black sesame very much. The matcha and ube is my seafood favorite!!!
author: John K.

description:
lactose intolerant? avoiding dairy? no problem! Their dairy-free ice cream is just as good! I haven't been able to eat ice cream for months since I developed my new dairy allergy but Garden creamery helped remind me how wonderful that cold creamy substance tastes. 

On a busy day, be prepared to wait in a long line for the delicious goodness, but you should be ok during off hours.
author: Annie Z.

description: After dinner one day I was craving some sweets and came across this cute place. No frills, just a place with delicious ice cream in not so common flavors. I had the matcha green tea and ube. You could tell on the first tasting that this was quality ice cream. It was freezing out and despite that the line was out the door. I wanted my ice cream in a cone but didn't want to deal with the dripping if I didn't finish fast enough. I was able to get it in a cup with a cone on the side for an extra 25 cents. It was the perfect hack. Can't wait to stop by here again!!
author: Kim P.

description:
I'm living in a glorious hellhole of sugary temptations. That is, equidistant between Garden Creamery and Candi Me. Homemade ice-cream on one corner and hand-made candy on the next. Smitten Creamery and Xanath are almost as close; less than a block a way. 

Bi-Rite Creamery and Humphrey Slocombe are within easy walking distance. Mitchell's too.

So, Ice cream everywhere. I only need to stumble out of bed to get some. Yet, Garden is my favorite spot. There's no such thing as bad ice cream; I just really like Garden Creamery the best.
author: Maya B.

description:
Good flavors but the scoops are sometimes way too small.  Really inconsistent from night to night.

Also sometimes there is an over concentration of tea flavors.

Best waffle cone in the city. Buttery and thin. Way better than their chimney cone.
author: Vince R.

description:
Amazing non dairy and vegan options like Earl Gray and Chocolate (their coconut is so creamy!)

They also have fabulous flavors like the and matcha toffee to try!
author: Steven W.

description: The new IT ice cream joint in SF. Came by in 50 degree weather and there was still a long line outside. Of course this piggy got too excited reading all the reviews about chimney cones and came here on a non-Saturday, only to be disappointed that my belly would only get to digest ice cream without the special cone. Still delicious -- stamp of approval for texture, taste, and quality. It is fluffy and frothy , but thick enough to be a heavy duty creamy scoop of heaven. You can expect your typical and unique flavors, all yummy. Also, one of the gals looks like Lady Gaga!! She's cool.
author: Sharon C.

description: My absolute favorite ice cream parlor in the mission! We got the Thai iced tea and mango sticky rice and were blown away by the quality of the ice cream, how much they actually tasted like the desserts themselves and the fact that they were vegan!
author: Sam M.

description:
There are a lot of amazing ice cream places in this city, and Garden Creamery is definitely one of the best. I heard about this place through word-of-mouth and actually received a text that said "Drop everything you're doing and go here NOW" when I mentioned I hadn't been here before! LOL!

Garden Creamery has a variety of flavors, including non-dairy options. As a huge fan of tea, I was thrilled to see a lot of tea-themed flavors including Hojicha, Earl Grey, and Matcha. There are also some dessert-themed flavors that closely resemble the real thing like Mango Sticky Rice (my favorite) and Ube Pandan. If you're feeling adventurous, they have some really original flavors too (last time I went here, they had Pico de Gallo and Guava Habanero!).

There's a reason why there is always a long line at this place! Luckily it moves fast and there are a good amount of tables to sit at and enjoy this sweet treat with some friends. Check it out!
author: Meenal T.

description:
Hands down my new favorite ice cream spot in SF. We waited about an hour in line on a Saturday afternoon. The wait was totally worth it! 

I tried matcha gold, hoijcha, Japanese milk coffee, and black sesame. I got their matcha gold, which is Matcha infused with toffees, and hoijcha. Their black sesame was really good and tasted very similar to Matcha Love. 

I will definitely be coming back!
author: Lynn H.

description: Best ice cream hands down! Don't know how they make all those flavors taste so incredibly amazing, but it's better than any ice cream place I've ever been!! So in love and all my friends I bring are too! Can't wait till they start selling pints to go! Especially loved their mango sticky rice and ALL the green tea flavors! "Nian gao" during Chinese New Year was an amazing rare treat! Don't know they get the 3 different stages of flavor. I thought only regular food or drinks could do that, but somehow, especially with the mango sticky rice, you get a great mango flavor up front that lilts right off into a delicious extravaganza of sticky rice heaven! Still love 'em, but they're miles better Mitchell's, Bi-Rite, Salt & Straw, Tin Pot, and Smitten! Wishing them all the success in the world even if that means longer lines for me!
author: Tiffany Y.

description: Get the mango sticky rice ice cream. It's delicious and refreshing! They have some very unique ice cream flavors like genmacha, black sesame, ube, milk teas. Service is fast. Only recommendation would be to have more seating :)
author: Michelle C.

description:
This is my absolute favorite ice cream place. Rich and creamy with unique and interesting flavors. 

My one goal in life is to try as many ice cream places as humanly possible, so I generally don't go back to the same place more than once unless I'm already in the area. Not only have I been to Garden Creamery three times, it's also very out of the way for me. That's how much I love their ice cream. 

I have tried black sesame, butter mochi, king's tea, lychee rose black tea, and Japanese milk coffee. I would recommend all of these, but black sesame and butter mochi were my favorites. The black sesame was the creamiest black sesame ice cream that I've ever tasted. And the butter mochi was incredible! It does NOT contain mochi bits, but it tasted just like mochi. I'm not sure if it was my imagination, but it seemed a little chewy when I bit into it. It would be interesting to get one scoop of black sesame and one of butter mochi together next time. Like a tangyuan!

My only complaint is that, unlike many other places that rotate flavors daily, Garden Creamery does not put up a list of today's flavors on social media.
author: LC K.

description:
Yes, we San Franciscans love our ice cream and YES! this is that good. It's not cheap, nothing is cheap here so why blame these guys? Unique flavors, excellent quality and worth it! As good as birite and that's the highest compliment you can get in SF for ice creams. 

Don't listen to the whinny reviews that complain that it's not better than the bulk junk you get at the supermarkets. They really don't know what the are talking about.
author: Hema P.

description: Came here for the famous chimney cone, which is only available on Saturdays from 2-4pm. Tip: they start serving the cone a little before 2pm, probably at like 1:40 or something so you can come and beat the line, since once it hits 2 it's super poppin. Anyway, I got the chimney cone with a scoop of haupia mac nut for $8. The chimney cone was softer than I expected it to be and the inside was kinda doughy in my opinion...but it was still good. The ice cream itself is good; I like how they have so many options although it makes it so hard to decide! They also have vegan options and they're not icy, they're still super creamy! I think after I read so many 5 star reviews, my expectations were too high...but it was still good nonetheless!
author: Alyssa W.

description: I randomly stopped by to get something sweet after having dinner in the neighborhood. The lady was nice when I was indecisive. Fairly good options available for sorbet and galatos. Ice cream fans, this is not a place for you.
author: Lianna D.

description:
This is a truly amazing new ice cream place in the Mission. The flavors are fantastic: golden green tea, black sesame, hojicha tea (my favorite ) and more.

The service is lovely and casually met the super friendly and unpretentious lady who started it.

My favorite ice cream place
author: Carmen C.

description:
So far on my quest for the best ice cream in San Francisco, I have tried Smitten, Salt and Straw, and now Garden Creamery. Garden Creamery is by far the best of the three. I came here on a Saturday afternoon, which meant I was part of a long line down the street of people waiting for their Chimney Cones. However, on a nice day without other obligations, I didn't mind. 

My boyfriend and I decided to share the day's special - Brownie Supreme. It was two scoops of our choice of ice cream - Hazelnut Crunch & Chocolate, with brownies, hot fudge, and caramel sauce on top. The Hazelnut was amazing. Chocolate was good, but not standout. Next time I'd try a more unique flavor. Definitely worth coming back multiple times - there's no shortage of flavor options! While there, I tried a sample of the Matcha Gold and will definitely be back for a full cone of that.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Bomb ice cream!! Very creamy, good price, unusual flavors but nothing too crazy. I got passion fruit cream cheese and roasted matcha on a waffle cone and I was content. I want to try all the flavors, probably will go back to try the thai tea flavors.
author: Idania G.

description: Goodness this was so good!! Very friendly staff and environment. Rose petal and matcha was what I got and it was definitely different but in a good way. I cant wait for next time!
author: Vee N.

description:
Pro:
- De- to the- licious
- Smooth, silky sorbet
- Variety of exotic flavors
- Friendly service

Con:
- Difficult to find street parking
- Waffle cone was a tad on the sweet side
- As the line was out the door, I wished there was a menu made available for indecisive people like me.  Always good to have something for the customers to think about and to have their decision made prior to their turn

Ordered a single scoop of the Coconut Pudding in a waffle cone as the husband ordered a single scoop of the Thai Tea in a cup.  Both flavors were OUTSTANDING- true to the name of the flavor.  I have had my fair share of Thai Tea "ice cream" flavor ranging from Asian brands such as Polly Ann, but this takes the cake.  And Coconut Pudding, holy poopie- was it divine!  The texture of the "ice cream" was smooth to the pallet and both flavors packed a punch!  The waffle cone was though a tad on the sweeter side, which took away from the sweetness of the Coconut Pudding- something I will have to reconsider when ordering my "ice cream" next time.

So you might be asking, why is she quoting "ice cream" throughout her review.  Well, upon devouring that delicious "ice cream" (okay, stop with the quoting), I had to rave about this establishment.  After visiting the Yelp site and clicking to Garden Creamery's homepage, apparently I have been enjoying a Vegan sorbet- holy mother of Haiti!  I have ALWAYS been a firm believer of fat everything in my dessert, so to my surprise, to say that this might had been the best "ice cream" I have EVER had AND now knowing it is in reality a VEGAN SORBET, I think I just hit the floor.... HARD!  

I am looking forward to visit Garden Creamery when I am around the area- damn, why must you be SO far from me.
author: Jennifer K.

description: So far I've introduced 5 people to this place and all five of them really enjoyed their ice cream.  This place is a keeper.  Run by a family.  That chimney cone seeems to be too much and you get only one flavor.  I like getting 2 flavors in the single cone.  Love their Dandalion dark chocolate but they don't always have it.  That and black sesame are my favorites.  I've gone and waited 20 minutes in line.
author: Helen L.

description: This place is awesome because....they have MULTIPLE flavors of green tea ice cream! Yeah you heard me. It's a cute place and it's located in a great part of the Mission. Definitely check it out if you like ice cream, especially green tea flavors.
author: Janice T.

description: Awesome ice cream great taste love to go again and again i must say going next will feel me new taste of ice cream and so healthy yogurt as well
author: Shehzad A.

description: Ice cream with an Asian flare. Very unique flavors like Thai rice and coconut meat. I got the chocolate. Nice and creamy, reminded me of gelato in Italy. There was a line at 10:45pm, so be ready to stand in a line.
author: P S.

description: I love love loveee this place. They have these great Asian flavors like matcha gold(matcha with toffee), black sesame, hojicha, Japanese milk coffee, and then a bunch of other really great delicious rotating flavors . You're allowed to try as many flavors as you would like and the staff is extremely friendly. The only thing I wish they would change is to sell pints! I need more ice cream to take home. Overall I have to say this is one of my favorite ice cream shops!
author: Connie T.

description: Really good food, the Maracuya Sour was on point. I tried the queso empanadas and they weren't greasy :) it was our first time here and I highly recommend it.
author: Carol C.

description:
You know Garden Creamery serves top notch ice cream when you're lactose intolerant and still eat their dairy flavors. 

Tried most of the ice creams at Garden but I keep on going back to the mango sticky rice + haupia combo - it is out of this world!
author: Elie H.

description: Great flavors. Ranging from Guanabana to rose petal. Crazy right? So delicioso. I would go back here for sure as it's not that expensive either.
author: Lola M.

description:
If you're seeking for unique ice cream flavors, Garden Creamery has them, some of which I recognize, but in other forms (i.e. milk tea, pudding, etc.).  I had the genmaicha and haupia macadamia; the macadamia nuts in the haupia compliments well and provides a nice nutty texture.  The genmaicha flavor is light, yet you can still taste the rice tea.  On Saturdays, you can order ice cream in a chimney cone (a cone made of chimney cake).  

Yay, another creamery to add to my list of ice cream shops!
author: Jessica S.

description: This place is incredible. But be warned, once you go -you can't unsee what you have seen. The deliciousness will simply penetrate all of your pleasure pathways and your neurons will simply be beyond your control! There's a wide variety of coconut milk? Or fruit vegan 'sorbetto' The Earl Grey is delicious and unique. Strawberry lychee was very refreshing. Some of their fresh mint and coffee flavors are out of this world... And everyone that works there is even nicer than the product.  In typical mission fashion it, there might be a lineup and I will admit that I have passed by because the line was too long. But I am always happy with my purchase here! Be sure to test the samples :) I've noticed the batches change from week to week sometimes their flavors r more sweet than others. Sweet sweet frozen goodness to drown out the noise of summer construction? Yes
author: Coco J.

description:
Came here for the first time recently, and was delighted by their offering of ice cream flavors! On the night I went, I tried (and later got 2 scoops) of the Earl Grey ice cream, and it was pleasantly delicious. I realized that it was actually a part of the "non-dairy" offerings, but I couldn't even tell the difference. The ice cream was creamy as I would expect!

The line may look a bit long, but it moves pretty quickly! Inside was a bit stuffy and hot though so I was happy that things were moving fast. I'd come back here again to try out some of their other interesting flavors next time.
author: Daniel H.

description:
This is delicious! They had several flavors of tea ice cream, including matcha, genmaicha, earl grey, and my favorite, hojicha. I always get hojicha with milk and sugar-- basically ice cream-- so I was very excited to see it in ice-cream form, and I was not disappointed. They also had several non tea flavors, including butter Mochi and sesame, which was dark purple/black just like sesame icecream in Japan, as well as more conventional flavors like mint and vanilla. 

The staff was very friendly and very helpful, and let me taste several flavors before making my decision. He was also knowledgeable about different types of green tea.
author: Ryan E.

description:
Tldr; Garden Creamery has awesome Asian/ Hawaiian flavors and delicious ice cream. A must must try. To avoid long lines, avoid Friday nights or Saturday 2- 4ish (unless you want to try their chimney cones).

I'm so happy Garden Creamery has come into my life (and I'm sad I didn't know about their products or ice cream truck earlier!). I love this place from the amazing, delicious flavors to the fantastic, sweet and kind owners. 

My first experience there involved my friends and me struggling to cut a cake that one of us had brought in. Donny noticed we were struggling and brought out a knife from the back, cups, and spoons. No questions asked. Him and Erin are so nice. Erin is always so enthusiastic and will bring a smile to your face when she greets or serves you or is switching out the ice cream.

Flavorwise, I was initially overwhelmed (in a good way) by the wonderful assortment. As many of the other reviews have commented on, they have awesome flavors. They consistently have threes of green tea (ceremonial/uji matcha (occasionally with toffee), genmaicha, and hojicha), pandan coconut, haupia macadamia nut, black sesame, mango sticky rice, Thai tea, Earl grey, and have several rotational flavors like sencha, banana liliko'i, strawberry lychee, mango li hung mui, strawberry ume (my favorite!), ube pandan coconut, and Hawaiian butter mochi, among others. Like I said, it's overwhelming. But the workers are all nice and have great recommendations and let you sample until you are set on what combination to get. You can get two flavors with a single and three flavors with a double. A single is a generous amount and good for most people. 

Additionally, there are also often tasty looking ice cream sandwiches and ice cream pops! Haven't tried one yet, but will do so soon! 

The atmosphere is lively and welcoming and they have nice backdrops for all your Instagram and Snapchat pics (of grave importance, I know :p). If you're in Dolores or exploring the Mission and want some ice cream, pass up Bi-Rite and definitely try out Garden! You won't be disappointed! And because there are so many great flavors, you'll just have to keep coming back! :D
author: Mario Z.

description:
Best ice cream in San Francisco, and maybe some of the best once cream I've ever had in my life. This place is just absolutely amazing

Pros: Fun, youthful atmosphere; really great staff who is super helpful, etc

Cons: Would be great to have a few more of the mint green chairs to fit more people around the table

I got the mango stick rice and coconut ice cream. I loved that the single is really like a double - you get a ton for $4.50

The black sesame ice cream is also exceptional. Definitely ask the staff for pairing recommendations if you're not sure

The ice cream is made on site and tastes exceptionally fresh. Go here today!!!! So good
author: Lilly D.

description:
The vegan ice cream is so smooth that even non-vegans love it. The store is little, but there are some bar chairs by the window. Add to your list of you are around Mission on a warm sunny day!
The customer service is great!
author: Katie K.

description:
My husband and I happened upon this place by accident - what a happy accident it was! We noticed a  long line and figured the ice cream must be good if people were willing to wait in this line. 

Unfortunately, the guy in front of us took the last churro cone (why don't they make more? It is my understanding they sell out fast every day!) so we split a salted caramel brownie sundae. 

It was FABULOUS and we have been so excited to tell our friends about this place!! It's much better than Bi-Rite in my opinion, and rivals Smitten. Absolutely worth a stop if you're in the mission!
author: Kayla S.

description:
What I ordered: Matcha Toffee Ice Cream w/ Churro Cone ($8.50): 7.5/10

There are long lines on Saturday afternoons since they serve churro cones from 2-4pm, however I came in at 5pm and happened to snatch the last churro cone haha. It was definitely overpriced for one modest scoop of ice cream + a mediocre churro (and I'm am one to usually be okay with spending a little extra on food if it is worth it) however, I don't think it's worth it. I was initially intrigued by their tea ice cream flavors such as Genmaicha and Hojicha but they didn't have it when I came so I settled with the matcha toffee which was good. All in all, I would be back again but would definitely skip the churro cone.
author: Emily L.

description:
My new fave ice cream shop in SF. Also huge bonus that it's near Mission Dolores Park which also happens to be my fave park in the city. The line wraps around the corner outside but it moves quickly.
The flavors remind me of Hawaii (Ube, haupia). They also have a good selection of non dairy ice cream (Thai tea was good). 
My fave was the matcha gold and black sesame which also happened to go great together. The Japanese coffee was also good.
The chimney cone was good but kind of pricey and not sure if it's worth it but glad I tried it.
author: Jules M.

description:
#chimneycone4life

The chimney cone is only available on Saturday.

They have a selection of Asianesque flavors to try but I tend to stick to the simple classic flavors.

Line can be non existent to 15 feet outside the door.
author: Evan W.

description:
Fairly new addition to San Francisco's Mission District. It was formerly a food truck. They offer fun and unique flavors such as thai tea, black sesame, coconut macadamia, coffee, mango sticky rice. They also offer vegan/non dairy options. Staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. They offer samples and assistance when deciding to choose flavors.

There are a few tables to enjoy your ice cream at. They offer some water with fruit in it at the front.

The sizing and portions are good for the price! They offer cups and cones. They do churro cones once a week! I'm waiting for the day I will be in SF on a Saturday to try it!

Definitely will be back!!
author: Kalani M.

description: Lines are long and it can be chaotic, but the ice cream is so, so good! The black sesame is the most glorious combo of sweet and savory. They also have plenty of normal flavours, and an impressive selection of dairy-free ones too!
author: Rachel R.

description: This place had a long line but I've been meaning to try it for some time now. The vegan flavors were amazing!!! Probably the best vegan ice cream I've had from a local shop. The nice middle aged lady was the cherry on top. Nowadays you don't see a lot of personable people working the crowds. She asked me where I went to dinner and how was it etc. She was in a very happy and cheery mood despite the long lines. I appreciated that bc I worked in customer service for a long time, so she was def in the zone. I understand why she was the last one in the line of employees, she was the finishing touch of an awesome experience.
author: Melissa P.

description: Ice creams were very good with a lot of Asian-inspired flavors. I had the hojicha and Thai iced tea flavors. Both very good. However, I went for the churro come, without knowing they only serve it at a specific time (Sat 2-4pm), so I was pretty sad I didn't get to try that.
author: Pamela P.

description:
Concept: 
Hawaiian, Japanese, Thai, and Polynesian flavors... ono, oh my, hell yeah.

Actual: 
Ice cream is melty and too sweet... waffle cone is sugary and stale.

Summary: 
Concept and flavors are creme de la creamery, substance has a little way to go.
author: Rachel R.

description: I LOVE garden creamery. Best waffle cones in SF, service is always so nice, and their flavors are SO exceptional. Definitely one of my favorites and best matcha ice cream I've ever had. I'm so excited to try their vegan flavors!
author: Arianna R.

description:
I am SO happy that they have a storefront now!

Easily the best ice cream in the Mission. They have at least 12 ice cream flavors and 6 sorbet flavors. All delicious.

I hate it when people ask to try 4 different flavors. Especially when there are 30 people behind them. But I understand that is my peeve! 

So yummy. A must try!
author: Kathleen D.

description: Great ice cream. Macapuno - yes! Peanut Butter - yum! Peppermint - yeah! It is very good, perfect consistency, not hard as a rock, not icy.
author: June W.

description:
Tl;dr - A variety of single-flavored Asian-driven ice creams with a creamy yet gummy/sticky texture. Different in its simplicity and Asian flavors, but nothing 'artisinal.'

You probably will find little crossover flavors with this place and Poly-Anns, which also does Asian flavors and Mitchells. This place has 3 different types of Matcha; Hojicha, Matcha, and Matcha w/ toffee chunks, so if you're a matcha fiend then this place is for you. I'd probably come back here for the Hojicha flavor to reminisce about the ice cream in Japan.

Flavor wise for the ice cream it's pretty simple and straightforward; you taste what you get with no complexity. I do not think their milk quality is as good as other ice cream places since you can't really taste the milk. Texturally the ice cream here is not to my liking. It's very soft and sticky and has a gummy texture that may have been stabilized with some gum extract for the texture? It's creamy but a different kind than Smitten; taste test them side by side and there is a difference in texture that's due to their churning process. 

Overall I'm ok that I tried it since I was in the neighborhood but I don't foresee myself recommending this place as an SF essential or going again.
author: Chad S.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! They have got to be one of the top ice cream places for me in SF right now. Their ice cream quality is always perfect and their crazy flavor combinations always blows me away! You can definitely tell they put a lot of thought in when crafting their ice cream! It does get busy on weekends so I would try to come weekdays or toward the end of the night to avoid the crowd! Definitely worth taking a trip here if you're craving some ice cream! 

Oh and if you're craving something different they have the chimney ice cream cone here where the cone is made out of churro.. CHURRO!!! It's definitely a little on the pricier side ($8) for a churro ice cream cone but it's definitely worth a try.
author: Kimberly D.

description:
I keep coming back here to try to find a flavor that I don't totally love, and they keep disappointing me :(

In all seriousness: the ice cream here is incredible. Really impressive variety of flavors (many of them Asian-influenced -- see the various versions of matcha, black sesame, mango sticky rice, among others), all of them just the right level of sweet. It's a good thing that they're closed a couple days of the week; otherwise, this would be very dangerous for my health.
author: Jason Y.

description:
ice cream is my jam
The ice cream is super creamy and delicious 
Everything was great. Loved the atmosphere
These are literally all the flavors i could ever dream about
author: James M.

description:
Please don't go here, the lines are already unbearable. Go to Bi-Rite and leave the better ice cream for locals like me.

But if you do go, ask to taste the weirdest flavor they have that day. You almost certainly won't regret it.
author: Elise L.

description:
Garden Creamery only offers their 'Chimney Cones' on Saturdays from 2-4pm. Unfortunately, I did not read the Tips section beforehand and was disappointed when I saw their menu board. I wasn't even really expecting to like the cone, I just wanted to try it once for the picture and review.

On the bright side, they do have some flavors that are more unique, such as Genmaicha and Coconut Pandan. I tasted (Ceremonial) Matcha, Earl Grey Sorbet, Black Sesame, and Saffron Rose before deciding on the Matcha and Black Sesame to share with my boyfriend. 

The Matcha was definitely my favorite. It had a good 'matcha' flavor that wasn't so strong that it was unpleasantly bitter or grassy. Two of our friends got it as well so I would consider it a group winner.

The ice cream was not as rich and creamy as other places, which made it a perfect dessert after a fuller meal. My boyfriend and I did, however, find a couple of ice crystals the size of coarse salt. But there weren't enough to affect the overall enjoyment of our scoops.
author: Cammie W.

description: I got hazelnut and cookies & cream which were both delicious. I still think ice cream should *always* be good (I mean, no one's eating it for the health benefits) and Garden Creamery  does not disappoint. The flavors are on point and there's a wide selection - next time, I want to try some of their vegan flavors and the chimney cone! There was a short line out the door when I came as the servers were taking their time with each customer (samples, etc). Worth the wait!
author: Connie Q.

description:
I was heading to try out the uber famous Bi-Rite Creamery. I happened to find this place on my way and boy !! it was probably the best ice-cream I`ve had in SF. No wonder the lines are so huge ( thankfully it wasnt as long as the one for B-Rite). The servers are really patient and allow you to sample as many flavors as you like. I got a single with 2 flavors : Matcha with Toasted Rice + Japanese Coffee. Calling this place amazing would be an understatement. 

I heard many people outside raving about the mango sticky rice ice-cream. Definitely need multiple visits to this place to try out their amazeball flavors.

NOTE: Their singles are pretty huge so keep this is mind while ordering.
author: Pranav B.

description: Wow!!! This place is soooo good! The owners are there 24/7 making small batches of delicious, organic, locally sourced ice cream. I'm dairy free so I got the coconut based cookies and cream/mint chip and it was to die for! Pls start one in South Lake Tahoe, CA.
author: Jessica H.

description: Delicious and really unique flavors. I wish they offered a smaller size because their single scoop is too big. Of course, I finish it, but always say to myself "ugh, never again." But I return because it's excellent ice cream.
author: N P.

description: They have vegan options :)) I was going to try the chimney cone but they didn't serve it, maybe there's a specific time when they serve it.
author: Rhea M.

description:
Creamy, luscious, and melts in your mouth. What every ice cream place should offer. Flavors are vibrant and so frikkin' good. The Mission has another ice cream winner!

What sets them apart is the old skool r&b jams playing in the background and plenty of seating. 

And the girl up front is so nice about giving samples!!! Gimme some Usher, J. Cole, and Haiwaiian Butter Mochi anytime.

$4.25 a single scoop includes 1-2 flavors.

I almost didn't leave. When I finished eating my cone, Nelly's Pimp Juice came on. You know I had to stay for that!
author: Michelle N.

description: While I enjoy ice cream, sorbet is my JAM and they have some of the best sorbets I've ever tasted. I have very selective tastes buds and even with the changing flavors I'm always able to find a sorbet that's Defrickinlicious! The Japanese milk coffee ice cream is also clutch for coffee ice cream lovers like myself. Also everyone who works here is super nice and helpful, it's always great to visit a business where people actually enjoy their job!
author: Shantel G.

description: They are amazing  thank you for having great tasting vegan options, keep up the good work!
author: Zahiry G.

description: The array of flavors offered are amazing and they all taste so good. The workers are also very friendly and they offer samples if you aren't sure what you want.I came here with a couple friends after eating dinner and I got a waffle cone with two scoops (I got the Matcha and mango sticky rice) for only $5. Only $5 for really high quality ice cream! :-)
author: Andy N.

description:
Chimney cone and pandan ice cream. What more do I need to say? Way better than smitten which is rather over-rates IMHO. 

Great local ice cream shop with fun classic flavors but unafraid to try new stuff too!
author: Aman H.

description: Great ice cream and they have some unique flavors! Line and wait can get super long on hot summer days though
author: Zareen C.

description: Don't go here, stay away. If you do go, don't get the haupia macadamia ice cream. It's TERRIBLE.
author: Crystal C.

description: Absolutely. The. Best. Ice. Cream. Local, organic, great flavors, wonderful owners and staff. Worth the wait! Erin kicks butt.
author: Gabriel B.

description: Matcha gold is my favorite flavor! The bits of toffee in it are AMAZING. Ube pandan was also really good- rich and creamy. You can choose up to two flavors for a single scoop.
author: Tiffany K.

description: I was so excited to come here. I found them on Instagram and I have been planning a trip to come to sf since a few months ago. I was so adamant on going to this place and I finally made it. Thank goodness I checked Instagram because I had no idea that they close on Monday's and tuesdays. The place was very nice and quaint. There is a nice sitting area and they have bathrooms. The customer service is phenomenal and they let me try literally almost every flavor! The ones I got were Thai tea, ube, and jade. These flavors went together really well. I also tried the saffron rose, mint, mango, earl grey, and some others I can't remember. What I noticed was that these flavors were so legit. They tasted exactly like what the were described as like the saffron rose really tasted exactly like saffron rose. And I think the icecream is made with coconut and not dairy. The consistency was thick and I think the coconut base allowed the flavors to really come forward. This place lived up to my expectations and beyond. I'm so glad I got to try this place out! As you can see I couldn't wait to try it before I took the pic. Can't wait to come back again!
author: Sarah E.

description: Love their Japanese tea/coffee flavors!! If you love tea any of their tea flavors will win you over!! My favorite is the Japanese milk coffee. If you're a coffee lover you must try!!! And the best part is in one single you can get two flavors. Genmaicha and Japanese coffee is my favorite pairing. The line fluctuates, we just beat the rush today around 9:45/10pm.
author: Kristin I.

description:
looking at my review from last month and really don't know why I didn't give it 5 stars because taht's what garden creamery deserves. unique flavors, not loaded with sugar and friendly staff. 

got to try the thai tea and saffron rose a couple of nights ago - delicious as always. Hojicha is till #1 though lol
author: Tao Tao W.

description: At this spot you can find a big selection of ice cream. Every time there is a big queue outside. I've never tried a vegan ice cream. It was my first experience. It was amazing. Not too sweet and very creamy. Recommended to visit this place.
author: Will J.

description: The flavors here are OFF. THE. HOOK. (do ppl say that anymore? I don't really care cuz these flavors are flat out amazing.) They're both creative and done very well. I tried the lychee black tea, hojicha (roasted tea), and matcha gold (matcha with toffee) and wanted to get all of them! Strong tea flavors. $4.50 for a single scoop but oh so worth it. Can't wait to come back and try all the flavors
author: Emily C.

description: Oh my chimney cone Saturday's! The island infused ice cream flavors were unspeakably delicious! If you are in San Francisco on a Saturday, you must stop by and wait in that line! It's worth the wait!
author: Ria P.

description: Sometimes you go to a place and, after a while, you start losing the excitement, right? Not here. Even if the vegan flavors are not so many and don't change so often, I always go there to grab my cone with 2 or 3 flavors when I'm in mission district! Thai tea is a big favorite...
author: Valentina G.

description:
I'm so happy Garden Creamy has come to the Mission area! Their ice cream is ON POINT--they're a small batch creamery using local ingredients. It's ridiculously creamy and they have not one but THREE different matcha flavors. There's genmaicha (matcha with toasted rice), hojicha (roasted matcha), and uji (vegan matcha flavor made with coconut base). They have some really unique flavors including vegan sorbets made with coconut base. I was torn when I was trying to choose my flavors. I went with a single scoop (two scoops of ice cream) of black sesame and hojicha. 

Can't wait to come back to try more flavors. They also have ice cream treats (popsicles) in addition to sundaes. They'll be offering their chimney cones again soon too; it's a hungarian cake with crunchy exterior and soft interior!
author: Katherine S.

description: I was asked if I wanted to sample the flavors but I immediately knew I wanted a scoop of cookies & cream and chocolate brownie. And it didn't disappoint.   & Cream tasted great but the chocolate brownie hit it on the head. Tasted exactly like brownies and even had chunks of brownies in it too! Waffle cone was an extra $5 and the guy behind the counter went to the back to grab it. Fresh and warm waffle cone. I don't think I've ever had that done at any ice cream place I went to. Good value and great customer service.
author: Gerard Y.

description: The ice cream at this place is simply amazing. My boyfriend and I waited in line on Saturday for their limited chimney cone from 2-4pm. We waited about 45 minutes to reach the front of the lines and they let you try as many flavors as you want. We tried about seven flavors before deciding to get the mango sticky rice and genmatcha with the cone. The price however is pricey for the chimney cone- $8.50 for one, but we got 2 which ended up being $17. I like how the chimney cone with the ice cream didn't end up being messy to eat. Overall, I would recommend coming here to try their ice cream and try their specialty cone at least once.
author: Tracy Y.

description:
Love that this hot and new ice cream shop just opened around the corner from my place!

The customer service is on point, the hours a great (they open till 10) and so far there aren't long lines like Birite but the flavors and just as original.

So far I've tried the Kona coffee and the Coconut pudding! Both are yummy!

I'll d finitely be back!
author: Jackie G.

description: I'm dairy free so this place gives me some choices beyond eating sorbet. It's a great spot to stop by, the non dairy is creamy and doesn't give you a hint of artificial flavors. I really love the texture of the ice cream, it makes me believe I'm not dumb for giving up dairy.
author: Deanna W.

description:
They have such rich flavors here. If you go try out their vanilla bean. 

I love to take my wife and kids here because the atmosphere is cozy and family friendly.

Personally the ice cream is a little bit on the pricey side for my liking but still I suggest this place
author: Jacob H.

description: Hands down my most favorite ice cream shop in the Mission District! Must come here for dessert if you're in the area. Favorite picks: mango, ube, and matcha. You can get all three as a "double scoop." You can totally taste the quality in the ice cream. Hands down my recommendation to come here! Heads up, parking is tough.
author: Joshua M.

description:
Amazing!

I love the explosion of fancy ice creameries in the city! What's distinctive about this place are interesting Asian-y flavors such as pandan-coconut and mango sticky rice and black sesame in addition to their more standard, and excellent other offerings. 

If you're in the area and want some great ice cream- drop by!
author: Terry N.

description: Well done. This ice cream is right up there with the BiRite I had a couple years ago. Completely amazing. I had Santa's Little Helper, a delicious take on mint chocolate chip. It had chocolate shavings, bits of candy cane, and what I think might be white chocolate covered pretzel pieces? Whatever those pieces were...it was heaven in my mouth. I also tried the non-dairy mango sticky rice. Ahhhh!! I was so bummed I tried it after I already got my scoop because it was that good! Everyone else I was with also loved their scoops and we all had different flavors. It was great for us because three people in our group did not eat dairy. There were 5 or 6 non-dairy flavors and they were definitely not lacking anything. Overall, if you're in SF, I recommend this place without a second thought!
author: Rozay F.

description:
Favorite ice cream spot in our neighborhood, real talk my girlfriend suggests we go here after every dinner. Everyone comes for the cones but the best part is the ice cream.

Best flavor: matcha gold

Also great: earl grey, black sesame, mango rice.
author: Nick C.

description: Yum...love all their ice creams! The chimney cones are a must if they are available. I inhaled the whole cone along with a scoop of black sesame and hojicha ice cream in no time...it was the best!
author: Pegs C.

description:
Yelp Review

I'm impressed by the variety of unique flavors. The texture is spot on--creamy, not icy. 

1. Staff Friendliness: 5
2. Staff Knowledge: 5
3. Staff Efficiency: 5
4. Transaction Time: 5
5. Order Wait Time: 5
6. Register Counter Cleanliness: 6
7. Kitchen / Prep Area Cleanliness: 5
8. Dining Area Cleanliness: 5
9. Restroom Cleanliness: N/A
10. Storefront Cleanliness: 5
11. Food Handling (i.e. clean hands): 5
12. Food/Drink Presentation (i.e. wrapping, boxing, pouring): 5
13. Food/Drink Preparation (i.e. made with care): 5
14. Food/Drink Value: (i.e. worth the price): 5
15. Food/Drink Taste: 5

(Total score) / (Questions Answered)  = (Yelp!)
author: Charlie A.

description:
Let me just start by saying I hardly ever review places. A lot of the time it's not worth it, to me, all the stupid sh*t I see, people thinking they're food critics and whatnot. But I go to Garden at least twice a week and it's finally time to give them the praise they deserve. 

This past week I tried a new flavor, Strawberry Ume(HOLY). The girl at the counter suggested it with Hojicha (my go to flavor) on a waffle cone. It was INCREDIBLE. The two paired so well together. Definitely my new fave. 

If you're looking for more of a Hawaiian flavor, which is what Garden owner, Erin is known for, the Butter Mochi will make your heart and tummy so happy! You can tell they put so much love into it, it has such an amazing mochi texture and the consistency is still so creamy!

Everything here is so on point. I never have a bad experience. The staff are friendly, flavors are always changing and I always leave with a belly full of the best ice cream in the mission. So happy Garden came out and brought some not so white washed flavors, if you know what I mean. ;)
author: Alexa A.

description:
Watch out, SF.
There's a new ice cream shop in town.

Garden Creamery is located in the fierce ice cream battleground known as the Mission district. My hunch is that it will soon become one of the top-contenders.

My girlfriend and I got to try a lot of different flavors but I settled on black sesame and mango sticky rice. The flavors were unique and delightful but not too sweet and the consistency was just right.

I think I may have a new favorite ice cream shop.

Go there now as soon you are able before this place blows up.
author: Samuel P.

description:
Make sure you come on a Saturday between 2-4PM so you get that churro cone. Mango Sticky Rice for the win!!!

I came here at 4PM on Saturday and had to wait maybe 15-20 mins in line, which wasn't that bad and they still had the churro cones around 4:30PM or so and let you order more than 1 if you got a sweet tooth like me.
author: Chris T.

description:
I haven't been able to find decent vegan ice cream for a long long time and I miss creamy ice cream!  I became allergic to milk 1 year ago (not a lactose issue).  I love super creamy ice creams!!
And this ice cream place is able to deliver that! Their vegan ice cream is made with coconut milk.  I had to look again to make sure that it was actually vegan because it was so creamy!  This ice cream's texture is unlike most vegan ice creams which can be super hard and grainy.  It is soft and velvety just like real ice cream made with milk.  
And the FLAVOR!! I had the Thai tea which is my most favorite it's spot on! (I haven't had Thai tea in a long as time because of the milk issue)
I love it! loveeeee it!!  I went there on a wednesday and then I had to come back the next day because I loved it sooooo much!!
I think their ice cream has spoiled me for the rest of the vegan ice creams out there.
author: Suzanne L.

description: I'm so happy for Erin that she finally opened up a Brick & Mortar! The new spot is so welcoming from the pink exterior to the minimalist interior (my kinda shop!). There's so many unique flavors and my favorite is the haupia macadamia nut! I know that there's so many different ice cream shops out there, but this has that homey feeling to it. It's in a residential area in the mission and parking isn't that bad.  From truck to shop, Erin is doing big things! Congrats!
author: Sheena C.

description:
Ah! I've been wanting to try out their icecream since they were an icecream truck, so when I found out they're now a brick and mortar shop, I had to go. 

I was hoping to try their chimney cones but they're only available Saturdays from 2-4pm. Anyways, I tried a bunch of flavors and ended up with a single scoop of magical matcha, which consisted of matcha icecream with lucky charms. The consistency was creamy, the lucky charms was interesting. 

Definitely coming back!
author: Jessica Z.

description:
This was such a gem of a place! I saw some photos of the chimney cones on instagram so I knew that I had to try it during my short trip in SF. 

I went around 3:00pm on Saturday and the line was almost out the door but it was moving quickly. Seeing so many local, Hawaiian flavors made my heart skip. Many flavors were quite unthinkable which made me so excited! I walked away with the hawaiian butter mochi, which yes, is just as good as it sounds. My bestie got thai tea and she was raving about it. Not to mention, the chimney cones were the perfect touch. 

The location is a little out of the way, but highly recommended regardless. Comparing this place to Bi-rite, I'd hands down pick Garden Creamery. I can't wait til I get to have another chimney cone :)
author: Nicole S.

description:
Definitely one of the best ice cream shops in SF!

The service here was amazing; kind, patient, and willing to give me as many samples as I needed! 

The ice cream itself was super delicious and creamy. The ube ice cream here was one of the best that I've ever had. And the flavors overall were creative, simple, and good. 

The ice cream was great. The service was great. The atmosphere was great. Overall, everything was great. Highly recommend this place. 

Only thing you may have trouble with is parking and lines. Parking is a ton easier a few blocks away and going at random times helps with lines. 

This place is also great because it stays open pretty late for late night cravings!
author: Michelle S.

description: We were exploring San Francisco when we come across this ice cream place. This tiny cute little place has all my favorite ice cream flavors. We tried black sesame, matcha toasted rice and ube pandan. They are all creamy and delicious. My goal next time is to try their non dairy selection.
author: Luanne T.

description: I first had this at the color factory then at the actual store. I decided to come here on a hot Wednesday night since i was early for class. I really wanted ice cream but I also needed it to be vegan since i was on a detox. Luckily i found this place and they had 6 different types! I really like the thai tea! Cant wait to go back to try the non vegan flavors.
author: Jan H.

description:
I'm so excited to have found a place in San Francisco that serves good black sesame ice cream!

I was quite indecisive, and very interested in most of their flavors, so I tried a lot! Eight in total, I think?! They were very gracious and generous with the samples. I liked them all! Including the vegan Lilikoi Cream, Thai Tea, and Coconut.

I also tried the Chimney cone, which is flavored like a cinnamon roll (though less sweet) and has a texture that's similar to a cinnamon roll. I got it on the side, as others suggested. Although I like the idea, I don't think I'd get it again.

The ambiance of this ice creamery is also quite nice. Clean, bright, with comfortable seating ( a few tables and a handful of bar seats along the window), and a clean bathroom :)

I'm a nerd, so I researched Garden Creamery and found that they started as a truck, and only served non-dairy (hence the "Garden" in their name). The founder is from Hawaii, hence the awesome unique flavors. I like what they're about. I'll be back!!!
author: Sharon W.

description: The stars are simply for the ice cream ! I tried probably six flavors and they were amazing -all good I got a double which is 2-3 scoops but  I'm so sad I missed out on the special cones they do Saturday afternoons ONLY from 2 to 4 -I wish I had known OK as far as environment, it was a little cramped and there was a line (of course)probably no real way to get around that un less they invest in the number system which is just a waste of paper...and there was a male version of Pippi Longstocking cashiering who was also playing DJ ‍and was actually driving me crazy with the music which was very annoying AND LOUD  ESP for a Sunday afternoon ‍I don't know if he was looking around trying to feel the crowd and What WE would like or just pleasing his own ears The poor girl trying to help me kept asking me to repeat what I was saying cuz she couldn't hear me -I don't know why she couldn't turn around and say to him "hey can you turn down  the music so I can hear the customers"‍‍ OK very long story short go there and see for yourself -I always do, I don't go on reviews -it's just one person's opinion
author: Soph C.

description: cute place located in the Mission! I am a self proclaimed ice cream fiend and always looking to try new places. I was looking forward to trying this place and I have mixed reviews. I really enjoyed their flavors, especially the thai tea and the spicy guava (both dairy free!) which I thought were really really good, however a lot of their other flavors I would classify as 'tropical' in which case I prefer Mitchell's for the creaminess, variety and price point.
author: Rachel N.

description:
* Amazing, unique selection of flavors that you will not find at local competitors
* Great vibes 
* Owners and employees are incredibly nice, seems like camaraderie flows 
* Location is impeccable
* Quantity of ice cream is great!

I wish that the prices were cheaper, I get the feeling that they upped it due to the popularity boost and change in weather, but I will continue to do my weekly trip to Garden Creamery :)
author: Paige S.

description:
Both the vegan and the dairy ice creams here are delicious!!  I don't even care
if I'm getting a vegan ice cream or a dairy ice cream, because they're both perfect. The black sesame ice cream is one of the best takes on the flavor I've had anywhere.

Plus everyone who works here is so super thrilled to share their amazing ice cream with you :D
author: Sasha W.

description: As good as it gets - their flavours are bright, fresh, and incredibly real. Instead muddled extracts, in the mint icecream you literally taste mint, coconut with coconut, black sesame with  black sesame, etc. Favourite flavour is Coconut Pandan, for its subtle grassy herbal sweetness.
author: Wiley W.

description: Black sesame and genmaicha are my favorite flavors. The smoothest ice cream I've had. Hands down superior to Bi Rite and Humphry Slocombe. Generous scoops. A "single" is 1-2 flavors for $4.50 pretax! This black sesame is smoother and nuttier than bi rite's. Location is walking distance to Dolores Park. The best in the Bay.
author: Alias A.

description:
Garden Creamery is by far my favorite treat!  It's hard for me to not order the Thai Tea ice cream every time, but there are so many other amazing flavors and treats to try too.  

Their waffle cones are a perfect crispy still warm treat and the chimney cones on Saturdays are heaven in your mouth! 

Great staff, great service, cool space and AMAZING treats.
author: Kim P.

description: Came with the family on a Saturday evening after dinner.  They have vegan a s non dairy. They have some unique flavors like haupia (coconut pudding) and banana salted caramel.  The Earl Grey is the best I've had.  Roasted matcha was amazing.  Definitely making this our we regular dessert place.
author: Becca D.

description: Garden Creamery is a nice, casual ice cream spot in the Mission--great for a dessert stop! Nearly half of their flavors are non-dairy, and this was some of the smoothest-tasting ice cream I've had! I opted for the single (they let you pick two flavors) with the black sesame and the non-dairy coconut--both of these were delicious, and very strong on the sesame and coconut flavors, respectively. I'd definitely love to come back to sample more of their selections!
author: David K.

description: Love at first sight... and taster. Had to taste (almost) all their favors first just cause they had so many different unique flavors you won't really find elsewhere, all at the same location. We did miss their churro cups that's only served on Saturday during 2-4p. But that's Ok, we'll just have to come back agn. Parking around their sucks, throw in the traffic uber/lyft causes makes it even worse especially on the weekends. I'd suggest parking a block or two away and just walk.
author: Flo F.

description: Lively, fun vibe. Friendly service. Interesting sorbet flavors. Thai Iced Tea and Mango were delicious. Guabanero good. Welcome to the neighborhood... you're helping this corridor of the Mission become the ice cream/gelato/sorbet/soft Mecca ;)
author: Anh D.

description: Must try the guava cream! A couple of friends and I tried a few flavors and all were so great!!! Hands down one of my favorite ice cream parlors in the Mission. Great lactose free options.
author: Rana K.

description: My god, I could eat that coconut macadamia nut ice cream every day for the rest of my life.  I'd be fat and diabetic, but it would be a small price to pay compared to the creaminess of that ice cream.  I loved sampling all the unique flavors, they had about 3 or 4 different tea flavors on the day I went and all were spectacular.  Line moves pretty quickly, the only thing slowing it down is everyone wanting to sample 10 different things before they decide.  I'm not a big fan of chimney cones, but just a note that they seem to sell out pretty quickly.  Definitely planning my next meal in the mission just so I can grab dessert here again!
author: Jessica L.

description: Yummy vegan options. Doesn't taste any different than the cream based desserts! The churro cones stop being served around 4:30pm.. just a heads up. There's a long wait for it, but it's San Fran...
author: Maritza T.

description:
I came here once for the frozen yogurt and then again for ice cream.
The vanilla is out of this world. My new spot for ice cream, friendly people too!
author: Liz W.

description: The chimney cone on definitely lives up to expectations and worth the $8-- share with a SO or friend and you won't regret it. The ice cream it self is also great.
author: Sheena P.

description:
Just yes.
I went here twice in one weekend. As in two days, back to back. No shame. I first stumbled across this gem with a group wandering from El Techo to Bi-Rite, and, boy did we pick the right street to walk down.
What first caught our attention was the line. Line = something amazing worth waiting for. On Saturdays from 2-4pm they serve Chimney cones - if churros and ice cream cones had a baby, it would be the chimney cone.  So naturally we had to try this highly instagramable novelty item. Highly messy so be sure to grab a gazillion napkins if you go this route. 
To be honest, Im glad I tried it but don't know if I would order it again, while it made a pretty picture it made me feel like I needed a major nap in the park afterwards as the dough was really heavy. The ice cream itself was amazing. Creamy and dense with everything a high quality ice cream should offer. I'm a fan of unusual flavors, and this one had a lot to chose from. The Earl Grey Coconut based [vegan] ice cream was amazing, along with the Matcha & Black Sesame. Yessssss....will definitely visit again.
author: Daniella O.

description: So many unique flavors. Fun flavors! Mango sticky rice. Black sesame. Roasted matcha!!
author: Christine K.

description: The KING'S TEA!!! GC is pretty awful at posting their flavors online but I just so happened to see their Instagram post Saturday about this new flavor and had to try it. I'm a huge oolong tea fan and their roasted oolong tea combined with ginseng is FIRE!!! It's like the best real milk tea you've ever had in your life. Also, when I went their whole family was working from the front scooping and the register to working in the back and bringing out ice cream. This place is a gem!
author: Katie C.

description:
Very creamy and I love creamy ice cream! Personally thought some of the flavors were a bit overwhelming. The ice cream here is thick and they have a bunch of different flavors that I don't find commonly elsewhere. 

I've tried the Banana Salted Caramel which was a bit on the sweeter side. I liked their Black Sesame a lot, it literally tasted just like Black Sesame. No waffle cones yet and also chimney cones are limited to saturdays for 2 hours only, lame ( hoping that changes soon so I can come back at better hours)
author: Alyssa M.

description:
Best Ice cream in the city 
Beats Humphrey Slocum, birite etc. Hidden gem no lines for now....
author: Petri Y.

description: I absolutely love their Genmaichi which is toasted rice and matcha. It has such a special flavour that it's undescribable. So aromatic and earthy. Genmaicha is now one of my favourite flavours all time..
author: Jenny D.

description:
my fav ice cream place!! thank you for finally existing!! 

flavors that you can't find elsewhere, perfect fat content, and not overly sweet (even the indulgent peanut butter brownie flavor!) 

I also like that it's tucked away on a quiet street corner far from all the craze. 

I highly recommend the matcha gold and black sesame. So so soooo good. 

( p.s. please start selling quart sizes to go!!!)
author: Nataly T.

description:
Good ice cream, good waffle cone, slowest most inefficient line/scooping ever.  Line at bi-rite is longer but moves much faster.

There is one stingy scooper - a woman who works there on Friday nights.  She was scooping way less than the other staff and I ended up with a single that barely made it above the waffle cone - avoid her at all costs.
author: Yin L.

description:
So good! I have literally tried every flavor here and they are all fantastic. My favorites are Cookies & Cream and Butterfinger, but I also love many of the Hawaiian/Asian flavors like Mango Sticky Rice, Macadamia Nut, Black Sesame, Coconut Pandan, & Thai Tea (vegan). 

I know everyone raves about the Donut Cones (2-4pm Saturday only), but for me it's all about the Brownie Sundae with one scoop Cookies & Cream and one scoop Vanilla or Coffee: the Platonic ideal of a sundae.

Erin & Donny (sp?) are incredibly nice. I'm constantly impressed with the blood, sweat & tears they pour into the shop (and their ice cream truck). They work their butts off making everything from scratch and rotating in tons of amazing flavors -- you could never get bored with such an incredible lineup of ice cream and sorbet flavors!
author: C M.

description: This place offered a refreshing refuge from the city heat on the day of our visit. The place has a cool (temperature and look) atmosphere to it as well as a variety of unique flavors. Having never had Earl Grey Ice Cream, I had to try it. It was just what I expected. I appreciated that they also offered milk-free ice creams.
author: Kevin A.

description: Definitely one of my top ice cream places. Flavors are fresh and high quality. Make sure to stop by here whenever you're in the Mission.
author: Elsie M.

description: Delicious islandesque flavors with some really delicious flavors individually that also make for great combos. Friendly and patient staff.
author: Janelle M.

description: Super friendly staff that lets u sample without pressure! Love their vegan selection. Every flavor was sooo good! My personal fav flavor is the earl grey :)
author: Andy L.

description: Great spot with loads of original flavors! Very friendly staff! And the flavors are super true.
author: Stephanie M.

description: So good!  I had the earl grey and coffee flavors in a single cup.  Both flavors were vegan made with coconut milk but did not taste overwhelmingly like coconut.  Can't wait to try other flavors here!
author: Helen T.

description:
I am so grateful that Garden Creamery is not within walking distance or I'd be here every day. I ended up here this Saturday at exactly the time they started serving the chimney cones (which, by the way, was a complete coincidence because I had no idea that they served chimney cones or that this place existed, to be honest). So if you don't have the same luck with ice cream places as I do, I recommend going here between 2-4 on Saturdays to get the chimney cones.

The variety of ice cream flavors (both vegan and non-vegan) made it nearly impossible not to be a tasting hog... but after sampling a handful of the options, I landed on cookies & cream in a chimney cone. It. Was. Amazing. 

I'll be back for seconds (thirds, and probably fourths) real soon. Looking forward to trying some of the vegan options!
author: Madeline K.

description: This might be one of my favorite ice cream spots in San Francisco. I love the creative and cultural flavors. I also love that everytime I go there they have new interesting flavors but keep some of their popular flavors out. Some of my favorites have been ceremonial matcha, hazelnut crunch, and Haupia. I also love that the staff is very friendly. I still have to try and get to garden creamery when they have the churro cones. Every time I am in the mission I always stop to get a scoop of ice cream! Love this place!
author: Nia R.

description: AMAZING ice cream! Been wanting to try it for weeks and finally went late night before close when the line was pretty short. The cookies and cream on a waffle cone was one of the best I've had! They also have great unique flavors - like the coconut macadamia nut we tried - also delicious! Will definitely be coming back more often.
author: Seema B.

description:
+ THE FOOD
THESE FLAVORS ARE ON POINT. Having seen so many pictures of their infamous soft cone, I knew I had to try this place. However, when I got there, I learned that they only sold the special cone for 2 hours on Saturdays. However, I saw all their interesting flavors and I knew I was already sold. As a tea person, I was pleasantly surprised by how many different tea flavors they had. I only tried a small variety but I loved everything and I wish I tried more. I ended up choosing a matcha gold (green tea + toffee) and hojicha (roasted matcha). I also tried their genmaicha (toasted rice tea) and black sesame, which were both really good. My boyfriend ended up choosing their black sesame, which is rich in flavor, and the ube pandan coconut, which was a little too sweet for his liking, but very unique indeed. I noticed they also had a bunch of other delicious flavors, such as strawberry lychee, earl gray, li hing mui and much more. Can't wait to come back to try the other flavors and with their chimney cone!
author: Cindy C.

description:
Update: The issue has been resolved and we will be back! Erin reached out to me before the day ended, promptly addressed the overcharge, and explained that the error came from their collaboration with Mochi Muffins. 

I appreciate Garden Creamery's honesty, transparency, and customer support. Moreover, their ice cream is pretty good and you can taste the high quality ingredients. (Get the black sesame!)


------
Not sure how I feel about $10 ice cream for a single scoop with mochi in a cup.

Either the kid sitting at the register over charged me or the price is jacked up. I even asked for a receipt and it wasn't even an itemized one that broke down the cost--it was just a confirmation that I paid $10.

I tried calling their number several times for clarification but they don't pick up.

There are better options in the city for ice cream.
author: Song Y.

description: The Hojicha (roasted green tea) is so good. I recommend it, especially to anyone who likes matcha and green tea flavors. The chimney cone is also worth trying. It's a different but quite fun way to enjoy your ice cream with. They have interesting ice cream flavors too.
author: Joy C.

description: Not my favorite ice cream joint in the city but I enjoy the vibe and friendly customer service.  They have a pretty good selections of flavors and they were tasty, but just not memorable to me.  I may just have peculiar taste in ice cream though because this is all my friends' new favorite ice cream shop so definitely worth checking out!
author: Thuan T.

description: Love this place for dairy-free ice cream. However, since they are clearly very popular with vegans, I think they should clarify that the dairy free chocolate is not vegan as it contains honey.
author: Lina L.

description: I heard great things about this place. We were in the vicinity and went to try it. They had 8 vegan options,  which I was so excited about!  I tried some of them and settled on 2 flavors.  They were delicious with a creamy texture. So good!
author: Ms. S.

description: Nothing over the top but then again I didn't go the few hours they actually have the chimney cones. They need to expand those hours to accommodate the demand. Some new flavors you don't usually see anywhere else. Must try the gen matcha!
author: Patrick M.

description: Thai tea and black sesame, still dreaming about this. Other places try to recreate it but they are the best! Lines are not as crazy as other SF ice creams.
author: Kimberly L.

description: I've been wanting to try Garden Creamery when they were a food truck. So glad that they have an actual location now! I came here on a Saturday night after dinner and surprisingly there was only a short line. I really like how they have many interesting ice cream flavors that other ice cream shops don't have! We shared two scoops of the Genmaicha and Coconut Pandan ice cream. Genmaicha (matcha and toasted rice) was light enough that you can still taste the toasted rice flavor. For those who don't know what pandan is, it's a plant used widely in cooking as a flavoring in Southeast Asia. We had chose this ice cream flavor because we loved pandan waffles (from vietnamese bakeries) and were very surprised to see it as an ice cream flavor. It had a light fragrant taste. Both ice cream flavors were creamy and refreshing. Perfect way to end the night! I want to be back to try their chimney cones, which unfortunately are only available on Saturdays from 2PM - 4PM. I hope one day they will expand those hours! Definitely will be back to try more of their ice cream flavors!
author: Philana C.

description: Best Cookies & Cream ever. Wow. Friendly staff. Line moves at a decent pace. Cute street corner.
author: Vicki L.

description: One of the best ice-cream in SF. Ube Pandan is a must-try. The choices here are endless.
author: Amnaj S.

description: I was so lucky enough to find this place as I was yelping dessert options to try while visiting San Fransisco.  The Ice cream was organic dairy and best flavors.  I can't wait to go back and try their other flavors!
author: Amy M.

description: Clearly well made, well executed, distinctive ice cream which many will just love. However, I wasn't personally a fan. I just didn't like the flavors or texture. It's also on the pricey side for what you get.
author: Michael S.

description: Unique flavors. Literally the only option I know of in SF with sugar free options and that's not Splenda crap. They use agave or coconut sugar. Very nice staff, they let you try as much as you want. There's always people inside. Even if you park far, worth a walk!
author: Shelby Nameless S.

description: I finally tried the ice cream at Garden Creamery since I am a self proclaimed ice cream expert having tried all the fantastic ice cream shops in San Francisco and in Oakland. I would give this place a 3 star plus. I know it is a matter of preference but I found the texture of the ice cream here a bit too heavy and creamy and lacking the fresh taste appeal of Bi-Rite, Humphry, & Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous. I had a hard time finishing my 3 scoops and trust me, this rarely happens anywhere else.
author: Michael C.

description:
Absolutely fabulous!  We were visiting the Mission area from Seattle and staying near Garden Creamery.  Even on a chilly wet evening Garden Creamery was a perfect place to visit.  The welcoming greeting and smile from the owner was so pleasant.  Very impressive selection of flavors (dairy and non-dairy), all of them are made in-house.  

I've visited the Bay area several times and I must say that this was truly the BEST ice cream that I've had during any visit.  I look forward to trying more flavors on my next visit:)
author: Walt W.

description: Dear god. Ordered the Japanese milk coffee ice cream, fresh mint chip, and banana salted caramel. All flavors were mind blowing; my girlfriend had to stop me from going back for seconds.
author: Brandon M.

description: Overpriced.It is just average , normal ice cream. The chimney cone is overpriced and expensive. I wish it tasted good..
author: Érica T.

description: The Thai Tea tastes exactly like a Thai Iced Tea drink.  If I walk by and the line is at the tree on Lexington or shorter, I'm getting one.
author: James O.

description: Love the flavors here. Good mix of original us flavors and Asian flavors. Can't quite give it 5 stars bacause it's still not better than Mitchell's
author: Michael M.

description: Forget Bi-rite. This is the best ice cream in SF! Their flavors are so creamy, a little edgy but not too crazy where they don't taste good. The line isn't too bad either! Everyone who works here is very kind and patient. Too bad they don't have more seating. But you NEED to try this place.
author: Asma w.

description: Best new find in the SF ice cream world! Garden Creamy offers a eclectic variety of Asian-inspired flavours such as genmaicha, hojicha, and ube! It's pretty awesome to try these not-so-typical flavours and they taste great! Highly recommend!
author: Angel G.

description:
Best ice cream place in SF. Their ice cream is always freshly made, their flavors are delicious and creative (love the mango sticky rice, chocolate, haupia, and many more), the service is great.

I only wish that the chimney cones were available more than 2 hours per week.
author: Lola L.

description: I've always said, "I'm a savory person, sweets isn't really my thing."  All that has changed! I'm so in love with Garden Creamery!! I've never been to an ice cream shop that has so many not just unique, but delicious flavors! A lot of people will tell you the chimney cone is where it's at but I prefer the waffle cones. Soooo bomb. Can't recommend this place enough!
author: Jeannie H.

description: Stopped by here and the ice cream there is JUST PERFECT. Great customer service, cool environment on a hot day.
author: Jay R.

description: I'm addicted to the mint chip. I live 50 feet away and can't get enough of this ice cream. They use organic milk in their base and fresh surprising ingredients such as lilikoi, oolong and Thai tea, saffron rose, black sesame. So delicious. If you like ice cream you must visit and taste!!!
author: Sandy G.

description: So many flavors to choose from! Look e the creamy texture and the waffle cones that are just out of the oven so fresh. Black sesame flavor is one of the unique flavors you can get add some caramel and banana and you have a masterpiece
author: Suna L.

description: Delicious! Love the coconut macadamia nut, and the matcha gold. I always get the waffle cone!
author: Carrie R.

description: It's pretty much impossible to find a single half-decent dairy free option at most ice cream shops. Not here! Tons of good vegan selections for every craving, and friendly staff that let you try until your find a winner.
author: Axel F.

description:
Great flavor selection and solid texture. I'm not very adventurous with ice cream flavors, but I tried my friend's ube and my mind was BLOWN. The flavor goes from 'hmm yeah this is kinda nice' to 'UBE FOR PRESIDENT 2020' pretty darn fast.

Also not sure how they managed to have vanilla ice cream so good I preferred it over one of my usuals (earl grey)... but that happened.
author: Jasmine W.

description: I had some dairy-free ice cream, and it was some of the best I've ever had! My friends loved their "regular" ice cream, too - "very creamy!" This rivals the better known ice cream shops in SF - would definitely go again!
author: Joey K.

description: I tried their ube pandan coconut which was delicious and very flavorful but too sweet.
author: Siri W.

description: This place has a great selection of non-dairy ice cream for vegans, lactose intolerant, etc. I had the coffee and thai tea flavors on a waffle cone. The ice cream was creamy, flavorful and rich, and the waffle cone was sweet and fresh. I would return for the selection and great quality.
author: Kathy M.

description: They have classics and original flavors, the cookie dough was so yummy! Also, the waffle cones are probably the best ever. Will definitely be back.
author: Claire M.

description: Loved their eclectic flavors: matcha green tea, black sesame, and thai tea. Service was quick and prices were reasonable. Loved the decor. It was clean and inviting. Well staffed as well. We were quickly serviced through the line and our scooper let us sample several flavors without agitation. We ordered the ice cream brownie (earl grey and green tea). It was scrumptious.
author: Leonardo O.

description:
I didn't think it was possible but I've found my new fav ice cream spot! Don't get me wrong, bi-rite is still one of my all time favs, but after eating it almost every other day, it was time to venture on to something new! And who could resist all the enticing flavors that garden creamery has to offer!? Hojicha Tea! That's the one that got my attention and got me into the store. Everyone has green tea and earl grey, but not everyone has hojicha and after our most recent trip to Japan, I feel in love with hojicha tea! Next up, mango sticky rice!!! Pretty tasty if you ask me! The only other flavor that I didn't order but sampled was Butter Mochi. Being a devoted mochi connoisseur, this didn't hit home for me the way I had hoped but still, A for effort. A few of the other flavors that caught my eye were Thai Tea, Earl Grey and Lilikoi! There's tons of other flavors as well, I just can't remember them all at the moment but I most definitely intend to try them all!!

Also if you happen to go on Saturdays between 2-4pm, they have their chimney cone!! What's a chimney cone you ask?? Just see for yourself in some of the photos! But if you're all about the gram, definitely worth making a special trip for.
author: Kristen C.

description: I was blown away by how good this ice cream is. All organic, half the selection is Vegan, they make all recipes by scratch. A lot of original flavors. The owners and workers are Amazing and sweet. Def my new favorite ice creamery!!!
author: Mutt M.

description: Delicious delicious ice cream and non-dairy sorbet. Great flavors. Best of all, no line! Great way to avoid the lines at BiRite and enjoy delicious organic ice cream!
author: Peter W.

description: Ice cream was delicious! I had the cookies and cream and hazelnut crunch. I was sad they didn't have the chimney cone (only available on Saturdays) but their waffle cones are really good.
author: Megan Y.

description: Their Hojicha and Taro ice cream are the best in town!! Too bad they sold out of the Matcha Gold (must try) on that day and Chimney cone is only available on Saturdays 2pm-4pm but I will be back!
author: D C.

description: This Ice-Cream parlor is beyond amazing!  They have a wide selection of delicious vegan ice-cream with wild names and flavors.  Thai Tea and Earl Grey is my favorite. It's so fun to come here.  Must try the Chimney cone!
author: Betty Y.

description: Garden Creamery is my favorite ice cream of all time. Now when I crave ice cream...I don't just crave any ice cream. I want their Haupia ice cream. It's this creamy macadamia nut pudding deliciousness that makes me want to eat it for breakfast brunch lunch dinner and dessert. But that's not all. They have great vegan options for my friends (and me too, they are YUM) - and the people that work there are great. Super friendly and do tasty partnerships with other neighborhood locals that I really enjoy.
author: Lola C.

description: Macadamia nut and genmaicha flavors were amazing. It was $4.25 for a single (two scoops) They have other great flavors like black sesame, mango, and mochi that I'd like to try later. Good service. Probably can seat about 15 -20 people.
author: Xteethx B.

description: New favorite! The nondairy ice cream flavors and texture are perfect. Hard to choose my favorite - coffee, thai tea, chocolate... :-)
author: C. R.

description: The wait was absolutely worth it. They allowed me to try as many as I asked for and she was extremely nice. The flavor I ended up with was Japanese milk coffee it is soooo good !!!!! I love it coming back soon
author: Kimberly P.

description: The ice cream is so good. You have to try the black sesame! Their pops are also refreshing and so tasty. They're frozen mousse dipped in chocolate. The owners, Erin and Donny, are such hard workers and are some of the nicest people and business owners. Be sure to check their shop and try all the flavors!
author: Frances L.

description: WOW! Totally impressed by how good the ice cream at Garden Creamery is. It was 54° and the line was out the door. I sampled several flavors before going with my all-time favorite,  "cookies & cream". I know, it's a basic flavor but the best I've ever had.
