Not so basic after all and by how busy it was, I'm not alone on this one. Highly recommend it!
author: Gonzalo B.

description: Mint choc chip vegan bomb!!! Dark choc vegan and coconut!  Even if your not vegan get the mint chocolate chip uses real mint leaves!
author: Wendy W.

description: Unique and delicious flavors, ice cream done to perfection. I very much enjoyed walking past the idiots waiting in the the line at bi rite a few blocks away while indulging in my 3 scoop garden creamery masterpiece!
author: Stephen B.

description: Came to this place around 2pm and there was a line out the door, but not to bad. This place has a lot of unique flavors, Me and my fiancé has the Hojicha & Japanese milk tea ice cream, I will come back to try different flavors the next time .
author: Melanie N.

description: Loved the gennaicha, hojicha, and Japanese milk coffee ice creams. Scoopers were nice and let us try a lot of flavors before deciding and kept the line moving quickly. Will definitely recommend and be back!
author: Yuwan L.

description: Hands down my absolute favorite ice cream joint in the city. I'm averaging 2 visits a week since they opened earlier this year and every time I'm in there, there's a new flavor Erin or Donnie has concocted: Haupia, Ceremonial Matcha, Thai Tea, Mango Sticky Rice, Hojicha, Guabenero and the ultimate ice cream sandwich made of a raspberry sorbet [don't quote me on it, it could be a sherbet], in between two marshmallow Fruity Pebbles patties, with half of the sandwich dipped in white chocolate. Chimney cones are a must but know they're only available on Saturdays from 2p-4p. Thank you Garden Creamery!
author: Linja L.

description: great service fresh flavors great price point thanks erin for your hospitality and x-rated playlist while eating and deciding what flavors to chose. definitely coming back saturday to try out the chimney cone.
author: Charles D.

description: Best ice-cream in SF no questions asked. I know what you're thinking about Humphrey's, Bi-Rite and Ice Cream Bar right now. But you are wrong. Just go in there and try it out. It also helps that the owner is incredibly hospitable, makes sure no one has any FOMO about picking flavors and is so passionate about what she is doing. Well done Garden Creamery! You do not disappoint.
author: Jess K.

description: Garden Creamery catered ice cream for my wedding. It was the perfect treat for my guests since it was a hot day towards the end of August. Erin was delightful to work with. She was happy to customize some flavors for our special day and even brought some other complementary flavors on the day of our wedding. Our guests raved about the ice cream. The flavors are so rich and the texture incredibly smooth. Their chocolate ice cream is still my favorite though. The salted caramel topping is so delicious as well! Garden is definitely one of my favorite ice cream places in San Francisco!
author: Amy Z.

description: This ice cream shop has, by far, the BEST black sesame ice cream! I love the wide variety of flavors. I come here once a week. They are also very generous with their sample portions.
author: Corie T.

description: Holy shmoly this is the real deal. For years now my favorite ice cream spot has been the Ice Cream Bar, but Garden Creamery is really amazing as well. Their flavor combinations are unique and delicious!
author: S O.

description: Loved the unique flavors, and the ice cream was so perfectly creamy! I especially enjoyed the black sesame :)
author: Annie F.

description: By far the BEST ice cream I've ever had!  And the churro cones are to die for! The Decor and color scheme is well put together. It makes you feel very welcome, at home, and happy. You can tell that this place was put together with love. The owners Erin and Donny are so amazing and you can tell that their staff is happy because the service is exemplary!! I want to go back to San Francisco just to come back here! Trust me when I say that the Garden Creamery is a must visit! Your welcome lol :)
author: Hokulea D.

description: Decided to stop by after my curiosity led me to looking this place up on Yelp, and I'm glad I did! Garden creamery is a great local ice cream shop with a ton of unique flavors. They have a lot of dairy-free flavors too! I got the black sesame and earl grey. So good!! I was sad that they didn't have hojicha on the day I was there, but I'll def be back.
author: Annie C.

description: Hipster to the max. But, the ice cream was delicious. Lots of vegan options for those that can't eat dairy.
author: Mark C.

description:
Yay!  The sweetest couple run this shop.

Excellent selection for all kinds of tastes from kids cookies and cream to several matcha varieties.  We love earl gray ice cream and we all loved saffron and rose.  

New location right on the corner of Lexington and 20th.  Bright red and retro inside.  This was steps away from our Airbnb and we stopped in several times during our visit to the Mission.  We happily carried this ice cream on our explorations.
author: Amy L.

description: Very distinctive tropical flavors at Garden Creamery. By distinctive,  I mean as you're making your way through eating the ice cream scoops in your cup, the different  flavors (black sesame, lychee, etc) still shine through.  With some ice cream,  after the first taste, the flavors start to blend together so you're not sure what flavor you're eating anymore. My favorite so far is the haupia  (coconut pudding) with macadamia nuts--very creamy, coconut goodness!
author: C C.

description: Organic super flavorful ice cream and better than bi-rite.....seriously.  Tons of unique tasty flavors.  The vibe is great in here, with happy helpful workers.  Easy 5 stars
author: Sean N.

description: Very nice space they got here! They have a lot of inside seating than most ice cream parlors in the area. They had a variety of really cool flavors like Hazelnut Crunch, Banana Lilikoi Passion, Pandan, Earl Grey, Thai Tea, Kona Coffee, and much more! I wanted to try those Chimney Cones but they are only made Saturdays 2-4pm. We tried the Hazelnut Crunchwhich was delicious! Also tried the ice cream sandwich which was fruity pebbles as the sandwich and either strawberry or raspberry inside. I ordered the strawberry but once I tasted it, it was actually raspberry. I didn't mind though because I actually really enjoyed it. It had the perfect amount of tartness to it. Their ice creams aren't too sweet and it's actually the only ice cream sandwich I've ever finished. I usually just like taking pictures of it and then it's too sweet that I never finish it. I definitely recommend this ice cream shop. Ill definitely be back to try more of their flavors, and I'm determined to try one of those chimney cones one of these days!
author: Sarina A.

description: Great non-dairy Earl Grey!! Couldn't even tell it was purely plant-based. Best vegan ice cream I've tastes yet. Good to see a variety of flavors, and hope they keep expanding on the vegan ones
author: Sas N.

description: Solid ice cream shop with unique flavors. Lots of Hawaiian and Asian influence. We had a coconut pandan flavor which was amazing. Also good mix of dairy and non-dairy (sorbets). Could improve the line traffic flow by adding another door near the back. Everyone walks in and out the same way creating traffic jams near the front. Great ice cream shop!
author: Michael C.

description: This is an AMAZING ice cream shop. Ran by Erin and Donny the perfect duo to think up and execute unique ice cream flavors. They have recently added the chimney cone which after going twice I still have forgotten to order because of my excitement and rush to get my ice cream. This is definitely my go to ice cream place and I am trying to get as much as I can before the lines start busting around the block.
author: andrew p.

description: Seriously my new favorite ice cream place in the city. I'm dairy sensitive so typically ice cream options are limited everywhere I go, but no anymore. They had seven dairy free options that were just as delicious and creamery as regular ice cream, including Thai ice tea, earl grey, fresh mint and dark chocolate. I hope they start selling by the pint because this is the best dairy free ice cream I've ever had.
author: Liz H.

description: Seriously it doesn't get any better than this.  Wow I thought I'd had good ice cream-now I'm ruined for life.  This is exactly why I'd really like to go on vacation to Fiji, (where hawaiians go for a beach vacation), but, I also don't want to forever more think all beaches are 'meh', cause I've now experienced beaches in FiJI!  Yum.  Great ice cream great customer service!  Try the Houpia Mac nut on a brownie, they call it a brownie sundae, guys, it ain't a sundae unless its got whipped cream. (Hoping you'll rethink not supplying whip cream.  Now I gotta find the truck.  ... thinking of putting my Tile in the truck so I can always find it.  A rabid fan.
author: M M.

description:
The vegan ice cream is amazing, I don't say that lightly. The texture is phenomenal, better than many conventional ice cream stores, creamier, and it is sweetened with agave. I went there today and they were closed, but the owner was so sweet he not only let me in, but when he heard I was visiting from Brazil he gave me a scoop of the Earl Grey - the other flavors were all too frozen to scoop - and I  didn't even like Earl Grey tea, I guess until today!!
He didn't even let me pay, great ice cream, great people
author: Estela S.

description: Best ice-cream ever!! Such unusual but great flavors, and they let you sample before you have to commit to a flavor.
author: Mimi D.

description:
I kept passing this place, wondering when it would open. I finally tried it last night and was really impressed. It was a rainy night, so I decided to go for more tropical flavors--banana liloki (passion fruit) and lemongrass coconut--both non-dairy. Delicious! And they let me taste many flavors before I made my selection. 

I'm looking forward to going back and trying more flavors. They have lots of interesting and unique flavors. And a bunch of vegan options that don't sacrifice flavor or texture for anyone avoiding dairy.
author: Casey P.

description: This was the best ice cream I've had in a while, and as this place is located in the mission there's steep competition! The small gets you two flavors and I had the banana salted caramel and the hazelnut, of which the banana was my favorite. It was creamy, not icy, and perfectly dense. Would definitely repeat.
author: Einat G.

description: Came here on a Friday night and it was packed. This place reminded me a lot of bi-rite creamery but they had non dairy choices as well. When it was finally our turn we asked the person helping us which flavor was their most popular flavor and he said everything which didn't help us much. I came here mainly to try the chimney cone but I was disappointed to find out it was only available during a certain time. The employee seemed to be rushing us to order so we ended up choosing japanese milk coffee flavor. Because of the service I will not be returning here.
author: Lorraine N.

description: One of my favorite ice cream stores ever! I got the matcha gold and Japanese milk coffee and both flavors were excellent. To be fair, I'm a green tea ice cream lover and avid bubble tea drinker so the flavors were right up my alley but they were done well -- very rich and bold. Tried the mint chip which tasted like fresh mint and was delicious as well. The line was just out the door when I was there around 8pm on a Sunday night but it was well worth the ~15 min wait. Staff was very friendly and helpful as well.
author: Will C.

description: They had eight dairy free options today! Eight!!! All delicious. Friends report that the other ice cream is terrific too. Super kind staff and attractive space. Definitely coming back.
author: Katie B.

description: Hands down one of the best places to get matcha gold ice cream. I'm very particular about the matcha ice cream I get. Usually, I find places either make it too sweet, or it just does not taste like matcha at all. I got the matcha gold and the japanese milk coffee. I wasn't able to try the chimney cones unfortunately, but I really enjoyed their waffle cone. I liked how their waffle cone wasn't as thick as most places make it, and it seems like their cone was coated with sugar so it was really pleasant to bite into. Although the line was out the door when we got there, the wait was not bad at all. We also got to try many different flavors. If you're into Asian ice cream flavors, this will definitely hit the spot for you. They have flavors such as Matcha Gold, Japanese Milk Coffee, Hojicha, Thai Ice Tea, Ube, Mango Sticky Rice, etc. Their ice cream is very creamy as well and I would definitely come back again!
author: Sandy Z.

description: I saw this place on my IG feed and decided to bookmark it for the next time I go to SF. Took us awhile to find parking but it's SF so I wasn't surprised. The line was out the door & down Lexington st. It moved pretty slow, we stood in line for about 30 minutes. Worth the wait? Yes and no. When we got to the door we could smell the cone that they sell. Forgot what it's called & I'm too lazy to go look for the name on other reviews. Anyways, none of flavors really stood out to me and they have a lot of flavors. My bf and I decided to go with the chocolate brownie with the special cone, $8.50 for the whole thing. The ice cream was good, i definitely enjoyed it. However I wasn't a fan of the cone. It smelled good but it didn't taste any different than the churro they sell at costco. And for just one scoop of ice cream? The ice cream was at the top so when we finished the ice cream we still had half of the cone left with no ice cream. My bf seem to enjoy it however he did say next time he would just get the regular cone. As for service, i get that it does get annoying when every customer is literally asking for samples & when someone want the special cone you gotta run into the back to get it but part of your job is to smile, make the customers feel welcomed and I did not get that feeling here. The workers seemed so annoyed and you can just tell that they would rather be anywhere but there. I will probably come back for the ice cream itself but when I do I hope I get a better experience.
author: Kristina N.

description: Super creamy texture and diverse range of flavors! I loved this place and will definitely be returning and telling all of my friends to come! I tried almost all the flavors (oops!) and loved the matcha toffee, ube, Japanese coffee, mango a cao, salted banana caramel, black sesame and non-dairy flavors: earl grey, lilokoi (tart and sour!), and Thai tea. The quality of the ice cream is amazing and I am looking forward to trying more flavors!
author: Leeni L.

description: That was by far one of the best ice creams and sorbets I've ever had!  The chimney cone is warm, chewy, crunchy and covered in an aromatic cinnamon sugar!  You can smell your way there!!  Too many interesting flavors to decide on so I got 4!  1) Japanese milk coffee was amazing!  Super smooth with a subtle flavor. 2) mango coconut just as smooth man my family would be able to devour a tub of this! 3) man ha green tea with burnt rice was soooo good. Same creaminess meets brûlée burnt rice crispier. So yum! 4) vegan strawberry lychee has a great smooth consistency too. No icy at all. And not too sweet. You could taste the fresh fruit and real color!  Mmmm so satisfying!  A must if you are hitting up the best SF creameries!  I'll be back fosh!
author: Marilyn K.

description: Being vegan, it's very hard to find a good ice cream place that has delicious ice cream but OMG this place was delicious and worth the long wait! Thank you for offering vegan options! Will be back whenever we visit SF!
author: Anonymous A.

description: Great place for a sweet treat! Was very satisfied with my dessert. Good place to take the family for a quick outing
author: Layla W.

description: it's good... unique flavors... but, can't say it's the best. it's all relative bc bi-rite is up there (always). still need to try that chimney cone!
author: mark s.

description: amazing ice cream. only downfall was that the churro cone is only available saturdays 2-4! :(
author: Ally L.

description: Gotta go on Saturday between 2-4 to get a chimney cone. Life changing. (My favorite is the banana salted caramel ice cream with the chimney cone)
author: Austin H.

description: I was excited to finally try this place yesterday -the staff was pleasant and they had at least 6 dairy (cruelty) free flavors like Thai tea and banana lilikoi--I may have to go there again right now.
author: Jill G.

description: I LOVE this place! Every time I'm in SF I make sure to make time to stop by Garden Creamery for a scoop (or 3) of delicious ice-cream. My go-to's are the Thai Iced Tea / Early Grey (both of which are vegan but you'd never know), the Macadamia Nut Custard, and the Black Sesame, but every time I go I try something else and have a hard time choosing. The staff is great, the space is bright and clean - the whole experience is an A+. Go check them out if you haven't already!
author: Sadie B.

description: I've been walking past the store for weeks now, wondering when it would open, and I was happy to find it open today! Erin is wonderfully cheerful and gives extremely generous samples of practically every flavor in the store. I had to tell her I had enough samples by the end because she kept offering and I was getting full! The flavors are delicate, clean, and Asian-inspired. I got matcha roasted rice and banana salted caramel, and both were excellent! I'm happy to welcome Garden Creamery to the neighborhood and look forward to going back!
author: E P.

description: This was such a disappointment! Very dull flavors, icy not flavorful. Even my 22 month old lost interest in his $5 scoop of ice cream before he even got to the cone!? Can I get a refund?!
author: Erica R.

description: I LOVE this ice cream shop. Great and interesting flavors. The owner and her staff and so sweet and have the best customer service.
author: Lisa R.

description: Great flavors and employees! The price wasn't bad at all, I can't wait to go on a weekend to get the funnel cone.
author: Luisa S.

description: Garden Creamery is the only place I will go to for ice cream! Their classics (vanilla bean, choc brownie, cookies n cream) are the best I've ever tried-so creamy and flavorful-especially the vanilla bean-which they tend to experiment and use various vanilla beans-BUT they also have the most amazing tropical-like flavors (the owner is from Hawaii!!) For anyone's first time definitely try the haupia (coco pudding w/ macadamia nuts), hawaiian butter mochi, or the banana loliki. Great price and they have pretty much anything you're in the mood for, whether that be chocolatey, fruity or just refreshingly sweet.
author: Isabel S.

description: Great creative flavors. Saffron Rose and Mexican vanilla on a cake cone was a great combo. Flavors can change daily. No lines at all around 8pm. Great service. Very friendly.
author: K L.

description: This place is great. The ice cream is delicious and the staff are wonderful, friendly and helpful. They let you try anything in the case to see if you like it. They also have great new flavors, most I have never seen or heard of. This place is cutting edge for sure. Very cute store, great location in the Mission. I'll make it a point to go back every time I visit SF!
author: Dave C.

description: We came here after dinner at Loló on a Wednesday night. It's a small place, but they have lots of flavors and were super friendly and generous with letting us try flavors and helping us decide which two flavors would go best together. We tried a bunch of flavors, but went with their Kona Gold with Cookies n' Cream. The kona coffee ice cream was fantastic-- I don't usually love coffee ice cream but I loved this scoop. Cookies n' cream, the flavor by which I judge all ice cream shops, was solid.
author: T K.

description: Very good and solid variety. Try different stuff. Saturday special! I've had some amazingly odd flavors at this place. Cereal and R-OH, yay!
author: Nick J.

description: Best ice cream I've had in SF! Hidden gem. Perfect way to cool down after a sunny day at Dolores. Pass on the Bi Rite -- this is even better.
author: Meaghan N.

description: Garden Creamery is my absolute favorite dessert truck of all times.  Then to find out that they were going to have a store front.  OMG!!! My heart skipped a beat and now my life is complete.  Not only is the ice cream delicious, the owners Erin and Donny are the best.  Great ice cream and owners, make a great business.  Thanks to them both I can now have Garden Creamery every day, week and month long.
author: Brenda T.

description: delicious creamy ice cream and the owners are super friendly!
author: Ivy L.
